original: @5a # // rgya gar skad du /üîΩsu partha de sha pa ri ka th'a /
analyzed: @5a # // rgya gar skad du / su partha de sha pa ri ka th'a /
translated: In Sanskrit:üîΩSuparip·πõcchƒÅparikathƒÅ

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: legs pa'i lam bstan pa'i gtam /
analyzed: legs pa'i lam bstan pa'i gtam /
translated: The Discourse Teaching the Good Path

original: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Three Jewels!

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the Bodhisattva MahƒÅsattva Ma√±ju≈õrƒ´ KumƒÅrabh≈´ta!

original: bdud ni mtha' yas sde dang bcas pa bstan pas 'bad pas 'bad pa med par rgyal mdzad la //
analyzed: bdud ni mtha' yas sde dang bcas pa bstan pas 'bad pas 'bad pa med par rgyal mdzad la //
translated: You, who through teaching effortlessly conquer MƒÅra and his limitless army,

original: rmad du byung ba'i gnas mchog brnyes nas drang sreng 'jig rten pa la brtson par mdzad //
analyzed: rmad du byung ba'i gnas mchog brnyes nas drang sreng 'jig rten pa la brtson par mdzad //
translated: Having attained the supreme wondrous state, strive for the welfare of the world.

original: gang phyir thugs rje chen po dang ldan mchog tu gzhan la phan par brtson pa'i mdzad pa can //
analyzed: gang phyir thugs rje chen po dang ldan mchog tu gzhan la phan par brtson pa'i mdzad pa can //
translated: Because of possessing great compassion, you are the foremost one who strives in benefiting others,

original: yon tan kun gyi gter du gyur pa sangs rgyas de la rtag tu phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: yon tan kun gyi gter du gyur pa sangs rgyas de la rtag tu phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I constantly pay homage to that Buddha, the treasure of all good qualities.

original: gang zhig rnyed na sdug pa dang bral las byung mya ngan rnams kyis nyon mongs med //
analyzed: gang zhig rnyed na sdug pa dang bral las byung mya ngan rnams kyis nyon mongs med //
translated: If one attains you, one is not afflicted by the sorrows arising from separation from what is dear.

original: mi sdug pa dang phrad las byung ba'i sdug bsngal rnyed sla 'byung bar 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang phrad las byung ba'i sdug bsngal rnyed sla 'byung bar 'gyur ma yin //
translated: The suffering that comes from contact with what is unpleasant is easy to find, but not so the suffering that comes from separation from what is pleasant.

original: 'chi dang na dang rga dang rgud pa'i sdug bsngal slar yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'chi dang na dang rga dang rgud pa'i sdug bsngal slar yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: The suffering of death, sickness, old age, and decline will not occur again.

original: sdug bsngal rnams ni mthar thug phung po lhag med lam bcas chos la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnams ni mthar thug phung po lhag med lam bcas chos la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to the Dharma, the ultimate collection of teachings, which is the path to the state of no remainder.

original: gang zhig dad sogs stobs kyis stobs chen bdud ni rnam par 'byer mdzad la //
analyzed: gang zhig dad sogs stobs kyis stobs chen bdud ni rnam par 'byer mdzad la //
translated: The one who, through the power of faith and so forth, scattered the powerful demon of the afflictions,

original: blo ni dge sbyong 'bras bu'i don gyi rgyan gyur 'jig rten 'das pa nyid du gyur //
analyzed: blo ni dge sbyong 'bras bu'i don gyi rgyan gyur 'jig rten 'das pa nyid du gyur //
translated: whose mind became the ornament of the meaning of the fruits of the spiritual practitioner, and became transcendent,

original: gang la sbyin na 'bras bu dpag med skye 'gyur thub pa'i slob ma dge 'dun ni //
analyzed: gang la sbyin na 'bras bu dpag med skye 'gyur thub pa'i slob ma dge 'dun ni //
translated: to whom, when given, produces immeasurable results, the disciple of the Sage, the Sa·πÖgha,

original: tshangs dang dbang po sogs kyis phyag byas blo sbyangs yon tan rgya mtsho de la 'dud //
analyzed: tshangs dang dbang po sogs kyis phyag byas blo sbyangs yon tan rgya mtsho de la 'dud //
translated: I bow to that ocean of qualities, whose mind is trained, and who is venerated by BrahmƒÅ, Indra, and so forth.

original: 'gro ba rnal 'byor spyod pa byams pa'i sems ldan 'dod pa'i don ni rdzogs phyir dang // dam chos gsal bya'i phyir dang chos ston skye bo rnams la brtse bar bya ba nyid dang ni //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnal 'byor spyod pa byams pa'i sems ldan 'dod pa'i don ni rdzogs phyir dang // dam chos gsal bya'i phyir dang chos ston skye bo rnams la brtse bar bya ba nyid dang ni //
translated: For the sake of fulfilling the wishes of beings who are yogis, who are endowed with loving thoughts,üîΩand for the sake of clarifying the holy Dharma, and for the sake of compassion for beings who are taught the Dharma,

original: dam pa rnams ni rab tu mgu bar bya dang bdag nyid kyis ni chos rnyed phyir //
analyzed: dam pa rnams ni rab tu mgu bar bya dang bdag nyid kyis ni chos rnyed phyir //
translated: and for the sake of delighting the holy ones, and for the sake of acquiring the Dharma for oneself,

original: legs pa'i gtam ni thub dbang gsungs dang sbyar te bdag gis bshad par bya //
analyzed: legs pa'i gtam ni thub dbang gsungs dang sbyar te bdag gis bshad par bya //
translated: I will explain the good advice in accordance with what the Lord of Sages has said.

original: bden la dga' zhing tshig re'ang nyams su len gyur rnams //
analyzed: bden la dga' zhing tshig re'ang nyams su len gyur rnams //
translated: Those who delight in the truth and practice even a single word,

original: rgyal ba'i legs bshad rab tu dga' bar gyur pa rnams //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i legs bshad rab tu dga' bar gyur pa rnams //
translated: those who are delighted by the good advice of the Victorious Ones,

original: nyid kyi sku yis bsdus nas nye bar bsags @5b pa ni ;
analyzed: nyid kyi sku yis bsdus nas nye bar bsags @5b pa ni ;
translated: those who have gathered and accumulated it in their own bodies,

original: / gang yin de dag dang pa'i yid kyis mnyan par bya ba'i rigs //
analyzed: / gang yin de dag dang pa'i yid kyis mnyan par bya ba'i rigs //
translated: they are worthy of being listened to with a delighted mind.

original: de la legs pa'i lam ni tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab yin te /
analyzed: de la legs pa'i lam ni tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab yin te /
translated: Therein, the good path is morality, concentration, and wisdom.

original: legs par gyur pa'i lam yin pas na legs pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: legs par gyur pa'i lam yin pas na legs pa'i lam mo //
translated: It is the good path because it is the path to what is good.

original: legs pa'i zhes bya ba ni mchog tu bsngags pa ste ;
analyzed: legs pa'i zhes bya ba ni mchog tu bsngags pa ste ;
translated: ‚ÄúExcellent‚Äù is praise of the highest kind.

original: de ni gcig tu phan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa'i gtsub shing las byung ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyi me gsum rab tu zhi bar byed pas mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gcig tu phan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa'i gtsub shing las byung ba'i sdug bsngal nyid kyi me gsum rab tu zhi bar byed pas mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: Since it is exclusively beneficial, it is nirvana, for it completely extinguishes the three fires of suffering that arise from the kindling of karma and affliction.

original: lam zhes bya ba ni des mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob par bya ba'i phyir 'dis tshol bas tshol bar byed pa'i don gyis na lam mo //
analyzed: lam zhes bya ba ni des mngon par 'dod pa'i don thob par bya ba'i phyir 'dis tshol bas tshol bar byed pa'i don gyis na lam mo //
translated: ‚ÄúPath‚Äù is so called because it is sought by those who seek to attain the goal that is its object.

original: de yang rtogs pa'i thabs kyi rim pa'i cho ga yin no //
analyzed: de yang rtogs pa'i thabs kyi rim pa'i cho ga yin no //
translated: It is also the ritual of the stages of the means of realization.

original: yang na nges par 'byung ba la phan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bsten par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: yang na nges par 'byung ba la phan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bsten par bya ba yin la /
translated: Or, it is to be relied upon because it is beneficial for the attainment of liberation.

original: de yang tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab yin pas na tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ni legs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab yin pas na tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab ni legs pa yin no //
translated: And since it is morality, concentration, and wisdom, morality, concentration, and wisdom are excellent.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Blessed One has said:

original: tshul khrims ting nge 'dzin 'byung ba la phan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bstan par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: tshul khrims ting nge 'dzin 'byung ba la phan pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bstan par bya ba yin la /
translated: It is taught because it is beneficial for the arising of morality and concentration.üîΩThe verse says,

original: chos rtogs phyir ni bsgoms pa yis //
analyzed: chos rtogs phyir ni bsgoms pa yis //
translated: Through meditation for the sake of realizing the Dharma,

original: byang chub mchog ni thob gyur nas //
analyzed: byang chub mchog ni thob gyur nas //
translated: having attained supreme enlightenment,

original: khyod ni nges par bcom gyur pa //
analyzed: khyod ni nges par bcom gyur pa //
translated: you will certainly conquer

original: sdig can gyis ni shes par gyis //üîΩzhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sdig can gyis ni shes par gyis // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the evil one, Mara, you should know this.

original: de la tshul khrims zhes bya ba 'di ni kha na ma thob nyid kyis bde ba nyams su myong ba dang ldan pas na tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de la tshul khrims zhes bya ba 'di ni kha na ma thob nyid kyis bde ba nyams su myong ba dang ldan pas na tshul khrims so //
translated: Here, morality is so called because it is endowed with the experience of pleasure due to the absence of remorse.

original: yang na 'dis 'gyod pa med pa'i bde ba bsten cing yon tan gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i bsngags pa len pa'i phyir tshul khrims de la ni len pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'dis 'gyod pa med pa'i bde ba bsten cing yon tan gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa'i bsngags pa len pa'i phyir tshul khrims de la ni len pa'o //
translated: Or, it is morality because it is the taking up of the absence of remorse, the taking up of the praise that passes from one to another of a series of virtuous persons.

original: yang na tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin la skad kyi byings las tshul khrims su 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin la skad kyi byings las tshul khrims su 'gyur te /
translated: Or, morality is derived from the verbal root ≈õi, meaning to bind, because it binds body and speech.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yang dag par sdom pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yang dag par sdom pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It has the meaning of binding body, speech, and mind.

original: de yang bram ze lus kyis legs par spyad pa rnam pa gsum gyis chos la sbyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang bram ze lus kyis legs par spyad pa rnam pa gsum gyis chos la sbyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: The brahmin, by means of the three kinds of good bodily conduct, practices the Dharma.

original: ngag gis ni bzhi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ngag gis ni bzhi'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: By means of the four kinds of good verbal conduct, and so on, as stated.

original: yang na bsil bar gyur pas tshul khrims te /
analyzed: yang na bsil bar gyur pas tshul khrims te /
translated: Or else, morality is coolness,

original: de yang 'chi ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi sems kyi gdung ba rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: de yang 'chi ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi sems kyi gdung ba rab tu zhi bar byed pa'i don gyis so //
translated: because it pacifies the burning of the mind until the end of death.

original: de yang / tsan dan shing gis gdungs pa sel min gyi //üîΩtsan @6a * //üîΩngan sa mchog gis byugs phreng bas min //
analyzed: de yang / tsan dan shing gis gdungs pa sel min gyi // tsan @6a * // ngan sa mchog gis byugs phreng bas min //
translated: The sandalwood tree does not remove the burning of the sandalwood tree.üîΩThe supreme sandalwood unguent does not remove the burning of the supreme sandalwood unguent.

original: chu yi legs byas sprin dang rlung gis min //
analyzed: chu yi legs byas sprin dang rlung gis min //
translated: The good deeds of water do not remove the burning of water.

original: ku mru ta rgyas rma med rdzing bus min //üîΩpadmo autpal sna tshogs kyis khyab pa //
analyzed: ku mru ta rgyas rma med rdzing bus min // padmo autpal sna tshogs kyis khyab pa //
translated: The pond with its unblemished blooming kumuta flowers does not remove the burning of the pond.üîΩThe lake covered with various lotuses and utpala flowers does not remove the burning of the lake.

original: spos chus khyab pa'i nor bu'i sa 'am ni //
analyzed: spos chus khyab pa'i nor bu'i sa 'am ni //
translated: The ground of jewels pervaded by fragrant water does not remove the burning of the ground of jewels.

original: sdug pa'i lag pa'i rtse mos 'dren pa'am//
analyzed: sdug pa'i lag pa'i rtse mos 'dren pa'am//
translated: The drawing forth by the tips of beautiful hands does not remove the burning of the drawing forth.

original: me tog phreng ba thig phan 'jigs pa yis //
analyzed: me tog phreng ba thig phan 'jigs pa yis //
translated: The garland of flowers, the necklace, the earrings, the bracelets, the anklets, the armlets, the rings, the girdles, the mirrors, the fans, the parasols, the banners, the streamers, the music of flutes, lutes, and drums, the singing of kinnara maidens, the various kinds of dancing, the various kinds of perfumes, the various kinds of incenses, the various kinds of garlands, the various kinds of ointments, the various kinds of powders, the various kinds of clothes, the various kinds of jewels, the various kinds of food and drink, the various kinds of enjoyments, the various kinds of pleasures, the various kinds of vehicles, the various kinds of dwellings, the various kinds of lamps do not remove the burning of the various kinds of lamps.

original: srog mthar gyur pa 'byung ba'i dus su ni //
analyzed: srog mthar gyur pa 'byung ba'i dus su ni //
translated: At the time of death, when life is ending,

original: dus de'i me 'dra 'jigs pa'i gdungs mi sel //
analyzed: dus de'i me 'dra 'jigs pa'i gdungs mi sel //
translated: it does not remove the fear that is like the fire at the end of the cosmic age.

original: gang phyir tshul khrims dran na'ang sel byed de //
analyzed: gang phyir tshul khrims dran na'ang sel byed de //
translated: But when one remembers morality, it removes that fear,üîΩtherefore, it is the supreme satisfier.

original: de phyir da ni tshim byed rnams kyi mchog / yang na nyes par spyod pa'i mi shes pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de phyir da ni tshim byed rnams kyi mchog / yang na nyes par spyod pa'i mi shes pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Or else, because of the absence of the ignorance that is misconduct,

original: bde ba'i rnam par smin pa gnod pa med pa dang ldan pas na zhi ba yin pa'i phyir tshul khrims so //
analyzed: bde ba'i rnam par smin pa gnod pa med pa dang ldan pas na zhi ba yin pa'i phyir tshul khrims so //
translated: it is morality, because it is peaceful, since it possesses the happy ripening that is not harmful.üîΩOr else,

original: yang na // 'di ni mgo bor gyur pa na //
analyzed: yang na // 'di ni mgo bor gyur pa na //
translated: it is the head,

original: de'i phyir tshul khrims zhes bshad la //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul khrims zhes bshad la //
translated: therefore, it is called morality.

original: tshul khrims nyams pas 'chir 'gyur ba //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pas 'chir 'gyur ba //
translated: One who violates morality is as if dead,

original: dper na mgo bo bcad dang mtshungs //
analyzed: dper na mgo bo bcad dang mtshungs //
translated: like one whose head has been cut off.

original: de yang dge slong gang dag bslab pa btang nas nyam chung ston cing dman pa shas che bar 'dod pa'i gnas su lhung ba 'di 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la 'chi ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'i'o //
analyzed: de yang dge slong gang dag bslab pa btang nas nyam chung ston cing dman pa shas che bar 'dod pa'i gnas su lhung ba 'di 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba 'di la 'chi ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'i'o //
translated: And it is said that for those monks who give up the training, who are weak, and who fall into the state of desiring the inferior, this is called death in this spiritual system of the noble ones.

original: yang na bde 'gro ste /
analyzed: yang na bde 'gro ste /
translated: Or else, it is the path to happy rebirth.üîΩOr else, it is the path to liberation.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of the world.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of others.

original: thar pa dang / 'jig rten la phan par 'dod pa'i dam pa rnams kyis bsten par bya ba yin pas na tshul khrims zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thar pa dang / 'jig rten la phan par 'dod pa'i dam pa rnams kyis bsten par bya ba yin pas na tshul khrims zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.

original: yang na dge ba'i lus dang ngag gi las rnams ni tshul khrims zhes bya ste /üîΩde yang sangs rgyas gsungs pa'i lus dang ngag gi las bya ba dang bya ba ma yin ba rnams la de bzhin du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dge ba'i lus dang ngag gi las rnams ni tshul khrims zhes bya ste / de yang sangs rgyas gsungs pa'i lus dang ngag gi las bya ba dang bya ba ma yin ba rnams la de bzhin du 'jug pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.

original: yang na 'tshe ba med pa'i bsam ba las nges par 'byung ba'i lus dang ngag gi rang bzhin gyi legs par sbyod pa las byung ba dang / mi dge ba'i las kyi tshul las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ni tshul khrims /
analyzed: yang na 'tshe ba med pa'i bsam ba las nges par 'byung ba'i lus dang ngag gi rang bzhin gyi legs par sbyod pa las byung ba dang / mi dge ba'i las kyi tshul las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid ni tshul khrims /
translated: Or else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.

original: yang na lus dang ngag gis gzhan la phan ba dang 'tshe ba med pa rnam par 'phel ba ni tshul khrims yin no //
analyzed: yang na lus dang ngag gis gzhan la phan ba dang 'tshe ba med pa rnam par 'phel ba ni tshul khrims yin no //
translated: Or else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself and others.üîΩOr else, it is the path to the welfare of oneself

original: yang na yang dag pa'i lus dang ngag dang 'tsho ba yin la /
analyzed: yang na yang dag pa'i lus dang ngag dang 'tsho ba yin la /
translated: Or else, it is right action, right speech, and right livelihood.

original: de yang lus dang ngag gi nyes par sbyod pa las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de yang lus dang ngag gi nyes par sbyod pa las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: And that is defined as turning away from evil actions of body and speech.

original: 'gyod pa med pa la rab tu 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'gyod pa med pa la rab tu 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is the entry into the absence of regret.

original: de dbang po sdom pa'i gnas la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de dbang po sdom pa'i gnas la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the state of abiding in the restraint of the senses.

original: yang na de'i lus dang ngag gi sdom pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: yang na de'i lus dang ngag gi sdom pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Or else, it is defined as the restraint of body and speech.

original: sdom pa med pa la @6b nye bar gnas pa yin /
analyzed: sdom pa med pa la @6b nye bar gnas pa yin /
translated: It is the state of abiding in the absence of restraint.

original: de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni dge ba'i rtsa ba'i gnas la gnas pa yin no //
translated: It is the state of abiding in the basis of the roots of virtue.

original: yang na lus dang ngag gtsang ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid tshul khrims te /
analyzed: yang na lus dang ngag gtsang ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid tshul khrims te /
translated: Or else, morality is defined as the purity of body and speech.

original: zag pa med pa'i bde ba la nye bar 'jog pa yin la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bde ba la nye bar 'jog pa yin la /
translated: It is the state of abiding in undefiled bliss.

original: de ni dad pa dang ldan pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: de ni dad pa dang ldan pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: It is the state of abiding in faith.

original: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is of two kinds:

original: bcas pa'i tshul khrims dang / ma bcas pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i tshul khrims dang / ma bcas pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of restraint and the morality of acquiring virtue.

original: bcas pa'i tshul khrims ni mig dang rna bas bcas pa'i lus dang ngag gi dge ba'i las so //
analyzed: bcas pa'i tshul khrims ni mig dang rna bas bcas pa'i lus dang ngag gi dge ba'i las so //
translated: The morality of restraint is the virtuous actions of body and speech that are restrained by the eye and the ear.

original: ma bcas pa'i tshul khrims ni yid kyi shes par bya ba'i lus dang ngag sdom pa'o //
analyzed: ma bcas pa'i tshul khrims ni yid kyi shes par bya ba'i lus dang ngag sdom pa'o //
translated: Morality that is not restrained is the restraint of body and speech that is known by mental consciousness.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Again, it is twofold:

original: sbyor ba las byung ba dang ; sbyor ba las byung ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba dang ; sbyor ba las byung ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: that which arises from application and that which does not arise from application.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba ni gang lus dang ngag gi sbyor bas bsags pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba ni gang lus dang ngag gi sbyor bas bsags pa'o //
translated: That which arises from application is that which is accumulated by the application of body and speech.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba ma yin pa ni gang yid gzhan du gyur pa las kyang nye bar bsags pa'i grangs su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba ma yin pa ni gang yid gzhan du gyur pa las kyang nye bar bsags pa'i grangs su 'gro ba'o //
translated: That which does not arise from application is that which is accumulated even from a change of mind.

original: yang gnyis te /
analyzed: yang gnyis te /
translated: Again, it is twofold:

original: dam bcas pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / chos nyid kyis thob pa'o //üîΩrab tu byung ba dang dus mnyam du'am /
analyzed: dam bcas pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / chos nyid kyis thob pa'o // rab tu byung ba dang dus mnyam du'am /
translated: that which is preceded by a vow and that which is obtained by the nature of things.üîΩThat which is preceded by a vow is the morality of one who has gone forth at the same time,

original: khyim pa bslab pa len par khas len pa'am /
analyzed: khyim pa bslab pa len par khas len pa'am /
translated: or the householder who accepts the training,

original: nor gtong ba ste 'di ni sdom pa yang dag par len pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: nor gtong ba ste 'di ni sdom pa yang dag par len pa sngon du 'gro ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: or the one who gives wealth. This is the morality preceded by the correct acceptance of vows.

original: yang brgyad pa la sogs pas lam bskyed nas zag pa med pa thob pa de ni chos nyid kyis thob pa'o //
analyzed: yang brgyad pa la sogs pas lam bskyed nas zag pa med pa thob pa de ni chos nyid kyis thob pa'o //
translated: That which is obtained by the nature of things is that which is obtained without outflows by generating the path through the eighth stage and so on.

original: yang na 'jug pa dang ldog pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na 'jug pa dang ldog pa zhes bya ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Or else, it is twofold: engaging and disengaging.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su gnang ba'i lus dang ngag gis las la sbyod pa de ni 'jug pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rjes su gnang ba'i lus dang ngag gis las la sbyod pa de ni 'jug pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of engaging in the actions of body and speech that are approved by the Tathagata is the morality of engagement.

original: gang bkag pa de mi byed pa ni ldog pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang bkag pa de mi byed pa ni ldog pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of not doing what is prohibited is the morality of disengagement.

original: yang na spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / ma spangs pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: yang na spangs pa'i tshul khrims dang / ma spangs pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: Or else, it is the morality of abandonment and the morality of non-abandonment.

original: de la gang lus dang ngag gi nyes par spyod pa mi byed pa de ni spangs pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de la gang lus dang ngag gi nyes par spyod pa mi byed pa de ni spangs pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of abandonment is the non-performance of evil bodily and vocal actions.

original: lus dang ngag gis legs par spyod pa la rjes su 'jug pa ni ma spangs pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gis legs par spyod pa la rjes su 'jug pa ni ma spangs pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of non-abandonment is the engagement in good bodily and vocal actions.

original: yang dag pa dang / ma dag pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang dag pa dang / ma dag pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is twofold, according to whether it is pure or impure.

original: sred pa dang / lta ba ngan pa dang / nga rgyal dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / yongs su tshang ba ni dag pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: sred pa dang / lta ba ngan pa dang / nga rgyal dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rtog pa dang / ma 'dres pa dang / yongs su tshang ba ni dag pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality that is not mixed with craving, bad views, pride, false imagination, and that is complete is pure morality.

original: de las go bzlog pa ni ma dag pa'o //üîΩdag pa la gnyis yod pas @7a * //
analyzed: de las go bzlog pa ni ma dag pa'o // dag pa la gnyis yod pas @7a * //
translated: The opposite of that is impure.üîΩPurity is twofold:

original: rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of purity.

original: gang 'da' ba med par rnam par byang ba de ni ltung ba med pa'i rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang 'da' ba med par rnam par byang ba de ni ltung ba med pa'i rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The purity of morality that is free from downfalls is that which is free from the transgression of the precepts.

original: gang ltung ba slar bcos pas rnam par dag pa de ni ldang ba'i rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang ltung ba slar bcos pas rnam par dag pa de ni ldang ba'i rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The purity of morality that is restored from downfalls is that which is restored by confession of the downfalls.

original: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two other kinds of purity:

original: ltung ba med pas mchog tu gyur pa dang / rnam par dag pas mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba med pas mchog tu gyur pa dang / rnam par dag pas mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: purity that is supreme because of being free from downfalls, and purity that is supreme because of being completely pure.

original: gang rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa ni bsams bzhin du 'da' ba med pas de ni ltung ba med pa mchog tu gyur pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gang rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa ni bsams bzhin du 'da' ba med pas de ni ltung ba med pa mchog tu gyur pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality that is supreme because of being free from downfalls is that of the stream-enterers and so on, because they never intentionally transgress the precepts.

original: dgra bcom pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gang yin pa de ni rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dang / sangs rgyas dang / yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gang yin pa de ni rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality that is supreme because of being completely pure is that of the arhats, the Buddhas, and the Perfectly Awakened Ones.

original: yang na slob pa dang mi slob pa dang so so'i skye bo la brten pas tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na slob pa dang mi slob pa dang so so'i skye bo la brten pas tshul khrims rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Or else, morality is threefold, based on the three: the trainee, the non-trainee, and the ordinary man.

original: slob pa dang mi slob pa dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: slob pa dang mi slob pa dang / slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: The trainee, the non-trainee, and neither the trainee nor the non-trainee.

original: yang na sems kyi dbang las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang na sems kyi dbang las dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa nyid kyis rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Or else, morality is threefold, by reason of the mind, as wholesome, unwholesome, and non-defined.

original: mi mnyam par yongs su smin pa dang / ma smin par ro //
analyzed: mi mnyam par yongs su smin pa dang / ma smin par ro //
translated: It is unevenly matured, and not matured.

original: mi mnyam pa yongs su gyur pa ni gang gzhan la 'tshe ba'i phyir brten pa'o //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa yongs su gyur pa ni gang gzhan la 'tshe ba'i phyir brten pa'o //
translated: Unevenly matured is that which is based on the desire to harm others.

original: mnyam par yongs su gyur pa ni sdug pa dang dbang po dang yul nyams su myong ba'i don du gang la brten pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par yongs su gyur pa ni sdug pa dang dbang po dang yul nyams su myong ba'i don du gang la brten pa'o //
translated: Evenly matured is that which is based on the desire to experience what is agreeable, and the objects of the senses.

original: yongs su gyur pa ma yin ba'i don du gang la brten pa dang 'gyod pa med pa gang yin ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa ma yin ba'i don du gang la brten pa dang 'gyod pa med pa gang yin ba'o //
translated: Not matured is that which is based on the desire for the meaning of the unmatured, and that which is based on the desire for the absence of regret.

original: yang dman ba dang / 'bring dang / mchog ste rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang dman ba dang / 'bring dang / mchog ste rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold, inferior, middling, and superior.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa drag pos nyen pa dang cho ga mi shes pas gzi byin nyams pa ni dman pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa drag pos nyen pa dang cho ga mi shes pas gzi byin nyams pa ni dman pa'o //
translated: The inferior morality is that of one who is troubled by the violence of the secondary defilements and who, ignorant of the rules, is lacking in vigor.

original: nyon mongs pa srab pa dang chog shes dang pa ldan ba ni 'bring ngo //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa srab pa dang chog shes dang pa ldan ba ni 'bring ngo //
translated: The middling morality is that of one who is not troubled by the secondary defilements, but who is not satisfied with his morality.

original: nyon mongs pa med pas gsal la chog shes pas rab tu phye ba'i rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims ni mchog go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pas gsal la chog shes pas rab tu phye ba'i rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims ni mchog go //
translated: The superior morality is that of one who, being without defilements, is clear, and who, being satisfied with little, is pure in his morality.

original: yang dbang du bya ba rnam pa gsum gyis gsum ste /
analyzed: yang dbang du bya ba rnam pa gsum gyis gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, there are three moralities, according to three kinds of mastery:

original: 'jig rten gtso bo byed pa'i gang zag ni khrel yod ba can te /
analyzed: 'jig rten gtso bo byed pa'i gang zag ni khrel yod ba can te /
translated: The morality of the person who is a master in the world is that of one who has a sense of shame.

original: 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas nas sdig pa spong pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi dbang du byas nas sdig pa spong pa ste /
translated: He avoids evil by taking the world into account.

original: de ni 'jig rten pa'i dbang du byas pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa'i dbang du byas pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: This is the morality of one who is a master in the world.

original: chos la gus pa ni chos gtso bor byas nas sdig pa spong ba de ni chos kyi dbang du byas nas tshul khrims so //
analyzed: chos la gus pa ni chos gtso bor byas nas sdig pa spong ba de ni chos kyi dbang du byas nas tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of one who is a master of the Dharma is that of one who avoids evil by taking the Dharma as his master.

original: bdag gtso bor byas pa de ni bdag nyid ngo tsha bas bdag nyid rjes su srung zhing sdig pa spong ba de ni bdag @7b nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: bdag gtso bor byas pa de ni bdag nyid ngo tsha bas bdag nyid rjes su srung zhing sdig pa spong ba de ni bdag @7b nyid kyi dbang du byas pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality based on oneself is the morality of one who is ashamed of oneself, who protects oneself, and who abandons evil.

original: yang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa las kyang 'das pa ste rnam pa gsum yin la /
analyzed: yang 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa las kyang 'das pa ste rnam pa gsum yin la /
translated: Morality is threefold: mundane, supramundane, and beyond the supramundane.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ni 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams kyi ni 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: The morality of ordinary people is mundane.

original: 'phags pa'i lam dang 'bras bu la gnas pa rnams kyi ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam dang 'bras bu la gnas pa rnams kyi ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: The morality of those who abide in the noble path and its fruits is supramundane.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ni 'jig rten las 'das pa las kyang 'das pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ni 'jig rten las 'das pa las kyang 'das pa'o //
translated: The morality of the Blessed Buddhas is beyond the supramundane.

original: yang tshul khrims ni sred pa la gnas pa dang / lta ba la gnas pa dang / nga rgyal la gnas pa dang / gnas pa med pa ste rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang tshul khrims ni sred pa la gnas pa dang / lta ba la gnas pa dang / nga rgyal la gnas pa dang / gnas pa med pa ste rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Morality is fourfold: based on craving, based on views, based on pride, and based on the absence of a basis.

original: de la sred pa la ni srid pa dang longs spyod kyi don du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la sred pa la ni srid pa dang longs spyod kyi don du byed pa'o //
translated: Morality based on craving is the morality of one who acts for the sake of existence and enjoyment.

original: lta ba la gnas pa ni tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas bcom pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba la gnas pa ni tshul khrims dang / brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas bcom pa'o //
translated: The morality of one who is established in the view is destroyed by the overesteeming of morality and certain types of spiritual behavior.

original: nga rgyal la brten pa bdag la stod pa dang gzhan la smod pas bcom pa'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal la brten pa bdag la stod pa dang gzhan la smod pas bcom pa'o //
translated: The morality of one who is based on pride is destroyed by self-praise and disparagement of others.

original: gnas pa med pa ni gnas pa'i nyes pa las grol ba'i tshogs su gyur pa dang zag pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa med pa ni gnas pa'i nyes pa las grol ba'i tshogs su gyur pa dang zag pa med pa'o //
translated: The morality of one who is not established is destroyed by the fault of non-establishment.

original: yang tshul khrims ni nyams pa dang / gnas pa dang / khyad par dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha gnyis kyi ste rnam pa bzhi'o //üîΩmi mthun pa'i phyogs ma spangs pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa yang dag par mi bsten pa dang / skye bo tshul khrims 'chal ba dang 'grogs pa dang ; rtog pa ngan pa'i go skabs 'byed pa dang / shes bzhin du 'da' bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: yang tshul khrims ni nyams pa dang / gnas pa dang / khyad par dang / nges par 'byed pa'i cha gnyis kyi ste rnam pa bzhi'o // mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma spangs pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa yang dag par mi bsten pa dang / skye bo tshul khrims 'chal ba dang 'grogs pa dang ; rtog pa ngan pa'i go skabs 'byed pa dang / shes bzhin du 'da' bar byed pa dang /
translated: Morality is fourfold: degenerate, established, distinguished, and destined for penetration.

original: ltung ba 'chab pas tshul khrims las nyams pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung ba 'chab pas tshul khrims las nyams pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: One is destined for the degeneration of morality through not abandoning the resistances, not attending properly to those who possess morality, associating with the immoral, opening the door to evil inclinations, transgressing with full awareness, and concealing one‚Äôs downfalls.

original: tshul khrims la bag yod pa dang / bslab pa la mang du gces par byed pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon bar brtson pa ni tshul khrims gnas pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro //üîΩtshul khrims ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba rnams la bag yod pa dang / lhag mthong gi rim pa la shas cher brtson pa'i tshul khrims ni khyad par can gyi skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims la bag yod pa dang / bslab pa la mang du gces par byed pa dang / zhi gnas dang lhag mthong la mngon bar brtson pa ni tshul khrims gnas pa'i skal ba can du 'gyur ro // tshul khrims ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba rnams la bag yod pa dang / lhag mthong gi rim pa la shas cher brtson pa'i tshul khrims ni khyad par can gyi skal ba can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of one who is heedful in morality, who values the training highly, and who is intent on serenity and insight, is the morality of one who is fortunate in the basis.üîΩThe morality of one who is heedful in the duties of concentration and who is intent on the stages of insight is the morality of one who is fortunate in distinction.

original: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa dang ; shes rab la mngon par brtson pa'i tshul khrims ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i skal pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa dang ; shes rab la mngon par brtson pa'i tshul khrims ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha'i skal pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: The morality of one who is intent on the perfection of morality and concentration and on wisdom is the morality of one who is fortunate in the factors of enlightenment.

original: yang dge slong dang dge slong ma dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / khyim pa las bcas pa'i khyad par gyi rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong dang dge slong ma dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang / khyim pa las bcas pa'i khyad par gyi rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Moreover, there are four kinds of morality, distinguished according to the four kinds of persons: monks, nuns, probationers and laymen.

original: dge slong gi tshul khrims de ni so sor @8a * //
analyzed: dge slong gi tshul khrims de ni so sor @8a * //
translated: The morality of a monk is the morality of one who has taken up the rules of training.

original: thar pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: It is the vow of liberation.

original: dge slong ma'i tshul khrims ni dge slong ma'i so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i tshul khrims ni dge slong ma'i so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'o //
translated: The morality of a bhik·π£u·πáƒ´ is the vow of individual liberation for a bhik·π£u·πáƒ´.

original: dge sbyong gi dbang du byas pa'i sdom pa bslab pa'i gnas kyi sdom pa ni dgu ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi dbang du byas pa'i sdom pa bslab pa'i gnas kyi sdom pa ni dgu ste /
translated: The vow of training in the bases of training is ninefold, based on the ascetic.

original: bya rog skrod nus pa'i bslab pa'i gnas kyi sdom pa ni brgyad de /
analyzed: bya rog skrod nus pa'i bslab pa'i gnas kyi sdom pa ni brgyad de /
translated: The vow of the bases of training that is able to drive away crows is eightfold.

original: de dag ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: de dag ni bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: These are the moralities of one who is not fully ordained.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi la dang / gso sbyong gi zhag bslab pa'i gnas brgyad ni khyim pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi la dang / gso sbyong gi zhag bslab pa'i gnas brgyad ni khyim pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The eight bases of training for the purification fast are the morality of a layperson.

original: yang rang bzhin dang / chos nyid dang / sdom pa dang / spong ba zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: yang rang bzhin dang / chos nyid dang / sdom pa dang / spong ba zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: Again, there are four types: natural, of reality, vow, and abandonment.

original: byang gi sgra mi snyan rnams kyi ni rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims so //
analyzed: byang gi sgra mi snyan rnams kyi ni rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of the Uttarakuru people is natural morality.

original: srid pa tha ma pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yum gyi ni chos nyid kyi tshul khrims so //
analyzed: srid pa tha ma pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i yum gyi ni chos nyid kyi tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of reality is the morality of the mother of the bodhisattva in his final existence.

original: lus dang ngag gi sdom pa brtan zhing rnam par dag pa ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi sdom pa brtan zhing rnam par dag pa ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The morality of undertaking what is wholesome is the cause of the increase of the wholesome.üîΩThe morality of acting for the benefit of beings is the cause of the increase of the wholesome.üîΩThe morality of restraint is the antidote to the holding of morality and ritual as paramount.üîΩThe morality of undertaking what is wholesome is the cause of the increase of the wholesome.üîΩThe morality of acting for the benefit of beings is the cause of the increase of the wholesome.üîΩThe morality of restraint is the antidote to the holding of morality and ritual as paramount.üîΩThe morality of undertaking what is wholesome is the cause of the increase of the wholesome.üîΩThe morality of acting for the benefit of beings is the cause of the increase of the wholesome.üîΩThe morality of restraint is the antidote to the holding of morality and ritual as paramount.

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dang / nyon mongs pa 'grib par byed pa ni spong ba'i tshul khrims so //üîΩde ltar mang du'ang rnam dbye nus mod kyi //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dang / nyon mongs pa 'grib par byed pa ni spong ba'i tshul khrims so // de ltar mang du'ang rnam dbye nus mod kyi //
translated: The morality of undertaking what is wholesome is the cause of the increase of the wholesome.

original: shin tu rgyas pas skyo ba skyed par byed //üîΩde yi rnam dag thabs ni bshad bya ste //
analyzed: shin tu rgyas pas skyo ba skyed par byed // de yi rnam dag thabs ni bshad bya ste //
translated: The morality of acting for the benefit of beings is the cause of the increase of the wholesome.üîΩThe morality of restraint is the antidote to the holding of morality and ritual as paramount.üîΩThe morality of undertaking what is wholesome is the cause of the increase of the wholesome.üîΩThe morality of acting for the benefit of beings is the cause of the increase of the wholesome.üîΩThe morality of restraint is the antidote to the holding of morality and ritual as paramount.üîΩThe morality of undertaking what is wholesome is the cause of the increase of the wholesome.üîΩThe morality of acting for the benefit of beings is the cause of the increase of the wholesome.üîΩThe morality of restraint is the antidote to the holding of morality and ritual as paramount.üîΩThe morality of undertaking what is wholesome is the cause of the increase of the wholesome.üîΩThe morality of acting for the benefit of beings is the cause of the increase of the wholesome.üîΩThe morality of restraint is the antidote to the holding of morality and ritual as paramount.üîΩThe morality of undertaking what is wholesome is the cause of the increase of the wholesome.üîΩThe morality of acting for the benefit of beings is the cause of the increase of the wholesome.

original: mnyam par 'jog las tshul khrims rnam dag 'gyur //
analyzed: mnyam par 'jog las tshul khrims rnam dag 'gyur //
translated: The morality of restraint is the antidote to the holding

original: de la rnal 'byor gyi spyod pa yongs su sbyang bar bya ba dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i phyir 'dun pa drag po skyed pa dang / lus dang ngag gi las kyi mthas bsdus pa la yang 'tsho ba gzhan la rag las pas 'jug pa sbyang bar dka' ba las tha dad par gnas su zin na yang de rnam par sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir mchog tu 'bad pas sdom pa la brtson pa dang
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor gyi spyod pa yongs su sbyang bar bya ba dang / so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i phyir 'dun pa drag po skyed pa dang / lus dang ngag gi las kyi mthas bsdus pa la yang 'tsho ba gzhan la rag las pas 'jug pa sbyang bar dka' ba las tha dad par gnas su zin na yang de rnam par sbyang bar bya ba'i phyir mchog tu 'bad pas sdom pa la brtson pa dang
translated: The training in the yogic conduct, the intense aspiration for the vows of individual liberation, the effort in the vows through supreme exertion in order to purify the difficult conduct of engaging in the activities of body and speech that depend on others for livelihood,

original: / gso ba'i longs sbyod la yang bag yod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: / gso ba'i longs sbyod la yang bag yod par bya ba'o //
translated: and being heedful with regard to the enjoyments of sustenance.

original: de yang so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams te gnas so zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //üîΩde la so sor thar pa zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pas na so sor thar pa ste /
analyzed: de yang so sor thar pa'i sdom pas bsdams te gnas so zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o // de la so sor thar pa zhes bya ba ni so sor thar pas na so sor thar pa ste /
translated: Moreover, one should abide by the vows of individual liberation as stated.üîΩHere, individual liberation is liberation through individual liberation.

original: lam 'di ni so sor thar par 'gro bas so sor thar pa ste /
analyzed: lam 'di ni so sor thar par 'gro bas so sor thar pa ste /
translated: This path is individual liberation because it leads to individual liberation.

original: dper na grong khyer du 'gro ba'i lam la grong khyer gyi lam zhes bya ba dang 'dra'o //üîΩyang na sdig pa las so sor thar pas na so sor thar pa'am sdom pa zhes bya ba la slob par byed pas na dag cing grol bar byed pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: dper na grong khyer du 'gro ba'i lam la grong khyer gyi lam zhes bya ba dang 'dra'o // yang na sdig pa las so sor thar pas na so sor thar pa'am sdom pa zhes bya ba la slob par byed pas na dag cing grol bar byed pa yin pa'am /
translated: For example, the path to a city is called the ‚Äúpath of the city.‚Äù

original: bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa la lhag par mos pa mi @8b gtong bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa la lhag par mos pa mi @8b gtong bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or else, it is called pratimoksa, ‚Äúindividual liberation,‚Äù or samvara, ‚Äúmorality,‚Äù because one is liberated from evil, or because one trains in being liberated. It is called ‚Äúpurification‚Äù and ‚Äúliberation‚Äù because it causes purification and liberation.

original: yang na bsrung zhing thar par byed pa na bsrung thar ces bya ste /
analyzed: yang na bsrung zhing thar par byed pa na bsrung thar ces bya ste /
translated: Or else, it is called ‚Äúprotection‚Äù and ‚Äúliberation‚Äù because it protects and liberates,

original: nyes par sbyod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams dang / ngan 'gro rnams las srung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes par sbyod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa rnams dang / ngan 'gro rnams las srung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it protects from immorality, from the defilements, and from the unfortunate destinies.

original: ji skad du chos sbyod pa rnams ni chos kyis srung bar byed cing rim gyis thar par 'gyur ba yin zhes ji skad du bshad pa dang / dge slong dag tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni 'gyod pa dang ldan pa'i sems su mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji skad du chos sbyod pa rnams ni chos kyis srung bar byed cing rim gyis thar par 'gyur ba yin zhes ji skad du bshad pa dang / dge slong dag tshul khrims dang ldan pa ni 'gyod pa dang ldan pa'i sems su mi 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, those who possess ethical discipline do not have regretful minds.

original: gzhan yang dge slong dag 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge slong dag 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
translated: Monks, this is the nature of things:üîΩEthical discipline gradually generates the supreme fruit.‚Äù

original: tshul khrims 'di ni rim gyis 'bras bu mchog skyed par byed do zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir bsrung zhing thar pa zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'di ni rim gyis 'bras bu mchog skyed par byed do zhes gsungs pas de'i phyir bsrung zhing thar pa zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that one should protect ethical discipline and attain liberation.

original: yang na sdom pa med pas ltung ba'i ngang tshul can thar par byed pa 'di ni yang dag par zhugs par 'gyur ba ste nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las thar par byed pas na ltung ba las thar pa'o //
analyzed: yang na sdom pa med pas ltung ba'i ngang tshul can thar par byed pa 'di ni yang dag par zhugs par 'gyur ba ste nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las thar par byed pas na ltung ba las thar pa'o //
translated: Or, one who is not restrained and has a nature of downfalls attains liberation. This is correct because one attains liberation from the secondary mental afflictions.

original: yang na so so'i skye bo yin pas ltung ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ltung ba yin la /
analyzed: yang na so so'i skye bo yin pas ltung ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ltung ba yin la /
translated: Or, because one is an ordinary being, one has a nature of downfalls. Therefore, one has downfalls.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dag gis yongs su 'khor bar gyur cing shis pa ma yin pa'i ngan 'gro rnams su 'khyams pa sdug bsngal de las srung zhing thar par phyed pas na ltung ba las srung ba ste /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dag gis yongs su 'khor bar gyur cing shis pa ma yin pa'i ngan 'gro rnams su 'khyams pa sdug bsngal de las srung zhing thar par phyed pas na ltung ba las srung ba ste /
translated: It protects from downfalls, because it protects from and liberates from that suffering of cyclic existence due to karma and affliction, wandering in the unfortunate realms that are not happy.

original: sdug bsngal de las thar pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de las thar pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is the liberation from that suffering.

original: rgyu las 'bras bu btags pa yin te /üîΩde yang / 'jug ngogs bde ba'i chu klung bde //
analyzed: rgyu las 'bras bu btags pa yin te / de yang / 'jug ngogs bde ba'i chu klung bde //
translated: The result is designated as the cause.

original: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the statement, ‚ÄúA river with a pleasant ford is pleasant.‚Äù

original: yang ltung ba las legs par byed cing 'gro ba la mngon par brtson pa rnams rang la phan pa'i don byed do zhes pa'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yang ltung ba las legs par byed cing 'gro ba la mngon par brtson pa rnams rang la phan pa'i don byed do zhes pa'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Moreover, it is the excellent practice of those who strive to go to liberation.

original: yang dag par zhugs pa rnams thar par byed pas na ltung ba las thar pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa rnams thar par byed pas na ltung ba las thar pa'o //
translated: It is the liberation from downfalls, because it liberates those who are correctly engaged.

original: yang na thog mar gyur pa ste /
analyzed: yang na thog mar gyur pa ste /
translated: Or it is the first vehicle,

original: thar pa sgrub pa la dang por gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dang por theg pa'o //
analyzed: thar pa sgrub pa la dang por gyur pa yin pa'i phyir dang por theg pa'o //
translated: because it is the first in the practice of liberation.

original: de yang ltung ba'i tshogs rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de yang ltung ba'i tshogs rnam pa bdun te /
translated: Moreover, it is the collection of seven types of downfalls.

original: phas pham pa dang / dge 'dun gyi lhag ma dang / de gnyis ka'i nyes byas sbom po dang ; ltung byed dang / so sor bshags pa dang / bshags par bya ba dang / bsngom par bya ba'i nyes byas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phas pham pa dang / dge 'dun gyi lhag ma dang / de gnyis ka'i nyes byas sbom po dang ; ltung byed dang / so sor bshags pa dang / bshags par bya ba dang / bsngom par bya ba'i nyes byas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The four classes of downfalls are: the defeating offenses, the residual faults, the serious infractions, and the downfalls.

original: de la ltung ba 'dis phas pham par 'gyur bar spyod pas na phas pham pa'o //üîΩltung ba 'di byung bar gyur na mal stan dang kha zas la sogs pa @9a * //
analyzed: de la ltung ba 'dis phas pham par 'gyur bar spyod pas na phas pham pa'o // ltung ba 'di byung bar gyur na mal stan dang kha zas la sogs pa @9a * //
translated: The defeating offenses are so called because one engages in them with a defeating attitude.

original: dge 'dun rgan po dang bar ma dang gzhon nu'i rjes la lhag mar spyod pas na dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun rgan po dang bar ma dang gzhon nu'i rjes la lhag mar spyod pas na dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
translated: The residual faults are so called because when this downfall occurs, one is left with a residual fault in relation to the sa·πÖgha‚Äôs bedding, food, and so on.

original: bshags par bya ba'i nyes pa thams cad kyi nang nas 'di ches rags pas na nyes pa sbom po'o //
analyzed: bshags par bya ba'i nyes pa thams cad kyi nang nas 'di ches rags pas na nyes pa sbom po'o //
translated: The serious infractions are so called because they are the most serious of all the faults that must be confessed.

original: mang ba'i phyir dang rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i spang bar bya ba sna tshogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir spang ba la 'bad pas gnas pa yin pas ltung ba'o //
analyzed: mang ba'i phyir dang rang bzhin dang bcas pa'i spang bar bya ba sna tshogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir spang ba la 'bad pas gnas pa yin pas ltung ba'o //
translated: The downfalls are so called because they are downfalls that one must strive to avoid by means of the four opponent powers.

original: nges par bshags par bya ba yin pas so sor bshags par bya ba yin pa 'am /
analyzed: nges par bshags par bya ba yin pas so sor bshags par bya ba yin pa 'am /
translated: They are to be confessed individually because they are to be confessed with certainty.

original: so sor bshags par bya bar 'os pa yin pas so sor bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: so sor bshags par bya bar 'os pa yin pas so sor bshags par bya'o //
translated: They are to be individually confessed because they are to be individually confessed, or because they are worthy of individual confession.üîΩThey are offenses that are to be individually confessed because they are offenses that are to be individually confessed through confession.

original: bshags pas slar bcos par bya ba'i nyes byas yin pas bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: bshags pas slar bcos par bya ba'i nyes byas yin pas bshags par bya ba'i nyes byas so //
translated: They are offenses that are to be individually confessed because they are offenses that are to be individually confessed through confession.

original: slar de ltar mi bgyid do zhes yang dag par sdom par byed pas slar gso ba yin pas na bsdam par bya'o //
analyzed: slar de ltar mi bgyid do zhes yang dag par sdom par byed pas slar gso ba yin pas na bsdam par bya'o //
translated: They are to be restrained because they are to be restrained through the vow not to commit them again, by saying, ‚ÄúI will not do it again.‚Äù

original: 'di dag ni ltung ba'i tshogs bdun yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni ltung ba'i tshogs bdun yin no //
translated: These are the seven classes of downfalls.

original: de la sdom pas bsdams pa zhes bya ba ni 'di man chad shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de la sdom pas bsdams pa zhes bya ba ni 'di man chad shes par bya ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúrestrained by the restraint‚Äù should be understood as follows.

original: de la sdom pas bsngams pa ni bsngags par bya ba'i sdom pa sba bar bya ba'i cho gas yang dag par kun nas g-yogs shing sbas la bsrungs ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la sdom pas bsngams pa ni bsngags par bya ba'i sdom pa sba bar bya ba'i cho gas yang dag par kun nas g-yogs shing sbas la bsrungs ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Restraint means the restraint that is to be praised. It is a vow that is completely covered, concealed, and guarded by the rite of taking the vow.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas shing bzhes la dus ji lta ba bzhin du sdod pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas shing bzhes la dus ji lta ba bzhin du sdod pa'o //
translated: To abide means to remain, to endure, to stay for as long as one lives.

original: cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni cho ga bya ba dang sbyod yul du bya ba dag yin la /
analyzed: cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni cho ga bya ba dang sbyod yul du bya ba dag yin la /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúperfect in ritual and conduct‚Äù means that they are to be ritually performed and practiced.

original: phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni ldan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPerfect‚Äù means endowed with.

original: de la kun du spyod pas na chog ste rang gi gzhung lugs su spyod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la kun du spyod pas na chog ste rang gi gzhung lugs su spyod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúRitual‚Äù means that they are to be practiced, that is, practiced according to one‚Äôs own scriptural tradition.

original: yang na de la spyod pa yin pas na sbyod pa ste /
analyzed: yang na de la spyod pa yin pas na sbyod pa ste /
translated: Or, ‚Äúritual‚Äù means that they are practiced in that way.

original: de la rten cing rang gi phan pa thob par bya ba'i phyir de la spyod cing rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la rten cing rang gi phan pa thob par bya ba'i phyir de la spyod cing rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúPractice‚Äù means that they are to be practiced and realized in order to rely on them and obtain one‚Äôs own benefit.

original: de yang sbyod pa ngan pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dang / skye bo dam pa rnams kyis bsngags pa dang thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis bslabs shing goms par byas pa dang ; bslab pa 'dod pa'i rab tu zhi ba la blo byang ba rnams kyis ma smad pa spyod pa'i rim pa kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de yang sbyod pa ngan pa'i gnyen por gyur pa dang / skye bo dam pa rnams kyis bsngags pa dang thar pa 'dod pa rnams kyis bslabs shing goms par byas pa dang ; bslab pa 'dod pa'i rab tu zhi ba la blo byang ba rnams kyis ma smad pa spyod pa'i rim pa kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: Moreover, they are the antidote to bad conduct, praised by holy persons, to be learned and practiced by those who desire liberation, and not censured by those whose minds are purified by the peace of the desire to learn. They are the stages of conduct that are free of evil.

original: cho ga ma yin pa ni dge slong me tog thu ba dang / phreng rgyud mkhan byed pa dang / rna rgyan byed pa dang / de dag byas nas khyim pa la ster ba dang / bud @9b med rnams dang lhan cig / stan dang khri gcig la 'dug pa dang /
analyzed: cho ga ma yin pa ni dge slong me tog thu ba dang / phreng rgyud mkhan byed pa dang / rna rgyan byed pa dang / de dag byas nas khyim pa la ster ba dang / bud @9b med rnams dang lhan cig / stan dang khri gcig la 'dug pa dang /
translated: Non-ritual is: a monk carrying flowers, making garlands, making earrings, giving those to householders, sitting on the same seat and bed as women,

original: snod gcig tu za ba dang / de'i lus dang 'brel pa len pa dang / de'i steng du lhung ba dang / gar dang / glu dang / rol mo dang / sgeg pa dang / byug pa dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / gos dkar po dang /
analyzed: snod gcig tu za ba dang / de'i lus dang 'brel pa len pa dang / de'i steng du lhung ba dang / gar dang / glu dang / rol mo dang / sgeg pa dang / byug pa dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / gos dkar po dang /
translated: eating from the same vessel, taking what is connected to their body, falling on top of them, dancing, singing, music, flirting, anointing, perfume, garlands, white clothes,

original: kha tshar dang bcas pa'i gos 'chang ba dang / khyim pa'i bya ba la sogs pa 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: kha tshar dang bcas pa'i gos 'chang ba dang / khyim pa'i bya ba la sogs pa 'jug pa ste /
translated: wearing clothes with fringes, and engaging in the activities of householders.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa byed pa yin no //
translated: One should not do such things.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ki ta'i rim zhes bya ba'i 'dul ba las ji skad bshad pa lta bu'i /
analyzed: ki ta'i rim zhes bya ba'i 'dul ba las ji skad bshad pa lta bu'i /
translated: In the Vinaya called the Kitigarbha, it is explained:

original: gzhan dag gis bshad pa ni spyod pa ma yin ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis bshad pa ni spyod pa ma yin ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Others explain non-ritual as twofold:

original: lus dang / ngag gi'o //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag gi'o //
translated: It is physical and verbal.

original: de la lus kyi ni 'di na dge 'dun gyir gtogs pa yin na yang gnas brtan rnams dang / dge slong rnams la mang du bsnyen bkur mi byed pa dang / sdug pa dang gud pa dang bral ba'i sems dang ldan zhing rgyud dang ba ma yin bas zil gyis mnan pa dang /üîΩrgyud shin tu rtsub pa rnyed pa dang bkur stis dregs pas myos pa na dge slong rgan po rnams la 'dzer zhing 'gro ba dang 'dug pa de lta bu'i bya ba med kyang mdun du 'gro ba stan mtho ba la 'dug pa de dag mthong zhing nyen kor
analyzed: de la lus kyi ni 'di na dge 'dun gyir gtogs pa yin na yang gnas brtan rnams dang / dge slong rnams la mang du bsnyen bkur mi byed pa dang / sdug pa dang gud pa dang bral ba'i sems dang ldan zhing rgyud dang ba ma yin bas zil gyis mnan pa dang / rgyud shin tu rtsub pa rnyed pa dang bkur stis dregs pas myos pa na dge slong rgan po rnams la 'dzer zhing 'gro ba dang 'dug pa de lta bu'i bya ba med kyang mdun du 'gro ba stan mtho ba la 'dug pa de dag mthong zhing nyen kor
translated: Physical means that even though one is a member of the Sangha, one does not serve the elders and monks with respect, and one is not subdued by the mind that is free from attachment and aversion, and one's continuum is not clear.

original: du phyin na yang mdun bsu ba dang / stan nas ldang ba dang / phyag 'tshal bar mi byed /
analyzed: du phyin na yang mdun bsu ba dang / stan nas ldang ba dang / phyag 'tshal bar mi byed /
translated: Even though one does not engage in such actions as walking and sitting while scolding the elder monks, one sees them walking in front and sitting on high seats, and when one approaches them, one does not welcome them, rise from one's seat, or prostrate.

original: de dag mchil lham med par 'chag pa dang / bdag nyid mchil lham dang bcas par 'chag pa dang / de dag sa phyogs dma' ba na 'chag pa na yang bdag nyid mtho ba gding ba dang bcas par 'chag pa dang / stan gyis de dag la gnod par byed pa dang /
analyzed: de dag mchil lham med par 'chag pa dang / bdag nyid mchil lham dang bcas par 'chag pa dang / de dag sa phyogs dma' ba na 'chag pa na yang bdag nyid mtho ba gding ba dang bcas par 'chag pa dang / stan gyis de dag la gnod par byed pa dang /
translated: They walk without shoes while they themselves wear shoes, they walk on lower ground while they themselves walk on high places with cushions, they sit on seats that harm the elder monks,

original: gzhon rims dag la brnyas pa dang bcas pas gnas par byed pa dang / khrus byed pa'i tshe chu ngogs dag tu dge slong rgan rims dag la 'dzer zhing 'dzug pa dang / mdun du zhugs pa dang / 'dzer zhing khrus byed pa dang / 'dzer zhing 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: gzhon rims dag la brnyas pa dang bcas pas gnas par byed pa dang / khrus byed pa'i tshe chu ngogs dag tu dge slong rgan rims dag la 'dzer zhing 'dzug pa dang / mdun du zhugs pa dang / 'dzer zhing khrus byed pa dang / 'dzer zhing 'gro ba dang /
translated: they live with contempt for the young, they make the elder monks wait on the banks while they bathe, they go in front of them, they bathe while talking, they walk while talking,

original: sngon du 'byung ba dang / gzhan gyi khyim du 'jug pa na yang dge slong rgan rims la 'dzer zhing 'gro ba dang / de lta bu'i bya ba med du zin na yang de dag la brnyas thabs su sngon du 'gro ba dang / dben pa'i khyim dang gnas gang yin ba de dag tu gang na rigs kyi bud med dam bzhon nu ma brtags par 'jug par byed pa dang /üîΩkhye'u gzhon nu dag @10a * //
analyzed: sngon du 'byung ba dang / gzhan gyi khyim du 'jug pa na yang dge slong rgan rims la 'dzer zhing 'gro ba dang / de lta bu'i bya ba med du zin na yang de dag la brnyas thabs su sngon du 'gro ba dang / dben pa'i khyim dang gnas gang yin ba de dag tu gang na rigs kyi bud med dam bzhon nu ma brtags par 'jug par byed pa dang / khye'u gzhon nu dag @10a * //
translated: They enter the houses and places of solitude where there are women of the family or young girls without being examined.

original: la mgo bo nyug par byed pa ste /
analyzed: la mgo bo nyug par byed pa ste /
translated: They fondle the heads of young boys.

original: de lta bu dag ni lus kyi spyod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dag ni lus kyi spyod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Such actions are not physical behavior.

original: ngag gi ni 'di na la la zhig dge slong rgan rims la gus pa med pas de la ma dris par chos smra rtsom zhing lan 'debs par byed pa dang / so sor thar pa ston pa dang / de g-yeng ba mang po yod kyang ston pa dang /
analyzed: ngag gi ni 'di na la la zhig dge slong rgan rims la gus pa med pas de la ma dris par chos smra rtsom zhing lan 'debs par byed pa dang / so sor thar pa ston pa dang / de g-yeng ba mang po yod kyang ston pa dang /
translated: As for speech, here some, out of disrespect for the senior monks, speak of the Dharma without asking them, compose answers, teach the pratimoksha, and teach while they have many distractions.

original: gtam sna tshogs byed pa dang / gzhan gyi khyim du 'jug pa na rigs kyi bud med dang / rigs kyi gzhon nu ma dag gus pa med par 'di skad smra ste /
analyzed: gtam sna tshogs byed pa dang / gzhan gyi khyim du 'jug pa na rigs kyi bud med dang / rigs kyi gzhon nu ma dag gus pa med par 'di skad smra ste /
translated: When they enter the houses of others, they speak disrespectfully to the women and girls of the family:

original: mi che ge mo zhes bya ba rigs che ge mo zhes bya ba khyod la kho bo cag gis bzar rung ba bza' 'am /
analyzed: mi che ge mo zhes bya ba rigs che ge mo zhes bya ba khyod la kho bo cag gis bzar rung ba bza' 'am /
translated: ‚ÄúO you of such and such a family, we are not to eat the food that is fit for you to eat.

original: bca' bar bya ba khyed kyis deng ci zhig stobs par byed /üîΩci zhig za bar bya /
analyzed: bca' bar bya ba khyed kyis deng ci zhig stobs par byed / ci zhig za bar bya /
translated: What is it that you are eating today?

original: ci zhig btung bar bya /
analyzed: ci zhig btung bar bya /
translated: What is it that you are drinking?

original: khyod de ring ci zhig ster bar byed ces smra zhing /üîΩyongs su rgod par byed la sun 'byin par byed ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ni ngag gis spyod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: khyod de ring ci zhig ster bar byed ces smra zhing / yongs su rgod par byed la sun 'byin par byed ces bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ni ngag gis spyod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: What is it that you are giving today?‚ÄùüîΩThey are boastful and contemptuous.

original: mdor na tshul khrims 'chal pa dang 'brel pa'i spyod pa dang smra ba thams cad ni cho ga ma yin no //
analyzed: mdor na tshul khrims 'chal pa dang 'brel pa'i spyod pa dang smra ba thams cad ni cho ga ma yin no //
translated: In brief, all conduct and speech that is associated with immorality is not the proper conduct.

original: de ni gnyen por gyur pa'i spyod pa ni tshig yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gnyen por gyur pa'i spyod pa ni tshig yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The proper conduct should be understood as the opposite of that.

original: cho ga zhes bya ba dge slong rgan po dang / bar ma dang gsar bu rnams la gces shing gus pa mang du byed pa dang / byams pa'i lus dang / ngag gi las dang / rab tu zhi ba la dga' ba dang / gzhan dad par byed pa dang /
analyzed: cho ga zhes bya ba dge slong rgan po dang / bar ma dang gsar bu rnams la gces shing gus pa mang du byed pa dang / byams pa'i lus dang / ngag gi las dang / rab tu zhi ba la dga' ba dang / gzhan dad par byed pa dang /
translated: The term ‚Äúritual‚Äù refers to the many forms of respect and reverence shown to senior, middling, and junior monks, to the physical and verbal actions of love, to the delight in peace, to the faith generated in others,

original: ngo tsha dang khrel yod pas brgyan pa dang / gya gyu med pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti ma bcom pa dang / 'dul ba'i gzhung lugs rjes su 'jug pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin gyis yongs su zin pa dang /
analyzed: ngo tsha dang khrel yod pas brgyan pa dang / gya gyu med pa dang / rnyed pa dang bkur sti ma bcom pa dang / 'dul ba'i gzhung lugs rjes su 'jug pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin gyis yongs su zin pa dang /
translated: to the adornment of conscience and shame, to the absence of deceit, to the absence of being destroyed by gain and honor, to the practice of the scriptural tradition of the Vinaya, and to being sustained by mindfulness and introspection.

original: 'gro ba dang / log par lta ba dang / rnam par lta ba dang / snam sbyar dang / lhung bzed dang / chos gos legs par 'char ba dang / 'gro ba dang sdod pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba la sogs par ram /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / log par lta ba dang / rnam par lta ba dang / snam sbyar dang / lhung bzed dang / chos gos legs par 'char ba dang / 'gro ba dang sdod pa dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba la sogs par ram /
translated: It refers to the proper wearing of the patched robe, the begging bowl, and the Dharma robes, and to the proper performance of all activities such as walking, turning around, looking ahead or to the sides, lying down, sitting, standing, and so on.

original: thams cad du kun du spyod pa las bshad pa las gus par byed pa 'di ni cho ga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad du kun du spyod pa las bshad pa las gus par byed pa 'di ni cho ga zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúritual.‚Äù

original: yang spyod yul ni phyogs ba lang 'tsho ba yin pas na de la spyod yul zhes bya la /
analyzed: yang spyod yul ni phyogs ba lang 'tsho ba yin pas na de la spyod yul zhes bya la /
translated: Again, the term ‚Äúgrazing ground‚Äù is used because it is the domain of the cow.

original: 'dir ni ba lang gi spyod yul dang 'dra bas na spyod yul zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni ba lang gi spyod yul dang 'dra bas na spyod yul zhes bya ste /
translated: Here, it is called ‚Äúgrazing ground‚Äù because it is similar to the grazing ground of a cow.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows.

original: ba lang rnams mdog dang / nad med pa @10b dang ; bde ba dang / srog rnams la phan par 'gyur ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / sdig sbrul dang / gcan gzan gdug pa'i 'tshe ba med pa /
analyzed: ba lang rnams mdog dang / nad med pa @10b dang ; bde ba dang / srog rnams la phan par 'gyur ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / sdig sbrul dang / gcan gzan gdug pa'i 'tshe ba med pa /
translated: A cow‚Äôs grazing ground is endowed with perfect color, health, happiness, and life for the cows, and it is free of the harm of flies, bees, snakes, and wild beasts.

original: rtsva sngon po rnam pa sna tshogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / chu gtsang ba dang ldan pa dus ran pa dang / shing gi grib ma'i tshogs phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan ba ni ba lang gi spyod yul yin la de bzhin du dge slong tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: rtsva sngon po rnam pa sna tshogs pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / chu gtsang ba dang ldan pa dus ran pa dang / shing gi grib ma'i tshogs phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan ba ni ba lang gi spyod yul yin la de bzhin du dge slong tshul khrims dang /
translated: It is endowed with perfect green grass of various kinds, clean water, and the perfect shade of trees.

original: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab la sogs pa gang zhig nges par bsten na phan pa byed par 'gyur ba de ni spyod yul zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dad pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab la sogs pa gang zhig nges par bsten na phan pa byed par 'gyur ba de ni spyod yul zhes bya'o //
translated: The field of activity is that which is definitely to be relied upon, such as faith, effort, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom, etc., which will bring benefit.

original: yang spyod yul ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: yang spyod yul ma yin pa ni /
translated: Again, the field of activity is not

original: smad 'tshong dang / ma nid dang / gzhon nu ma chen po dang / yugs sa dang / kun du rgyu la sogs pa gnas pa'i sgrib pa'i 'os yod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa'i rgyal po dang / rgyal po'i blon po dang /
analyzed: smad 'tshong dang / ma nid dang / gzhon nu ma chen po dang / yugs sa dang / kun du rgyu la sogs pa gnas pa'i sgrib pa'i 'os yod pa dang / rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa'i rgyal po dang / rgyal po'i blon po dang /
translated: the abode of prostitutes, widows, old girls, widows, wandering ascetics, etc., which is suitable for obscuration, and is not conducive to the king, the king's ministers,

original: bram ze dang / khyim bdag dang / mu stegs byang sna tshogs dang / nyan thos lam dad pa'i khyim dang 'dres pa dang / dge sbyong dang dge sbyong gi 'jigs pa la phyogs pa dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam pa lngas rnam par gtses pa med pa /
analyzed: bram ze dang / khyim bdag dang / mu stegs byang sna tshogs dang / nyan thos lam dad pa'i khyim dang 'dres pa dang / dge sbyong dang dge sbyong gi 'jigs pa la phyogs pa dang / 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam pa lngas rnam par gtses pa med pa /
translated: Brahmins, householders, various non-Buddhist ascetics, those mixed with the families of Shravakas, those who are inclined towards the fear of ascetics and ascetics, those who are not tormented by the five sense objects,

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i bde ba dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen la brten pa'i bde ba dang ldan pa /
translated: those who have the happiness of relying on a spiritual friend,

original: bas mtha'i gnas mal dang ldan ba /
analyzed: bas mtha'i gnas mal dang ldan ba /
translated: They have secluded dwellings in remote areas.

original: de lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das kyi dge slong rnams kyis bde ba 'phel bar byed pa yin te /üîΩdge slong dag ji tsam na dgon pa dang / nags 'dab dang / bas mtha'i gnas mal la legs par spyod par gyur pa ni dge slong ngam /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bcom ldan 'das kyi dge slong rnams kyis bde ba 'phel bar byed pa yin te / dge slong dag ji tsam na dgon pa dang / nags 'dab dang / bas mtha'i gnas mal la legs par spyod par gyur pa ni dge slong ngam /
translated: Such are the bhagavan's monks who increase happiness.üîΩMonks, as long as you enjoy remote areas, forests and secluded dwellings, you will increase virtue and not decrease it, whether you are monks or

original: dge slong ma mngon par 'dod pa'i dge ba 'phel bar 'gyur gyi nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong ma mngon par 'dod pa'i dge ba 'phel bar 'gyur gyi nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: nuns who desire to be monks.üîΩHaving dwelt there, they think, ‚ÄúThe four establishments of mindfulness are the domain and object of my father.

original: der gnas nas kyang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni rang gi pha'i spyod yul dang / yul yin no snyam nas cho ga dang spyod yul de dag phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan ba ni chog dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
