analyzed: der gnas nas kyang dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi ni rang gi pha'i spyod yul dang / yul yin no snyam nas cho ga dang spyod yul de dag phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan ba ni chog dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äù They are endowed with perfect conduct and domain and are thus endowed with perfect conduct and domain.

translated: They are careful about even the slightest nonvirtuous action that is to be abandoned.üîΩThey are careful about even the slightest nonvirtuous action that is to be abandoned.üîΩThey are careful about even the slightest nonvirtuous action that is to be abandoned.üîΩThey are careful about even the slightest nonvirtuous action that is to be abandoned.üîΩThey are careful about even the slightest nonvirtuous action that is to be abandoned.üîΩThey are careful about even the slightest nonvirtuous action that is to be abandoned.üîΩThey are careful about even the slightest nonvirtuous action that is to be abandoned.

analyzed: sdig pa chung du'ang 'di dang ni //üîΩphrad mi 'gyur zhes bsam mi bya //üîΩzhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //

original: lus kyi las kyi mtha' dang / ngag gi las kyi mtha' yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni las rnam pa gsum po kha na ma tho ba med pa so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i spong ba goms pa'i ngang tshul dang / sbyor ba can gyi cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pas lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: lus kyi las kyi mtha' dang / ngag gi las kyi mtha' yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni las rnam pa gsum po kha na ma tho ba med pa so sor thar pa'i sdom pa'i spong ba goms pa'i ngang tshul dang / sbyor ba can gyi cho ga dang spyod yul phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan pa dang ldan pas lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: The purity of bodily action and the purity of verbal action refers to the purity of bodily, verbal and mental actions, through the possession of a nature that is habituated to the avoidance of the three types of action that are subject to censure, i.e. the restraint of the prƒÅtimok·π£a, and through the possession of the perfect application, ritual and domain.

original: yid kyi las yongs su dag pa ni kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam yang 'jigs par lta bas sdig pa mi dge ba dang / log par spyod pa dang / rtog pa ngan pa yid la mi byed pas yid kyi las yongs su dag par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi las yongs su dag pa ni kha na ma tho ba phra rab tsam yang 'jigs par lta bas sdig pa mi dge ba dang / log par spyod pa dang / rtog pa ngan pa yid la mi byed pas yid kyi las yongs su dag par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The purity of mental action refers to the purity of mental action because one does not think about sin, demerit and wrong conduct, even in one's thoughts, since one views even the slightest sin with fear.

original: 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa zhes bya ba ni 'di la 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The purity of livelihood refers to the purity of livelihood in this regard.

original: log par 'tsho ba yongs su spangs pa yin pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: log par 'tsho ba yongs su spangs pa yin pa'i phyir yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: It is pure because wrong livelihood is completely abandoned.

original: nyes pa des kun nas ma gos pa'o //üîΩ'tsho ba zhes bya ba ni 'di la brten te kun du 'tsho bas 'tsho ba yin pa'am /
analyzed: nyes pa des kun nas ma gos pa'o // 'tsho ba zhes bya ba ni 'di la brten te kun du 'tsho bas 'tsho ba yin pa'am /
translated: He is not defiled by that fault.

original: legs par gnas te 'tsho ba yin pas na 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: legs par gnas te 'tsho ba yin pas na 'tsho ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLivelihood‚Äù is that by which one lives, or that by which one lives well.

original: log par 'tsho ba ni gso ba byed pa dang / ltas la sogs shes pa dang / zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs sngags kyi sbyor ba dang / mtshan ma lta ba dang / skar rtsis dang / ltas mkhan dang / tshul 'tshos la sogs pas 'tsho bar byed pa ni log par 'tsho ba yin te /
analyzed: log par 'tsho ba ni gso ba byed pa dang / ltas la sogs shes pa dang / zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi tshogs sngags kyi sbyor ba dang / mtshan ma lta ba dang / skar rtsis dang / ltas mkhan dang / tshul 'tshos la sogs pas 'tsho bar byed pa ni log par 'tsho ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúWrong livelihood‚Äù is to live by astrology, omens, and so on; by the collection of pacifying and other rites, by the application of spells; by observing signs; by divination; by being an augur; by being a fortuneteller; and so on.

original: log par 'tsho ba'i 'grel ba las ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: log par 'tsho ba'i 'grel ba las ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is explained in the commentary on the line ‚Äúwrong livelihood.‚Äù

original: gzhan dag ni gang mi dge ba'i las kyis 'tsho ba'am /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gang mi dge ba'i las kyis 'tsho ba'am /
translated: Others say that wrong livelihood is to live by any nonvirtuous action.

original: bzo dang / mngag gzhug dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba dang / 'dab ma dang / so shing la sogs pa ster ba'i rgyus 'tsho ba 'di ni logs par 'tsho ba yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: bzo dang / mngag gzhug dang / me tog dang / 'bras bu dang / rtsa ba dang / 'dab ma dang / so shing la sogs pa ster ba'i rgyus 'tsho ba 'di ni logs par 'tsho ba yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: He lives by means of gifts of crafts, of service, of flowers, fruits, roots, leaves, tooth cleaners, and so on.

original: gzhan dag ni gang 'tsho ba'i don du nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis sbyor bar byed cing des 'tsho bar rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di ni log par 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gang 'tsho ba'i don du nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa'i sems kyis sbyor bar byed cing des 'tsho bar rtogs pa gang yin pa 'di ni log par 'tsho ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Others say: Wrong livelihood is that by which one lives with a defiled mind, engaged in the pursuit of livelihood.

original: gzhan yang rnyed pa'i don du nyo tshong byas nas 'tsho bar byed pa dang / chos 'chad pas 'tsho @11b bar byed pa de yang log par 'tsho ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnyed pa'i don du nyo tshong byas nas 'tsho bar byed pa dang / chos 'chad pas 'tsho @11b bar byed pa de yang log par 'tsho ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is wrong livelihood to live by means of buying and selling for the sake of gain, and to live by means of teaching the Dharma.

original: de dag ni dug dang 'dra ba dang dri ma dang bcas pa dang 'dra bar de yongs su song zhing nyes pa des ma gos par kun du rgyu 'tsho ba gang yin pa de ni 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni dug dang 'dra ba dang dri ma dang bcas pa dang 'dra bar de yongs su song zhing nyes pa des ma gos par kun du rgyu 'tsho ba gang yin pa de ni 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: These are like poison and like impurity. The life of the mendicant is pure when he lives without being defiled by that fault, as if it were poison or an impurity.

original: de yang ji lta bur 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji lta bur 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is this accomplished?

original: brjod par bya ste /üîΩlus kyi rma dkri ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste / lus kyi rma dkri ba la sogs pa /
translated: It is said:üîΩOne should rely on the means of removing suffering

original: sdug bsngal bsal ba'i don du sten byed cing //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsal ba'i don du sten byed cing //
translated: such as binding the wounds of the body.

original: rig pas rnyed la sems ni cho ga shes pa //
analyzed: rig pas rnyed la sems ni cho ga shes pa //
translated: One should be aware of the rules for acquiring knowledge

original: 'tsho ba min pa'i nyes pas gnod mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'tsho ba min pa'i nyes pas gnod mi 'gyur //
translated: and not be harmed by the faults of an improper livelihood.

original: yang rigs pa ni bdag nyid snod du rang bar byas pa dang / rnyed pa'i bsam bas ma bcom pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis ma gos pa dang / gzhan dag la 'dud cing gcam gsag gis bsgrub pa ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: yang rigs pa ni bdag nyid snod du rang bar byas pa dang / rnyed pa'i bsam bas ma bcom pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos rnams kyis ma gos pa dang / gzhan dag la 'dud cing gcam gsag gis bsgrub pa ma yin pa dang /
translated: Moreover, propriety is that which makes oneself a suitable vessel, that which is not destroyed by the thought of gain, that which is not defiled by worldly dharmas, that which is not accomplished by bowing to others or by flattery.

original: bdag nyid kyi yon tan yang dag pa ma yin pa ston par byed pa dang / yang dag pa'i yon tan yang sbed par byed pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / slong mos spyod pa'i 'tsho bas 'tsho bsgrub pa la spyod pa 'di ni rigs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi yon tan yang dag pa ma yin pa ston par byed pa dang / yang dag pa'i yon tan yang sbed par byed pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / slong mos spyod pa'i 'tsho bas 'tsho bsgrub pa la spyod pa 'di ni rigs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is that which reveals one's own false virtues, that which conceals one's true virtues, and that which is accomplished by a livelihood of shame, modesty, and mendicancy. This is called propriety.

original: de bzhin du de ltar zhugs pa las ma rnyed du zin kyang ma rnyed pa de la bdag gi 'tsho ba ni gzhan la rag las pa yin pa dang / gzhan la re ba mi skyed pa dang / bdag la stod par mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du de ltar zhugs pa las ma rnyed du zin kyang ma rnyed pa de la bdag gi 'tsho ba ni gzhan la rag las pa yin pa dang / gzhan la re ba mi skyed pa dang / bdag la stod par mi byed pa dang /
translated: I will not place my hopes in others, nor will I praise myself.üîΩThe Blessed One has taught that one should remember one‚Äôs lack of possessions, that one should be self-sufficient, and that one should see the danger in possessions.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ma rnyed pa rjes su dran pa dang las bdag gir bya ba'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / rnyed pa'i nyes dmigs mthong bas kyi ma'o rnyed pa'i sems las bdag ring du gyur pa ni legs so snyam te de la yid gdung bar mi byed do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang ma rnyed pa rjes su dran pa dang las bdag gir bya ba'i rjes su 'brang ba dang / rnyed pa'i nyes dmigs mthong bas kyi ma'o rnyed pa'i sems las bdag ring du gyur pa ni legs so snyam te de la yid gdung bar mi byed do //
translated: I am far from the mind of possessions. This is good.‚Äù He should not be tormented by that.

original: dka' thub nags tshal gnas la rnyed bkur te //
analyzed: dka' thub nags tshal gnas la rnyed bkur te //
translated: ‚ÄúWealth comes to those who live in the forest of asceticism,

original: mdza' ba'i sgo nas dgra bo 'ongs pa yin //
analyzed: mdza' ba'i sgo nas dgra bo 'ongs pa yin //
translated: just as enemies come to those who are loved.

original: zla ba'i zer gyis padma ji bzhin du //
analyzed: zla ba'i zer gyis padma ji bzhin du //
translated: Just as the moon‚Äôs rays open the lotus,

original: legs pa rab 'joms brtul zhugs lhod par byed //
analyzed: legs pa rab 'joms brtul zhugs lhod par byed //
translated: wealth destroys the good and slackens self-discipline.‚Äù

original: yang gal te rigs pas bcas pas rab tu rnyad par gyur na cung zad rnyed pa des dga' zhing dregs par mi byed cing len pa na yang tshod shes pa yin te /
analyzed: yang gal te rigs pas bcas pas rab tu rnyad par gyur na cung zad rnyed pa des dga' zhing dregs par mi byed cing len pa na yang tshod shes pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, if one obtains a little through reasoning, one does not become elated and conceited by that little gain.

original: lhag ma yod pa tsam du len la dregs pa'i nyes par ltung bar mi byed cing chung du zhig byin pa la yang sbyin pa po la brnyas par mi byed la sbyin pa po yang byams pa'i sems nye bar 'jog ste /
analyzed: lhag ma yod pa tsam du len la dregs pa'i nyes par ltung bar mi byed cing chung du zhig byin pa la yang sbyin pa po la brnyas par mi byed la sbyin pa po yang byams pa'i sems nye bar 'jog ste /
translated: When one receives more, one knows the proper amount. One receives only what is left over and does not fall into the fault of conceit. One does not despise the donor even if he gives little, and one places the donor in a loving frame of mind.

original: re zhig sbyin bdag 'di'i sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rdzogs par bya ba dang / 'di'i ser sna @12a * //
analyzed: re zhig sbyin bdag 'di'i sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po rdzogs par bya ba dang / 'di'i ser sna @12a * //
translated: One thinks, For the time being, I will complete the meritorious deeds that arise from this donor's generosity, and I will destroy his stinginess.

original: dang phrag dog gi dri ma bsrabs par byas par 'gyur ba dang / 'di'i dge ba'i bya ba la spro bar khas blangs pa las nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / gang 'di la rjes su yi rang ba'am grogs byed pa de dag kyang dge ba la sbyor bar 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: dang phrag dog gi dri ma bsrabs par byas par 'gyur ba dang / 'di'i dge ba'i bya ba la spro bar khas blangs pa las nyams par mi 'gyur ba dang / gang 'di la rjes su yi rang ba'am grogs byed pa de dag kyang dge ba la sbyor bar 'gyur ba dang /
translated: and the stains of pride and jealousy are reduced; and he does not fail in his promise to delight in the virtuous actions of others; and those who rejoice in this or assist in it will also be engaged in virtue.

original: gal te 'di dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngos na 'jig rten la phan par zhugs pa dag gi grogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu bsngos na 'jig rten la phan par zhugs pa dag gi grogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: If they dedicate it to supreme perfect enlightenment, it will assist those who are engaged in benefiting the world.üîΩBut if they dedicate it to the accumulation of liberation or to worldly excellence, then also it will assist them, since it will have helped them.

original: 'on te thar pa'i tshogs sam srid pa'i phun sum tshogs pa yongs su sngo bar byed na de lta na yang 'di'i grogs byas par gyur bas phan btags pa yin no snyam du rnam par ma bsams nas yongs su len par byed do //
analyzed: 'on te thar pa'i tshogs sam srid pa'i phun sum tshogs pa yongs su sngo bar byed na de lta na yang 'di'i grogs byas par gyur bas phan btags pa yin no snyam du rnam par ma bsams nas yongs su len par byed do //
translated: Thus, without reflecting, he accepts it.

original: yongs su blangs nas kyang sbyin pa pos ji ltar yongs su bsngos pa bzhin du yongs su longs spyod par byed kyi gsog 'jog tu mi byed cing brlag par yang mi byed do //
analyzed: yongs su blangs nas kyang sbyin pa pos ji ltar yongs su bsngos pa bzhin du yongs su longs spyod par byed kyi gsog 'jog tu mi byed cing brlag par yang mi byed do //
translated: Having accepted it, the giver enjoys it as he dedicated it, he does not hoard it and he does not waste it.

original: snod ma yin pa la yang sbyin par mi byed do //üîΩde ltar yongs su tshol ba dang / len par byed pa dang / yongs su longs spyod pas kun nas yongs su dag par byed pa ni 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: snod ma yin pa la yang sbyin par mi byed do // de ltar yongs su tshol ba dang / len par byed pa dang / yongs su longs spyod pas kun nas yongs su dag par byed pa ni 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: He does not give to unworthy recipients.üîΩThus, by seeking, accepting and enjoying, he purifies his livelihood.

original: 'tsho ba sgrub pa yongs su tshol ba dang / len pa dang de ni phan pa la sbyor ba dang / rigs pas 'jug pa dag pas mdzes pa ni /
analyzed: 'tsho ba sgrub pa yongs su tshol ba dang / len pa dang de ni phan pa la sbyor ba dang / rigs pas 'jug pa dag pas mdzes pa ni /
translated: He seeks and accepts the means of livelihood, he is beautiful by his purity in applying himself to benefit and in his proper conduct.

original: dam pas 'tsho ba yongs su dag par bshad /
analyzed: dam pas 'tsho ba yongs su dag par bshad /
translated: The holy ones have explained this as the purity of livelihood.

original: sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi la slob pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par slangs nas slob pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i gnas la gnas pa yin la /
analyzed: sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi la slob pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par slangs nas slob pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i gnas la gnas pa yin la /
translated: He trains in the precepts of the vow he has taken is the basis of training in morality by training in the precepts of the vow he has taken.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' la gus pas bslab pa'i gzhi don yod pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong ba dang / thams cad du phan yon rnam pa bcu las dam pa'i chos kyi phun sum tshogs pa bcu bcu zhing phan yon re re la yang dag par brtags te bslab pa 'dod pa nyid dam /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' la gus pas bslab pa'i gzhi don yod pa nyid yang dag par rjes su mthong ba dang / thams cad du phan yon rnam pa bcu las dam pa'i chos kyi phun sum tshogs pa bcu bcu zhing phan yon re re la yang dag par brtags te bslab pa 'dod pa nyid dam /
translated: Moreover, one who has respect for the word of the Tathagata, who sees the point of the basis of training, who is aware of the benefits in all circumstances, who examines each of the ten benefits, and who desires the training,

original: kha na ma tho ba la 'jigs pa ni ltung ba lci ba dang / yang bar rtog par mi byed cing sbom po dang / phra ba rnams sdom par byed pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa 'am de la bde bar d'u shes pas yang dag par blangs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi la slob pa yin no //üîΩgang zhig bde gshegs bstan pa la //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba la 'jigs pa ni ltung ba lci ba dang / yang bar rtog par mi byed cing sbom po dang / phra ba rnams sdom par byed pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa 'am de la bde bar d'u shes pas yang dag par blangs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi la slob pa yin no // gang zhig bde gshegs bstan pa la //
translated: and who fears transgression, who does not consider transgressions to be heavy or light, who is restrained with regard to gross and subtle transgressions, and who is respectful of the training or who knows the happiness of that, trains in the basis of training that has been undertaken.üîΩOne who has undertaken the basis of training in the

original: bslab gzhi bcas par gyur pa ni //üîΩ'di dag bsngams la sdug bsngal la //
analyzed: bslab gzhi bcas par gyur pa ni // 'di dag bsngams la sdug bsngal la //
translated: teaching of the Well-GoneüîΩwill experience suffering from restraining

original: 'di dag ldog las bde ba skye //
analyzed: 'di dag ldog las bde ba skye //
translated: the senses, but will generate happiness from turning away from that.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas legs @12b bsdams shing //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pas legs @12b bsdams shing //
translated: Well restrained by the vows of individual liberation,

original: rang gi chog spyod yul phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: rang gi chog spyod yul phun sum tshogs //
translated: Their own conduct and sphere of activity are perfect.

original: kha na ma tho chung la'ang nyes chen lta //
analyzed: kha na ma tho chung la'ang nyes chen lta //
translated: They regard even the slightest misdeed as a great fault.

original: lus ngag yid kyi sbyor ba rnam par dag / ma smad 'tsho ba 'tsho ba rnam dag yin //
analyzed: lus ngag yid kyi sbyor ba rnam par dag / ma smad 'tsho ba 'tsho ba rnam dag yin //
translated: Their physical, verbal, and mental actions are completely pure.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi la sogs pas slob par dga' //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi la sogs pas slob par dga' //
translated: They have pure livelihood and delight in training in the bases of training.

original: bslab pa'i gnas su gyur pa gang cung zad //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gnas su gyur pa gang cung zad //
translated: Whatever is a basis of training

original: mi mthun de de gsal bar rnam par spong //
analyzed: mi mthun de de gsal bar rnam par spong //
translated: They clearly avoid as if it were a poisonous snake.

original: mdo las tshul khrims kyi gags su gyur pa ni mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin par gsungs la /
analyzed: mdo las tshul khrims kyi gags su gyur pa ni mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen yin par gsungs la /
translated: A sutra states that a nonvirtuous friend is an obstacle to ethical discipline.

original: de ni phung khrol thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin te /
analyzed: de ni phung khrol thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin te /
translated: He is the source of all misfortune.

original: 'di ltar dad pa med pa dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / le lo dang / shes rab 'chal pa nyid dang / dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams pa nyid dang / lto 'gengs pa nyid dang / zas kyi tshod mi shes pa nyid dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar dad pa med pa dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / le lo dang / shes rab 'chal pa nyid dang / dbang po'i sgo ma bsdams pa nyid dang / lto 'gengs pa nyid dang / zas kyi tshod mi shes pa nyid dang /
translated: They are: lack of faith, shamelessness, lack of embarrassment, laziness, lack of wisdom, not guarding the sense doors, overeating, not knowing moderation in food,

original: nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal ba la mngon par mi brtson pa dang / sngon nyams su myong ba'i dgong pa dang / smra ba dang / dga' zhing rtse ba rjes su dran pa dang ; dge ba'i chos mngon par mi brtson ba dang /
analyzed: nam gyi cha stod dang / nam gyi cha smad la mi nyal ba la mngon par mi brtson pa dang / sngon nyams su myong ba'i dgong pa dang / smra ba dang / dga' zhing rtse ba rjes su dran pa dang ; dge ba'i chos mngon par mi brtson ba dang /
translated: not making an effort to stay awake in the first and last periods of the night, remembering past experiences, conversations, and amusements, not making an effort in virtuous activities,

original: dge slong rgan rabs rnams la ma gus shing brtse bar mi sems pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang / tshig ngan par smra ba dang / bzod pa med pa dang / las dang smra dang 'du 'dzin la mngon bar dga' ba dang ;
analyzed: dge slong rgan rabs rnams la ma gus shing brtse bar mi sems pa dang / tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang / tshig ngan par smra ba dang / bzod pa med pa dang / las dang smra dang 'du 'dzin la mngon bar dga' ba dang ;
translated: not respecting and caring for senior monks, improper attention, speaking harshly, impatience, and delighting in work, talking, and socializing.

original: khyim pa'i skye bo dang 'dre ba dang / bud med la yang dang yang du lta ba dang / khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang tshul khrims kyi gags su gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: khyim pa'i skye bo dang 'dre ba dang / bud med la yang dang yang du lta ba dang / khro ba dang khon du 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyang tshul khrims kyi gags su gyur pa yin te /
translated: Associating with householders, looking again and again at women, and the afflictions such as anger and resentment are also obstacles to morality.

original: tshul khrims kyi gags su gyur pa la gnas pa ni tshul khrims yongs su ma rdzogs pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'am yongs su nyams pa 'gyur //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi gags su gyur pa la gnas pa ni tshul khrims yongs su ma rdzogs pa rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'am yongs su nyams pa 'gyur //
translated: One who is occupied with obstacles to morality will not understand the completion of morality, or will fall away from it.

original: de bas na tshul khrims yongs su bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir de'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na tshul khrims yongs su bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir de'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa dge ba'i bshes gnyen la sogs pa la brten par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in order to protect morality, one should rely on the spiritual benefactors who are the antidote to those obstacles.

original: tshul khrims rgyu ni dbang po sdom pa yin par bshad //
analyzed: tshul khrims rgyu ni dbang po sdom pa yin par bshad //
translated: The cause of morality is said to be restraint of the sense faculties.

original: phun sum tshogs des tshul khrims dri med dang ldan 'gyur //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs des tshul khrims dri med dang ldan 'gyur //
translated: Through that perfection, one becomes endowed with stainless morality.

original: de bas thos pa'i rang bzhin lta la nges dmigs te //
analyzed: de bas thos pa'i rang bzhin lta la nges dmigs te //
translated: Therefore, having ascertained the view which has the nature of learning,

original: rang gi dbang po'i yul la 'phyan las bsrung bar bya //
analyzed: rang gi dbang po'i yul la 'phyan las bsrung bar bya //
translated: one should protect oneself from wandering into the objects of the senses.

original: de bas na de bsrung bar bya ste /üîΩsdig pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid dang / de la mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / de'i tshul dran pa dang / @13a * //
analyzed: de bas na de bsrung bar bya ste / sdig pa'i rgyur gyur pa nyid dang / de la mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / de'i tshul dran pa dang / @13a * //
translated: Therefore, one should guard against them.

original: de'i rnam pa yid la byed pa dang / rjes su rtog pa spang ba dang / yul gyi nyes dmigs mthong ba dang / nyes dmigs mthong ba nas kyang de la lus kyis rgyad bsrings la sdug ba yid la byed pa spang bar bya zhing yul la chags pa'i gzhi shing dang 'bag la reg pa snyam ba dang /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa yid la byed pa dang / rjes su rtog pa spang ba dang / yul gyi nyes dmigs mthong ba dang / nyes dmigs mthong ba nas kyang de la lus kyis rgyad bsrings la sdug ba yid la byed pa spang bar bya zhing yul la chags pa'i gzhi shing dang 'bag la reg pa snyam ba dang /
translated: The causes of sin are: to grasp at the signs of the object, to remember the way of the object, to attend to the aspects of the object, to follow the object, to see the faults of the object, to see the faults of the object and to extend the body to the object, to attend to the pleasant, to abandon the proper mental attentions, and to be attached to the object.

original: gzan lta bur gyur pa'i 'tsho ba rkyen rnams zil gyis mnan la shin tu zhen pa las bzlog pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa spong ba dang / 'jig rten sna tshogs la mngon par ma chags par bya'o //
analyzed: gzan lta bur gyur pa'i 'tsho ba rkyen rnams zil gyis mnan la shin tu zhen pa las bzlog pa tshul bzhin yid la byed pa spong ba dang / 'jig rten sna tshogs la mngon par ma chags par bya'o //
translated: The object is like a tree or a wall that one touches, and the conditions of life are like a blanket. One should overcome the conditions of life and turn away from great attachment. One should abandon the proper mental attentions and not be attached to the various things of the world.

original: cho ga gang gis bya zhe na /
analyzed: cho ga gang gis bya zhe na /
translated: By what ritual should one act?

original: gnyen por gyur pa la yang dag par brten pas spang bar bya zhing /
analyzed: gnyen por gyur pa la yang dag par brten pas spang bar bya zhing /
translated: One should abandon the object by relying on the antidote.

original: sems kun nas dran pa dang ldan bas phyogs kun du rnam par lta zhing gzugs la sogs pa la rnam par 'jug pa na de ltar sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kyis dge ba'i sems gtugs nas gnas par 'gyur ro zhes dran pa brtan pos yang dag par
analyzed: sems kun nas dran pa dang ldan bas phyogs kun du rnam par lta zhing gzugs la sogs pa la rnam par 'jug pa na de ltar sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos kyis dge ba'i sems gtugs nas gnas par 'gyur ro zhes dran pa brtan pos yang dag par
translated: When he looks in all directions with mindfulness, and when he engages in form and so on, he should be mindful of the fact that his virtuous mind is obscured by nonvirtuous actions.

original: srung bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: srung bar byed pa yin no //
translated: He should be mindful of this and properly guard himself.

original: ba ltar nag po'i phyogs la mngon par zhen pa'i sems yang dag par tshar gcad pa dang / gzugs sdug pa dang bde ba la tsher ma lta bur lta ba dang / yul rang bzhin shes par bya ba dang / 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs tshol ba dang /
analyzed: ba ltar nag po'i phyogs la mngon par zhen pa'i sems yang dag par tshar gcad pa dang / gzugs sdug pa dang bde ba la tsher ma lta bur lta ba dang / yul rang bzhin shes par bya ba dang / 'dod pa'i nyes dmigs tshol ba dang /
translated: He should destroy the mind that is attached to the dark side, and he should view attractive and pleasant forms as if they were thorns. He should understand the nature of objects, and he should seek out the faults of desire.

original: nges par 'byung ba la lhag par mos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan la sems dga' ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan la sems gtong ba dang / dge ba'i chos la 'grus par bya ba dang / rgyun tu bya bas mngon bar brtson bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba la lhag par mos pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan la sems dga' ba dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan la sems gtong ba dang / dge ba'i chos la 'grus par bya ba dang / rgyun tu bya bas mngon bar brtson bar bya ba dang /
translated: and he is diligent in constant practice.üîΩHe should avoid people who do not restrain their faculties,üîΩhe should rely on people who restrain their faculties,

original: dbang po yongs su ma bsdams pa'i gang zag rnams yongs su spang ba dang / dbang po bsdams pa'i gang zag rnams la brten pa dang / sdom pa ma yin pa la 'jigs par lta bas spang bar bya'o //üîΩlcags kyi thur ma rab tu 'bar ba yis //
analyzed: dbang po yongs su ma bsdams pa'i gang zag rnams yongs su spang ba dang / dbang po bsdams pa'i gang zag rnams la brten pa dang / sdom pa ma yin pa la 'jigs par lta bas spang bar bya'o // lcags kyi thur ma rab tu 'bar ba yis //
translated: and he should avoid what is not restraint, seeing it as fearful.üîΩIt would be better to have one‚Äôs eyes

original: mig la byug par gyur pa ches bla yi //
analyzed: mig la byug par gyur pa ches bla yi //
translated: smeared with burning ironüîΩthan to look with desire and hatred

original: rang gi ngan 'gro'i lam ni stsol byed pa //üîΩgzugs la chags dang sdang bas lta mi bya //
analyzed: rang gi ngan 'gro'i lam ni stsol byed pa // gzugs la chags dang sdang bas lta mi bya //
translated: at the path that leads to one‚Äôs own lower realms.üîΩIt would be better to have one‚Äôs ears filled

original: lcags khu 'bar bas rna ba bkang bla yi //
analyzed: lcags khu 'bar bas rna ba bkang bla yi //
translated: with burning ironüîΩthan to listen heedlessly,

original: bag med chags dang dregs pa 'phel byed pa /
analyzed: bag med chags dang dregs pa 'phel byed pa /
translated: increasing desire, hatred, and pride.

original: rngon pa'i khong glu dag pas lhag pa'i sgra //
analyzed: rngon pa'i khong glu dag pas lhag pa'i sgra //
translated: The hunter‚Äôs song is purer than your voice.

original: nyan pa bdag la phan pas thos mi rung //
analyzed: nyan pa bdag la phan pas thos mi rung //
translated: It is not right to listen to what is beneficial to oneself.

original: sna la bltas te spu gri rnon por ni //
analyzed: sna la bltas te spu gri rnon por ni //
translated: Looking at the nose, the sharp razor

original: bdar ba gtsangs pa'i nad ni brang bla yi //
analyzed: bdar ba gtsangs pa'i nad ni brang bla yi //
translated: is sharpened, but the disease of the throat is not.

original: bdag nyid sdug bsngal sna tshogs @13b 'phel byed pa'i //
analyzed: bdag nyid sdug bsngal sna tshogs @13b 'phel byed pa'i //
translated: It increases the various sufferings of oneself,

original: dri chags dgra ba rnam par 'phel mi rung //üîΩme lce 'bar ba'i mtshon ni rnon po yis //
analyzed: dri chags dgra ba rnam par 'phel mi rung // me lce 'bar ba'i mtshon ni rnon po yis //
translated: but it is not right to increase the attachment to smell, the enemy.üîΩThe sharp weapon of the blazing flame

original: lce ni mngon du gcad par gyur bla yi //
analyzed: lce ni mngon du gcad par gyur bla yi //
translated: is better to cut off the tongue.

original: skye ba'i sdug bsngal lam ni skyed byed pa //
analyzed: skye ba'i sdug bsngal lam ni skyed byed pa //
translated: The path of the suffering of birth is created

original: ro la chags pa'i sdig byed de lta min //üîΩmkhas pas rang lus dgra sta rnon po yis //
analyzed: ro la chags pa'i sdig byed de lta min // mkhas pas rang lus dgra sta rnon po yis //
translated: by the sinner attached to taste, but not so.üîΩThe wise one is better destroyed by

original: rnam par gtubs pas 'jig par gyur bla yi //
analyzed: rnam par gtubs pas 'jig par gyur bla yi //
translated: the sharp axe of his own body.

original: reg pa sna tshogs sred pas gdungs gyur pas //
analyzed: reg pa sna tshogs sred pas gdungs gyur pas //
translated: It is not right to be tormented by the craving for various touches

original: yun rings dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur mi rung //
analyzed: yun rings dmyal bar skye bar 'gyur mi rung //
translated: and to be born for a long time in hell.

original: gang phyir ci dga' spyod las yid ma bsrungs //
analyzed: gang phyir ci dga' spyod las yid ma bsrungs //
translated: Since the mind is not protected from the conduct of desire,

original: sdug bsngal mtha' yas bskyed pa'i sdig pa sogs //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mtha' yas bskyed pa'i sdig pa sogs //
translated: the sin that produces endless suffering arises.

original: dbang po lhag ma sdom pa'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: dbang po lhag ma sdom pa'ang yod ma yin //
translated: There is no restraint of the remaining faculties.

original: de phyir mkhas pas de nyid bsrung ba'i rigs //
analyzed: de phyir mkhas pas de nyid bsrung ba'i rigs //
translated: Therefore, the wise one should guard reality.

original: mkhas pas 'dod chags nyes la mi sdug bsten //
analyzed: mkhas pas 'dod chags nyes la mi sdug bsten //
translated: The wise one should rely on the repulsive for the fault of passion,

original: sdang la byams dang rtse goms yon tan gyis //üîΩrmongs la mi rtag 'du shes 'chi ba ni //
analyzed: sdang la byams dang rtse goms yon tan gyis // rmongs la mi rtag 'du shes 'chi ba ni //
translated: on love for the fault of hatred, and on the cultivation of the virtues.

original: rjes su dran dang bag yod bsten pas bsrungs //
analyzed: rjes su dran dang bag yod bsten pas bsrungs //
translated: One should guard against delusion by the perception of impermanence and by the recollection of death,üîΩand by reliance on heedfulness.üîΩThus, seeing the danger in lack of restraint, one should strive to restrain the faculties.

original: de ltar sdom pa ma yin pa las 'jigs pa mthong nas dbang po bsdam pa'i phyir 'bad pa dang bcas par gyur pa dang / sred pa skye ba'i dngos po yin pas yongs su longs spyod pa'i rkyen la bag yod pa nyid du bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sdom pa ma yin pa las 'jigs pa mthong nas dbang po bsdam pa'i phyir 'bad pa dang bcas par gyur pa dang / sred pa skye ba'i dngos po yin pas yongs su longs spyod pa'i rkyen la bag yod pa nyid du bya'o //
translated: And one should be heedful with regard to the conditions of enjoyment, since they are the basis for the arising of craving.

original: gzhan gyi kha zas dang rnyong dang shing gi gzugs brnyan dang mchil pa ltar 'tsho ba'i rkyen gyi yo byad rnams ni 'jigs pa bskyed pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi kha zas dang rnyong dang shing gi gzugs brnyan dang mchil pa ltar 'tsho ba'i rkyen gyi yo byad rnams ni 'jigs pa bskyed pa yin no //
translated: The conditions for livelihood, such as food, drink, and the requisites of life, are like a mirage, a phantom village, or a reflection of the face in a mirror.

original: de bas na so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis tshul bzhin du yongs su brtags te longs spyad par bya zhing 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis kun nas ldang ba dang bral zhing lhag par zhen pa dang / mdud pa med pa dang /
analyzed: de bas na so sor brtags pa'i stobs kyis tshul bzhin du yongs su brtags te longs spyad par bya zhing 'dod chags dang zhe sdang dang gti mug gis kun nas ldang ba dang bral zhing lhag par zhen pa dang / mdud pa med pa dang /
translated: Therefore, you should use them after proper analysis with the power of discernment. You should be free of the motivations of attachment, anger, and ignorance. You should not be excessively attached, nor should you be bound up with them.

original: lhag par ma chags pa dang ; nyes dmigs mthong ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan zhing rtse ba'i don du ma yin /
analyzed: lhag par ma chags pa dang ; nyes dmigs mthong ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i shes rab dang ldan zhing rtse ba'i don du ma yin /
translated: You should not be excessively attached to them, nor should you see them as faults. You should have the wisdom of renunciation. You should not use them for the sake of play,

original: rgyags pa'i don du ma yin /
analyzed: rgyags pa'i don du ma yin /
translated: for the sake of intoxication,

original: cha rgyan pa'i don du ma yin /
analyzed: cha rgyan pa'i don du ma yin /
translated: for the sake of ornamentation,

original: kha dog sdug par bya ba'i don du ma yin /
analyzed: kha dog sdug par bya ba'i don du ma yin /
translated: for the sake of beauty,

original: brgyan par bya ba'i phyir ma yin gyi /
analyzed: brgyan par bya ba'i phyir ma yin gyi /
translated: or for the sake of adornment.

original: gzhan du na dgos pa'i dbang gis der re zhig gos la longs spyod pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan du na dgos pa'i dbang gis der re zhig gos la longs spyod pa ni /
translated: Rather, you should use them for a while, for the sake of necessity,

original: sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / tsha ba dang / grang ba dang / sdig sbrul gyi reg pa las bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sbrang bu dang / sha sbrang dang / tsha ba dang / grang ba dang / sdig sbrul gyi reg pa las bsrung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to protect yourself from the touch of flies, bees, heat, cold, and snakes.

original: ngo tsha bas gsang ba dgab pa'i phyir ma yin /üîΩrab tu byung ba'i cha lugs dang rjes su mthun par bsod snyoms la yongs su @14a * //
analyzed: ngo tsha bas gsang ba dgab pa'i phyir ma yin / rab tu byung ba'i cha lugs dang rjes su mthun par bsod snyoms la yongs su @14a * //
translated: It is not to conceal oneself out of shame.

original: longs spyod par bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod par bya'o //
translated: One should enjoy alms in a way that accords with the lifestyle of one who has gone forth.üîΩAs long as this body remains, one should protect one‚Äôs life in order to live, without attachment, like a charioteer who greases the axle.

original: ji srid du lus 'di gnas shing 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir srog bsrung ba shing rta'i mig bsku ba dang 'dra bar shin tu ma chags par rma 'i tshor ba bsal ba'i don du bsku ba dang 'dra bar bru ba tsha ba zhi bar bya ba'i don du
analyzed: ji srid du lus 'di gnas shing 'tsho bar bya ba'i phyir srog bsrung ba shing rta'i mig bsku ba dang 'dra bar shin tu ma chags par rma 'i tshor ba bsal ba'i don du bsku ba dang 'dra bar bru ba tsha ba zhi bar bya ba'i don du
translated: One should do so in order to remove the pain of wounds, without attachment, like one who applies ointment in order to heal a wound.üîΩOne should do so in order to pacify the burning of hunger, without attachment, in order to protect one‚Äôs life.üîΩOne should do so in order to abide for a long time in pure conduct, without attachment, like one who eats the flesh of one‚Äôs son in order to escape from a desert.

original: rjes su chags pa med par srog bsrung ba'i phyir dang / tshangs par spyod pa la yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir dgon pa las thar pa'i don du bu'i sha za ba dang 'dra bar zhen pa med pas de ltar tshor ba rnying pa so sor gzhom par bya ba dang /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa med par srog bsrung ba'i phyir dang / tshangs par spyod pa la yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir dgon pa las thar pa'i don du bu'i sha za ba dang 'dra bar zhen pa med pas de ltar tshor ba rnying pa so sor gzhom par bya ba dang /
translated: In this way, one should destroy old feelings.

original: tshor ba gsar pa mi bskyed par bya'o zhes zas la tshod rig pa nyid du sman dang 'dra bar tshad yod par byas la lus 'di kha zas chad tsam bstan pas yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'di nyid nad yin pas kha na ma tho ba med pa dang /üîΩrnal 'byor la rjes su mthun pa dang / lus bde blag tu rjes su gnas pa dang / sred pa'i zhags pas ma bcings pa'i bde ba la reg par gnas par bya zhing tshod zin par zos pas mi dga' ba dang / skom pa dang /
analyzed: tshor ba gsar pa mi bskyed par bya'o zhes zas la tshod rig pa nyid du sman dang 'dra bar tshad yod par byas la lus 'di kha zas chad tsam bstan pas yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir dang / 'di nyid nad yin pas kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / rnal 'byor la rjes su mthun pa dang / lus bde blag tu rjes su gnas pa dang / sred pa'i zhags pas ma bcings pa'i bde ba la reg par gnas par bya zhing tshod zin par zos pas mi dga' ba dang / skom pa dang /
translated: One should eat in moderation, like medicine, without creating new sensations, thinking, I will not eat to excess.üîΩ One should eat in moderation, without displeasure, thirst,üîΩyawning, heaviness of the body due to food, sleep, or lethargy, and one should maintain a proper lifestyle.

original: glal ba dang / zas kyis lus lci ba dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa kun du mi spyod pa yin zhing spyod lam la legs par gnas pa dang / rnal 'byor la phan pa nyid kyis bde ba la reg par gnas par bya ba'i don du yin gyi rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: glal ba dang / zas kyis lus lci ba dang / gnyid dang rmugs pa kun du mi spyod pa yin zhing spyod lam la legs par gnas pa dang / rnal 'byor la phan pa nyid kyis bde ba la reg par gnas par bya ba'i don du yin gyi rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: One should eat in moderation for the sake of maintaining a pleasant life through benefiting one's practice, not for the sake of conceptualization.

original: rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: rgyags pa'i phyir ma yin /
translated: It is not for the sake of intoxication.

original: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin zhes spang bar bya ba la so sor rtog cing 'di lta ste /üîΩlus 'di gnas par bya ba dang / 'tsho bar bya ba dang / bkris pa bsal bar bya ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa la phan par bya ba'i phyir yin no zhes bya ba la so sor rtog cing tshor ba rnying pa rnams spang bar bya ba dang /
analyzed: brgyan pa'i phyir ma yin zhes spang bar bya ba la so sor rtog cing 'di lta ste / lus 'di gnas par bya ba dang / 'tsho bar bya ba dang / bkris pa bsal bar bya ba dang / tshangs par spyod pa la phan par bya ba'i phyir yin no zhes bya ba la so sor rtog cing tshor ba rnying pa rnams spang bar bya ba dang /
translated: It is not for the sake of physical beauty.üîΩHe should reflect, ‚ÄúI eat just enough food for this body to survive, to remain comfortable, to support the holy life, thinking, ‚ÄòI will get rid of any old feeling and not give rise to new feeling.

original: gsar pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems shing de ltar tshad tsam za ba so sor rtog cing kha na ma tho ba med par 'tsho bas 'tsho ba dang / bde ba la reg par gnas pa yin no zhes tshad tsam za ba la so sor brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: gsar pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems shing de ltar tshad tsam za ba so sor rtog cing kha na ma tho ba med par 'tsho bas 'tsho ba dang / bde ba la reg par gnas pa yin no zhes tshad tsam za ba la so sor brtag par bya'o //
translated: ‚Äô I will live without reproach, and I will live comfortably, and I will live with a sense of moderation in my food.‚Äù

original: spang bar bya ba la so sor brtag cing 'dod pa'i bde ba la ma zhen pas de la rten par mi byed kyi bkres pa bsal bar bya ba dang / tshor ba rnyed pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa dang / gsar pa rnams mi @14b skye bar bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid dang zhing dub ba la mi rten pa yin la tshig lhag ma rnams kyis ni go 'phang bar ma dang /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba la so sor brtag cing 'dod pa'i bde ba la ma zhen pas de la rten par mi byed kyi bkres pa bsal bar bya ba dang / tshor ba rnyed pa rnams spang bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa dang / gsar pa rnams mi @14b skye bar bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid dang zhing dub ba la mi rten pa yin la tshig lhag ma rnams kyis ni go 'phang bar ma dang /
translated: He does not rely on his own body and field of activity in order to prevent new feelings from arising.

original: rjes su mthun pa yin no //üîΩde ltar na mal stan la yang tshul bzhin yid la byed bas so sor brtags te yongs su longs spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa yin no // de ltar na mal stan la yang tshul bzhin yid la byed bas so sor brtags te yongs su longs spyad par bya ste /
translated: The remaining phrases refer to intermediate and suitable states.üîΩThus, one should fully enjoy a bed by properly attending to it.

original: 'di ltar mal stan rnams la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid kyis so sor brtags la yongs su longs spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mal stan rnams la yang tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid kyis so sor brtags la yongs su longs spyad par bya ste /
translated: One should fully enjoy a bed by properly attending to it with an improper mind.

original: ci nas 'di ltar sbrang bu dang / rlung dang / tsha ba dang / sdig sbrul dang / char dang / ba mo'i reg pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir mngon du gnod pa phyung ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir dang / nang du yang dag 'jog dang /
analyzed: ci nas 'di ltar sbrang bu dang / rlung dang / tsha ba dang / sdig sbrul dang / char dang / ba mo'i reg pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir mngon du gnod pa phyung ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir dang / nang du yang dag 'jog dang /
translated: In order to avoid the contact of flies, wind, sun, snakes, rain, and dew, he should use them to ward off the discomfort that has arisen and to prevent it from arising.

original: rjes su mthun par bya ba dang / sgra la sogs pa'i g-yeng ba chung bar bya ba'i phyir longs spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun par bya ba dang / sgra la sogs pa'i g-yeng ba chung bar bya ba'i phyir longs spyad par bya'o //
translated: He should use them in order to be in harmony with the practice of yoga and to avoid distraction by sounds and so on.

original: nad kyi rkyen sman ni ji srid gnod pa skyed par byed pa'i tshor ba rnams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bde ba dam pa thob par bya ba'i phyir lus nyes dmigs mang po dang ldan par yid la bya ste spyad par bya'o //üîΩde ltar srog bsgrub pa la dgos pa dag / so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis 'jug pa na ci nas nyes pa sngon du mi 'byung zhing /
analyzed: nad kyi rkyen sman ni ji srid gnod pa skyed par byed pa'i tshor ba rnams bsal bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bde ba dam pa thob par bya ba'i phyir lus nyes dmigs mang po dang ldan par yid la bya ste spyad par bya'o // de ltar srog bsgrub pa la dgos pa dag / so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis 'jug pa na ci nas nyes pa sngon du mi 'byung zhing /
translated: He should use medicine to cure the body of disease, considering the body to be full of many faults, in order to remove the pain that causes discomfort and to attain the highest bliss.

original: 'di'i tshul khrims yongs su dag par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di'i tshul khrims yongs su dag par 'gyur //
translated: Thus, when he uses these things to sustain his life, he should do so with the power of discernment, so that faults do not arise and so that his morality remains pure.

original: yang so sor rtog pa'i dus gang zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang so sor rtog pa'i dus gang zhig yin zhe na /
translated: When is the time for discernment?

original: brjod par bya ste /üîΩbsod snyoms dang nad kyi rkyen sman len pa'i dus nyid na 'am /
analyzed: brjod par bya ste / bsod snyoms dang nad kyi rkyen sman len pa'i dus nyid na 'am /
translated: It is said:üîΩAt the time of receiving alms and medicine for illness,

original: khams dang po dang / chos gos dang / mal stan dang por rnyed pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: khams dang po dang / chos gos dang / mal stan dang por rnyed pa'i dus su'o //
translated: or at the time of first obtaining robes and bedding.

original: gzhan dag ni longs spyod pa yongs su longs spyod pa'i dus su bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni longs spyod pa yongs su longs spyod pa'i dus su bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say: It should be done at the time of using the enjoyments.

original: kha cig na re nyin re zhing dus gcig gi tshe na bya'o zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: kha cig na re nyin re zhing dus gcig gi tshe na bya'o zhes 'dod do //
translated: Some say: It should be done once a day at one time.

original: la la ni nyin re zhing dus gcig gi tshe bdag nyid ni rkyen gyis 'tsho'o zhes so sor rtog pan thams cad so sor brtags par gyur pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: la la ni nyin re zhing dus gcig gi tshe bdag nyid ni rkyen gyis 'tsho'o zhes so sor rtog pan thams cad so sor brtags par gyur pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: When one discerns oneself at one time each day, ‚ÄúI live by conditions,‚Äù then all is discerned.

original: yo byad bzhi po de dag kyang gang zag gi dbye bas longs spyod rnam pa ltar gyur te /
analyzed: yo byad bzhi po de dag kyang gang zag gi dbye bas longs spyod rnam pa ltar gyur te /
translated: Those four requisites are also enjoyed in the same way as enjoyments, according to the classification of persons.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba rnams kyi ni rku bas longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba rnams kyi ni rku bas longs spyod pa'o //
translated: For those with faulty morality, they are enjoyed by theft.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin zhing yid la byed pa la mngon bar mi brtson pa rnams kyi ni ngo tsha ba med par longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin zhing yid la byed pa la mngon bar mi brtson pa rnams kyi ni ngo tsha ba med par longs spyod pa'o //
translated: For those who are moral but do not strive in mental attention, it is enjoyment without shame.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan zhing lhag pa'i sems la mngon par brtson pa rnams kyi ni rjes su gnang ba la longs @15a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan zhing lhag pa'i sems la mngon par brtson pa rnams kyi ni rjes su gnang ba la longs @15a * //
translated: For those who are moral and strive in higher thought, it is enjoyment with permission.

original: spyod pa'o // slob ma rnams kyi ni skal ba la longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa'o // slob ma rnams kyi ni skal ba la longs spyod pa'o //
translated: For disciples, it is enjoyment of their share.

original: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ni dbang phyug la longs spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyi ni dbang phyug la longs spyod pa yin no //
translated: For arhats, it is enjoyment of sovereignty.

original: de la 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa ni so sor thar pa'i sdom ba'i 'khor yin te /
analyzed: de la 'tsho ba rnam par dag pa ni so sor thar pa'i sdom ba'i 'khor yin te /
translated: Therein, pure livelihood is the retinue of the vow of individual liberation.

original: nyon mongs pas 'tsho ba'i thabs kyi rtsol ba las ldog pa ni lus dang ngag gi sdom pa sla ba yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pas 'tsho ba'i thabs kyi rtsol ba las ldog pa ni lus dang ngag gi sdom pa sla ba yin no //
translated: Turning away from the effort of livelihood by afflictions is the easy vow of body and speech.

original: dbang po sdom pa ni gnyi ga'i yin te /
analyzed: dbang po sdom pa ni gnyi ga'i yin te /
translated: The vow of the sense faculties is both.

original: sems bsrungs nas lus dang ngag gi las bsrungs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems bsrungs nas lus dang ngag gi las bsrungs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Having guarded the mind, one guards the actions of body and speech.

original: kha nam tho ba'i yo byad ni dbang po sdom pa'i 'khor yin te /
analyzed: kha nam tho ba'i yo byad ni dbang po sdom pa'i 'khor yin te /
translated: The equipment of the weapon of the sword is the retinue of the faculty of selfrestraint.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dngos po'i rkyen rnams la rig pas tshad tsam du so sor brtags te rjes su skyong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dngos po'i rkyen rnams la rig pas tshad tsam du so sor brtags te rjes su skyong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, by means of the knowledge of the conditions of the things of the passions, one examines them to the extent of the measure and then cares for them.

original: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang dad pa'i stobs te yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang dad pa'i stobs te yongs su rdzogs par bya ste /
translated: The vow of individual emancipation is the power of faith, which is to be perfected.

original: de ni de dang bral bar gyur na bsams bzhin du bslab pa las 'da' bas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni de dang bral bar gyur na bsams bzhin du bslab pa las 'da' bas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: For, if one is separated from that, one is defiled by transgressing the precepts, as one wishes.

original: de yang mdo las dge slong dag ji tsam du dge ba'i chos rnams la dad pa nye bar gyur pa de srid so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa dang / brtson pa'i stobs la ston par 'gyur ba yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de yang mdo las dge slong dag ji tsam du dge ba'i chos rnams la dad pa nye bar gyur pa de srid so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa dang / brtson pa'i stobs la ston par 'gyur ba yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And it is as stated in the scripture: ‚ÄúMonks, to the extent that faith in the good qualities is present, to that extent the vow of individual emancipation, the pure livelihood, and the power of striving are present.‚Äù

original: de yang le lo can dang mi mthun pa tshol ba la zhugs pas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang le lo can dang mi mthun pa tshol ba la zhugs pas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And that is defiled by the one who is lazy and who is engaged in seeking what is not conducive.

original: dbang po sdom pa'i ni khrel yod pa dang / dran pa'i stobs la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po sdom pa'i ni khrel yod pa dang / dran pa'i stobs la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par bya'o //
translated: The restraint of the sense-faculties is perfected by means of the power of conscience and shame, and by means of the power of mindfulness.

original: de yang de dang bral na skye mched gang yang rung ba'i nyon mongs pas dri ma can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang de dang bral na skye mched gang yang rung ba'i nyon mongs pas dri ma can du 'gyur ro //
translated: And if one is without these, one becomes defiled by the defilements of the sense-fields.

original: rkyen gyi yo byad longs spyod pa yang shes rab kyi stobs la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rkyen gyi yo byad longs spyod pa yang shes rab kyi stobs la gnas pas yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The enjoyment of the conditions of life is perfected by means of the power of wisdom.

original: de yang yang dag par so sor rtog pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang yang dag par so sor rtog pa la zhugs pa rnams kyi ni rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And that is purified for those who are engaged in correct discrimination.

original: de bas blo ldan bslab pa'i stobs gnas pa //
analyzed: de bas blo ldan bslab pa'i stobs gnas pa //
translated: Therefore, the wise one, abiding in the power of morality,

original: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa nyid du 'gyur //üîΩde rnams dag pas yid kyi sdug bsngal ni //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam par dag pa nyid du 'gyur // de rnams dag pas yid kyi sdug bsngal ni //
translated: attains the purity of morality.üîΩAnd by means of that purity, he draws to himself

original: zhi bar byed pa'i ting 'dzin ma lus 'dren //
analyzed: zhi bar byed pa'i ting 'dzin ma lus 'dren //
translated: all the concentrations which bring about the pacification of mental suffering.

original: tshul khrims 'chal las nyes mang 'byung 'gyur bar //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal las nyes mang 'byung 'gyur bar //
translated: One should think about the many faults which arise from immorality,

original: yang dag bsams la tshul khrims ma brten par //
analyzed: yang dag bsams la tshul khrims ma brten par //
translated: and not rely on morality for the sake of those.

original: gnas pa'i cho ga la ni 'bad bya ste //
analyzed: gnas pa'i cho ga la ni 'bad bya ste //
translated: One should strive for the rite of abiding,

original: tshul khrims las byung yon tan mang po mthong //
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung yon tan mang po mthong //
translated: seeing the many virtues arising from morality.

original: de la tshul khrims 'chal ba la ni 'gyod pa'i me rnam par @15b 'bar par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la tshul khrims 'chal ba la ni 'gyod pa'i me rnam par @15b 'bar par 'gyur la /
translated: For the immoral, the fire of remorse blazes up.

original: 'gyod pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang mya ngan dang zhum pa'i dri mas sbags pa'i 'byung gnas yin zhing /
analyzed: 'gyod pa ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang mya ngan dang zhum pa'i dri mas sbags pa'i 'byung gnas yin zhing /
translated: Remorse is the source of improper mental activity, and the stain of sorrow and depression.

original: ngan 'gro'i las gnyis med pa yin pa dang / sman par bya ba'i dngos po dang / grags pa ma yin ba'i skye gnas dang / 'tshe ba rnams kyi gzhi dang / legs par spyod pa rnams kyi sgrib pa dang / skye bo ngan pa dang 'dres pa'i 'obs dang /
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i las gnyis med pa yin pa dang / sman par bya ba'i dngos po dang / grags pa ma yin ba'i skye gnas dang / 'tshe ba rnams kyi gzhi dang / legs par spyod pa rnams kyi sgrib pa dang / skye bo ngan pa dang 'dres pa'i 'obs dang /
translated: It is the root of the two actions leading to bad transmigrations, the basis of the three poisons, the basis of the four evil destinies, the basis of the five evils, the basis of the six stains, the basis of the seven improper mental activities, the basis of the eight worldly dharmas, the basis of the nine causes of hypocrisy, and the basis of the ten nonvirtuous actions.

original: yon tan brjed pa dang / sems sun 'byin par byed pa dang / yon tan gyi phyogs 'dzin pa'i de'i bla ma dang / slob ma dang / grogs rnams kyi ngo tsha ba'i gzhi dang / sdug bsngal brgya stong dpag tu med pa'i gzhir gyur pa dang /
analyzed: yon tan brjed pa dang / sems sun 'byin par byed pa dang / yon tan gyi phyogs 'dzin pa'i de'i bla ma dang / slob ma dang / grogs rnams kyi ngo tsha ba'i gzhi dang / sdug bsngal brgya stong dpag tu med pa'i gzhir gyur pa dang /
translated: It is the basis for forgetting good qualities, for being disgusted with the mind, for being ashamed of one‚Äôs teacher, disciples, and friends who are on the side of good qualities, and for the basis of immeasurable hundreds of thousands of sufferings.

original: de yongs su 'dzin pa'i gang zag chos kyi mdangs nyams par byed pa dang / so ma btang ba'i chu snod ltar yon tan rin po che'i snod ma yin par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de yongs su 'dzin pa'i gang zag chos kyi mdangs nyams par byed pa dang / so ma btang ba'i chu snod ltar yon tan rin po che'i snod ma yin par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is the basis for a person who holds it to lose the luster of the Dharma and to not be a vessel for precious good qualities, like a water vessel that is not fired.

original: nyes pa rnams kyi snod du 'gyur ba dang / phongs pa rnams kyi dben nyid dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / dam pa rnams kyis bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / sdig pa'i dri ma can gyi las byed pa rnams dang /
analyzed: nyes pa rnams kyi snod du 'gyur ba dang / phongs pa rnams kyi dben nyid dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i phyogs su gyur pa dang / dam pa rnams kyis bgrod par bya ba ma yin pa dang / sdig pa'i dri ma can gyi las byed pa rnams dang /
translated: It is the basis for becoming a vessel for faults, for being destitute, for being on the side of the non-holy, for not being the object of approach for the holy, and for engaging in sinful, defiled actions.

original: skal ba mnyam ba dang / yongs su dag pa'i las can gyi skyes bu dam pa dang / skal ba mi 'dra ba yin /
analyzed: skal ba mnyam ba dang / yongs su dag pa'i las can gyi skyes bu dam pa dang / skal ba mi 'dra ba yin /
translated: The person who has good karma is a holy person who has the same good fortune as the holy person.

original: khyad par rtogs pa yin /üîΩskal ba med pa yin /
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa yin / skal ba med pa yin /
translated: The person who has different karma is a person who has different good fortune.üîΩThe person who has no good fortune is a person who has no good fortune at all.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob pa'i re ba med pa yin te /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu thob pa'i re ba med pa yin te /
translated: The person who has no hope of attaining the fruit of the religious life is a person who has no hope of attaining the fruit of the religious life.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kha na ma thob dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kha na ma thob dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because his bodily, verbal and mental actions are accompanied by evil.

original: gos nag nog can dang 'dra bar mdog mi sdug pa yin te /
analyzed: gos nag nog can dang 'dra bar mdog mi sdug pa yin te /
translated: He is like a dirty garment, for he is of bad color.

original: de nyes par spyad pa'i rjes su byed pa la brten ba rnams yun ring por sdug bsngal ba thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyes par spyad pa'i rjes su byed pa la brten ba rnams yun ring por sdug bsngal ba thob par 'gyur ba'i phyir sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: He is an experiencer of suffering, for he is based on the practice of evil conduct and will obtain suffering for a long time.

original: sbyin gnas rnams las 'bras bu chung dun du byed pa nyid kyis rin thang chung ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyin gnas rnams las 'bras bu chung dun du byed pa nyid kyis rin thang chung ba yin no //
translated: He is of little value, for he produces a small result from the fields of merit.

original: mi gtsang bar byed pa'i chos dang ldan pas na dur khrod kyi gnas ltar mi gtsang ba yin ;
analyzed: mi gtsang bar byed pa'i chos dang ldan pas na dur khrod kyi gnas ltar mi gtsang ba yin ;
translated: He is impure, like a charnel ground, for he is endowed with the quality of impurity.

original: snyan pa ma yin pa'i dris kun tu khyab pas na de dang 'dra ba yin /
analyzed: snyan pa ma yin pa'i dris kun tu khyab pas na de dang 'dra ba yin /
translated: It is similar to a corpse because it is filled with the stench of bad reputation.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams kyis spang bar bya ba yin pas na de dang 'dra bar spang bar bya ba yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa rnams kyis spang bar bya ba yin pas na de dang 'dra bar spang bar bya ba yin /
translated: It is similar to something to be abandoned because it is to be abandoned by those possessing ethical discipline.

original: gang zag skal ba mnyam pa rnams dang gcig tu gnas par rung bas na de dang 'dra bar skyes bu sbrul lta bu @16a * //
analyzed: gang zag skal ba mnyam pa rnams dang gcig tu gnas par rung bas na de dang 'dra bar skyes bu sbrul lta bu @16a * //
translated: It is similar to a person who is a fraud because it is not suitable to live together with a person of equal status.

original: yin / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis chos nyid blta bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dur khrod kyi gnas ltar skye ba'i tshogs chen pos cho nges 'debs par bya ba yin /
analyzed: yin / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis chos nyid blta bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dur khrod kyi gnas ltar skye ba'i tshogs chen pos cho nges 'debs par bya ba yin /
translated: It is similar to a charnel ground because it is a place of wailing by a great assembly of beings who are not to be viewed by those who are wise and who are spiritual friends.

original: dud 'gro 'dra bar mnog chung zhing nag nog dang bcas pa'i bud med dang / reg pas me'i phung por ring por mi thogs par 'jug pa'i rgyur gyur cing gnas mal 'bar ba la gnas shing 'khyud pa dang / yi dags kyi sdug bsngal du 'jug par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: dud 'gro 'dra bar mnog chung zhing nag nog dang bcas pa'i bud med dang / reg pas me'i phung por ring por mi thogs par 'jug pa'i rgyur gyur cing gnas mal 'bar ba la gnas shing 'khyud pa dang / yi dags kyi sdug bsngal du 'jug par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: They are the cause for entering the suffering of the hungry ghosts.

original: skra'i thag pas byin par bsrung zhing mdung thung 'bar ba snying gar drag tu yang dag yang du bsnun pas sdug bsdul tsha zhing rno ba yin /
analyzed: skra'i thag pas byin par bsrung zhing mdung thung 'bar ba snying gar drag tu yang dag yang du bsnun pas sdug bsdul tsha zhing rno ba yin /
translated: They are protected by a rope of hair and are repeatedly and violently stabbed in the heart with a flaming spear.

original: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo'i skye bo'i dmod pa nye bar gnas pas nyin re zhing nye bar gtses pa yin /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dang rigs kyi bu mo'i skye bo'i dmod pa nye bar gnas pas nyin re zhing nye bar gtses pa yin /
translated: They are constantly tormented by the curses of sons and daughters of noble families.

original: lcags kyi leb ma 'bar bas bsreg pas shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i chos gos gyon pa nyid yin /
analyzed: lcags kyi leb ma 'bar bas bsreg pas shin tu sdug bsngal ba'i chos gos gyon pa nyid yin /
translated: They wear Dharma robes that are very painful, since they are burned by flaming iron plates.

original: lcags kyi thu lum shin tu 'bar pa'i zas za bas shin tu tsha bar rnam par smin pa'i bsod nams la spyod pa yin /
analyzed: lcags kyi thu lum shin tu 'bar pa'i zas za bas shin tu tsha bar rnam par smin pa'i bsod nams la spyod pa yin /
translated: They enjoy the merit of very hot ripening, since they eat food that is a very hot ball of iron.

original: lcags kyi bum pa shin tu 'bar ba'i nang du gnas pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad par rnam par smin pa'i mal snyan la yongs su longs spyod pas nyin re zhing rnam par bcom pa yin pas skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis mchog tu snying rje bar bya ba'i
analyzed: lcags kyi bum pa shin tu 'bar ba'i nang du gnas pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad par rnam par smin pa'i mal snyan la yongs su longs spyod pas nyin re zhing rnam par bcom pa yin pas skyes bu dam pa rnams kyis mchog tu snying rje bar bya ba'i
translated: They experience the unbearable ripening of suffering that is like a bed of thorns.

original: dngos por gyur ba yin /
analyzed: dngos por gyur ba yin /
translated: They are destroyed day after day.üîΩThey are objects of supreme compassion for holy beings.

original: ro bsregs pa'i mgal dum ltar dgos pa med cing gnyi ga'i don las nyams pa yin /
analyzed: ro bsregs pa'i mgal dum ltar dgos pa med cing gnyi ga'i don las nyams pa yin /
translated: They are like a piece of charcoal from a cremation fire. They have no purpose and they have failed in the aims of both themselves and others.

original: skye bo dam pa 'dus pa'i nang du 'jigs pa dang bcas shing /
analyzed: skye bo dam pa 'dus pa'i nang du 'jigs pa dang bcas shing /
translated: They are in the midst of an assembly of holy beings and they are fearful.

original: 'jig rten gyis yid brtan du mi rung ba yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyis yid brtan du mi rung ba yin /
translated: They are untrustworthy to the world.

original: rjes su brtan par mi nus pa yin /
analyzed: rjes su brtan par mi nus pa yin /
translated: They are unable to be steadfast.

original: lha rnams kyi yang yid du mi 'ong ba yin /üîΩtshul khrims nyams pa'i gtam thos nas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: lha rnams kyi yang yid du mi 'ong ba yin / tshul khrims nyams pa'i gtam thos nas sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba yin /
translated: They are not even pleasing to the gods.üîΩThey suffer when they hear about the decline of moral discipline.

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa'i gtam thos nas rjes su 'gyod par gyur pa yin /
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa'i gtam thos nas rjes su 'gyod par gyur pa yin /
translated: They regret when they hear about the perfection of moral discipline.

original: 'di thos pa dang spobs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gzung bar 'os par mi 'gyur te /üîΩdur khrod kyi me dang 'dra ba yin /üîΩde rmongs bzhin 'che ba'i dus byed par 'gyur zhing shi ba'i 'og tu yang dmyal ba dang yi dags kyi skye ba len par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: 'di thos pa dang spobs pa la sogs pa'i yon tan gzung bar 'os par mi 'gyur te / dur khrod kyi me dang 'dra ba yin / de rmongs bzhin 'che ba'i dus byed par 'gyur zhing shi ba'i 'og tu yang dmyal ba dang yi dags kyi skye ba len par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: It will not be worthy of being received as a good quality, such as being learned and eloquent.üîΩIt will be like a cemetery fire.üîΩOne will die in a state of confusion and after death will take birth as a hell being or hungry ghost.üîΩ

original: lo grangs brgya phrag mang po shin tu 'das pa na de las thar na yang de'i rnam par smin pa'i lhag ma lus pas 'di na tshe thung ba nyid yin /üîΩlongs spyod chung ba yin /üîΩ@16b 'gran zla dang bcas pa gnas pas zil gyis gnon pa yin /üîΩskur ba mang ba yin /üîΩyid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra thos par gyur pa yin /üîΩmdza' bo dang nye dus phongs par 'gyur ba yin /üîΩ'khor mi 'dum ba nyid yin /üîΩtshig gzung bar mi 'os pa yin /
analyzed: lo grangs brgya phrag mang po shin tu 'das pa na de las thar na yang de'i rnam par smin pa'i lhag ma lus pas 'di na tshe thung ba nyid yin /üîΩlongs spyod chung ba yin /üîΩ@16b 'gran zla dang bcas pa gnas pas zil gyis gnon pa yin /üîΩskur ba mang ba yin /üîΩyid du mi 'ong ba'i sgra thos par gyur pa yin /üîΩmdza' bo dang nye dus phongs par 'gyur ba yin /üîΩ'khor mi 'dum ba nyid yin /üîΩtshig gzung bar mi 'os pa yin /
