original: tshul khrims dang lta pas phongs pa'i rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal len pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims dang lta pas phongs pa'i rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal len pa yin no //
translated: The ripening of a person who is poor in morality and view is suffering.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pas bsod nams chung ngu sogs //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pas bsod nams chung ngu sogs //
translated: The ripening of a person who is poor in morality is small merit,

original: rnam smin de yang mthar ni gtugs par 'gyur //
analyzed: rnam smin de yang mthar ni gtugs par 'gyur //
translated: and that also is exhausted in the end.

original: rigs ni dma' par skye ba 'thob 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: rigs ni dma' par skye ba 'thob 'gyur zhing //
translated: He is born into a low family,

original: de rtogs sdug bsngal mang po'ang nyams myong 'gyur //
analyzed: de rtogs sdug bsngal mang po'ang nyams myong 'gyur //
translated: and he experiences many sufferings.

original: las ni ngan pas de ru 'phangs nas ni //
analyzed: las ni ngan pas de ru 'phangs nas ni //
translated: Having been projected there by bad karma,

original: dman pa'i rigs su gyur pa'i las de yis //
analyzed: dman pa'i rigs su gyur pa'i las de yis //
translated: by that karma which has become a low family,üîΩhe is not trained in morality, enters into what is not good,

original: tshul khrims ma bslabs dam pa min la 'jug / dmyal ba'i me ni mtha' med par ltung 'gyur //
analyzed: tshul khrims ma bslabs dam pa min la 'jug / dmyal ba'i me ni mtha' med par ltung 'gyur //
translated: and falls into the endless fire of hell.

original: tshul khrims brtan par gnas pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir de la sogs pa tshul khrims 'chal ba'i nyes pa yang dag par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims brtan par gnas pa bskyed par bya ba'i phyir de la sogs pa tshul khrims 'chal ba'i nyes pa yang dag par bsam par bya'o //
translated: In order to generate firm abiding in morality, one should contemplate the faults of immorality in this way and so forth.

original: tshul khrims gnas pa'i yon tan ni de las go bzlog pa yin par yongs su brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims gnas pa'i yon tan ni de las go bzlog pa yin par yongs su brtag par bya'o //
translated: The virtues of abiding in morality should be thoroughly understood as the opposite of those.

original: tshul khrims yang dag bsrung bar gyur na ni //
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag bsrung bar gyur na ni //
translated: But when you keep moral discipline well,

original: 'gyod pa'i me ni zhi bar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: 'gyod pa'i me ni zhi bar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: The fire of regret is pacified.

original: dga' dang rab gus sad par byed pa'i rgyus //
analyzed: dga' dang rab gus sad par byed pa'i rgyus //
translated: The causes for arousing joy and respect

original: lus dang ngag gi dge ba skyed par byed //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi dge ba skyed par byed //
translated: Give rise to virtue of body and speech.üîΩThe path to enter the city of liberationüîΩAnd the path to achieve the status of human or divine

original: thar pa'i grong du 'jug pa'i lam nyid dang // mi dang lha dbang grub lam gnyis pa med //
analyzed: thar pa'i grong du 'jug pa'i lam nyid dang // mi dang lha dbang grub lam gnyis pa med //
translated: Are not a second path that produces

original: grags dang snyan dang bde ba skyed pa'i rgyus //
analyzed: grags dang snyan dang bde ba skyed pa'i rgyus //
translated: Fame, renown, and happiness.

original: tshe dang smad pas tshugs pa med pa yin //üîΩbla ma slob ma mdza' bshes ngo mi 'gyur //
analyzed: tshe dang smad pas tshugs pa med pa yin // bla ma slob ma mdza' bshes ngo mi 'gyur //
translated: You are not overcome by life or slander,

original: ma smad bde ba'i sgor ni gyur pa yin ;
analyzed: ma smad bde ba'i sgor ni gyur pa yin ;
translated: And you become a door to the happiness of mother and child.

original: / skye bo dam pa dang 'dre 'dren par byed //
analyzed: / skye bo dam pa dang 'dre 'dren par byed //
translated: You are led to associate with holy beings

original: yon tan skyed pa'i cho gar gyur pa yin //
analyzed: yon tan skyed pa'i cho gar gyur pa yin //
translated: And become a ritual for producing good qualities.

original: 'di dang ldan na mkhas pa'i yon tan ni //
analyzed: 'di dang ldan na mkhas pa'i yon tan ni //
translated: When you have this, the good qualities of the wise

original: chen po rnams kyi snod du gyur pa yin //
analyzed: chen po rnams kyi snod du gyur pa yin //
translated: Become a vessel for the great.

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i phongs pa ci yod pa //
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba'i phongs pa ci yod pa //
translated: Whatever poverty there is of moral discipline

original: nyes pa de dang de ni rnam par spong //
analyzed: nyes pa de dang de ni rnam par spong //
translated: You completely abandon those faults.

original: dam pa'i chos kyis bgrang bar 'gyur ba dang // yon tan la dga' bar yang go bar byed //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyis bgrang bar 'gyur ba dang // yon tan la dga' bar yang go bar byed //
translated: They will be counted among the righteous, and will be known for their love of virtue.

original: khyad par rtogs pa'i skal bar ldan pa dang // bdag nyid yon tan dag gis bsngags 'os 'gyur //
analyzed: khyad par rtogs pa'i skal bar ldan pa dang // bdag nyid yon tan dag gis bsngags 'os 'gyur //
translated: They will be fortunate in their understanding of the distinctive realizations, and will become praiseworthy for their own virtues.

original: skye bo dam pa rnams dang skal mnyam gyi //
analyzed: skye bo dam pa rnams dang skal mnyam gyi //
translated: They will be equal in fortune to the holy beings.

original: rang gi yon tan rgya chen dman dang na //
analyzed: rang gi yon tan rgya chen dman dang na //
translated: Their own virtues will be extensive, and they will be

original: @17a * // tshul khrims 'chal ba'i nyes pas mi gos shing //
analyzed: @17a * // tshul khrims 'chal ba'i nyes pas mi gos shing //
translated: unstained by the faults of immorality.

original: de las byung ba'i sdug bsngal thob mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i sdug bsngal thob mi 'gyur //
translated: They will not experience the suffering that arises from that.

original: mi yi bdag po sum cu rtsa gsum bdag / gal te 'dod na srid pa zad pa nyid //
analyzed: mi yi bdag po sum cu rtsa gsum bdag / gal te 'dod na srid pa zad pa nyid //
translated: If the lord of humans, the lord of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three,

original: tshul khrims rnam dag des ni thob 'gyur la //
analyzed: tshul khrims rnam dag des ni thob 'gyur la //
translated: wishes to, he can end his existence through pure morality.

original: smon lam grub pa'i rtsa ba 'ang tshul khrims yin //
analyzed: smon lam grub pa'i rtsa ba 'ang tshul khrims yin //
translated: Morality is also the root of fulfilling one‚Äôs aspirations.

original: de ltar tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba 'di'i yon tan dang skyon yang dag pa bltas la /
analyzed: de ltar tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims 'chal ba 'di'i yon tan dang skyon yang dag pa bltas la /
translated: Thus, having seen the virtues and faults of those who are moral and those who are immoral,

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa las /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa las /
translated: one should avoid immoralityüîΩand

original: sems shin tu 'khums shing de la 'jug par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sems shin tu 'khums shing de la 'jug par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: The mind does not shrink from that, nor does it turn away.

original: tshul khrims la yang sems kyi spro ba 'phel ba dang / dga' zhing mang du gces par byed de de la dga' zhing gces par sems pa mngon par 'phel zhing gus pas srung bar byed do //üîΩyid bzhin nor ltar bsam pa'i dbang gis don ster cing //
analyzed: tshul khrims la yang sems kyi spro ba 'phel ba dang / dga' zhing mang du gces par byed de de la dga' zhing gces par sems pa mngon par 'phel zhing gus pas srung bar byed do // yid bzhin nor ltar bsam pa'i dbang gis don ster cing //
translated: Rather, the mind becomes more and more eager for morality, and it delights in it and cherishes it more and more.üîΩIt is like a wish-fulfilling gem, granting the desired objects.

original: rigs pa lta bur mngon par 'dod pa'i rdzas sgrub byed //
analyzed: rigs pa lta bur mngon par 'dod pa'i rdzas sgrub byed //
translated: It is like a mine, producing the desired substances.

original: dbul pos lha las bum pa bzang po rnyed 'dra zhing //
analyzed: dbul pos lha las bum pa bzang po rnyed 'dra zhing //
translated: It is like a poor person finding a treasure.

original: bsngags 'os rang lus mi gcig lta bur bsrung bya yin //
analyzed: bsngags 'os rang lus mi gcig lta bur bsrung bya yin //
translated: It is like a praiseworthy person guarding his own reputation.

original: nus shing phan la rjes brtson mthun pa'i grogs 'dra zhing //
analyzed: nus shing phan la rjes brtson mthun pa'i grogs 'dra zhing //
translated: It is like a capable friend who is helpful, persevering, and agreeable.

original: shes ldan yon tan la dga' sdug pa'i bu gcig mtshungs //
analyzed: shes ldan yon tan la dga' sdug pa'i bu gcig mtshungs //
translated: It is like a wise person who delights in good qualities, like a loving mother.

original: khyim du gter ni rgya chen byung ba dang mtshungs shing /
analyzed: khyim du gter ni rgya chen byung ba dang mtshungs shing /
translated: It is like a great treasure that has arisen in one‚Äôs home.

original: nad dang rga pa'i sdug bsngal dang bral srog dang mtshungs //
analyzed: nad dang rga pa'i sdug bsngal dang bral srog dang mtshungs //
translated: It is like life itself, free from the suffering of sickness and old age.

original: grong khyer mi dbang lta bur yon tan phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: grong khyer mi dbang lta bur yon tan phun sum tshogs //
translated: Like a king of cities, it is the perfect source of good qualities.

original: nang gshin 'bru ni phun sum tshogs pa'i zhing sa 'dra //
analyzed: nang gshin 'bru ni phun sum tshogs pa'i zhing sa 'dra //
translated: Like a field, it is the perfect source of inner harvest.

original: nad rnams ma lus sel ba'i sman gyi mchog 'dra ste //
analyzed: nad rnams ma lus sel ba'i sman gyi mchog 'dra ste //
translated: Like the best of medicines, it cures all illnesses.

original: tshul khrims de las lhag pa'i gus pas de bsrung bya //
analyzed: tshul khrims de las lhag pa'i gus pas de bsrung bya //
translated: So guard morality with greater respect than you do anything else.

original: legs pa'i lam bstan pa las tshul khrims rnams par dag pa zhes bya ba phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o /
analyzed: legs pa'i lam bstan pa las tshul khrims rnams par dag pa zhes bya ba phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o /
translated: This is the first perfection, the purity of morality, which is taught as the good path.

original: // / de ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa 'dis tshul khrims yongs su dag pas ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa'i yan lag gi gtso bo sbyangs pa'i yon yang dag par blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: // / de ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa 'dis tshul khrims yongs su dag pas ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa'i yan lag gi gtso bo sbyangs pa'i yon yang dag par blang bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, this spiritual practitioner, through pure morality, should take up the perfect branches of the perfection of meditative concentration, the perfect qualities of purification.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pas sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs pas ni 'dod pa chung ba nyid dang // chog shes pa nyid dang / rab tu dben pa nyid dang / nyon mongs pa spong ba dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / gso sla ba dang /üîΩdgang sla ba dang / bde ba la reg par gnas pa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pas sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs pas ni 'dod pa chung ba nyid dang // chog shes pa nyid dang / rab tu dben pa nyid dang / nyon mongs pa spong ba dang / brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / gso sla ba dang / dgang sla ba dang / bde ba la reg par gnas pa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: They are the basis for seclusion, because one who is content with little and satisfied with what he gets is not attached to the enjoyment of cyclic existence.üîΩThey are the basis for abandonment of defilement, because one who is secluded abandons defilement.üîΩThey are the basis for exertion of vigor, because one who has abandoned defilement is vigorous.üîΩThey are the basis for ease of sustenance, because one who is vigorous is content with little.üîΩThey are the basis for ease of protection, because one who is content with little is satisfied with whatever he gets.üîΩThey are the basis for ease of thought, because one who is satisfied with what he gets is not attached to the enjoyment of cyclic existence.üîΩThey are the basis for fewness of duties, because one who is not attached to the enjoyment of cyclic existence does not perform many duties.

original: @17b bya ba nyung bas ni tshul khrims bsrun gbar 'gyur ba ni ting nge 'dzin 'grub pa'i tshogs yin zhing sdon gyi 'phags pa'i rigs kyi lus su mthun pa dang / rab tu dad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: @17b bya ba nyung bas ni tshul khrims bsrun gbar 'gyur ba ni ting nge 'dzin 'grub pa'i tshogs yin zhing sdon gyi 'phags pa'i rigs kyi lus su mthun pa dang / rab tu dad par byed pa yin no //
translated: They are the basis for purity of livelihood, because one who has few duties is pure in his livelihood.

original: de las sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis ni 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: de las sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis ni 'di dag yin te /
translated: These are the twelve ascetic practices.

original: dgon pa pa nyid dang / phyag dar khrod pa nyid dang / bsod snyoms pa nyid dang / stan gcig pa nyid dang / cog pu ba nyid dang / zas phyis mi len pa nyid dang / chos gos gsum pa pa nyid dang / phying pa ba nyid dang /
analyzed: dgon pa pa nyid dang / phyag dar khrod pa nyid dang / bsod snyoms pa nyid dang / stan gcig pa nyid dang / cog pu ba nyid dang / zas phyis mi len pa nyid dang / chos gos gsum pa pa nyid dang / phying pa ba nyid dang /
translated: The ascetic practices are: living in the forest, wearing robes made of rags, living on alms, having only one sitting, being a one-bowl ascetic, not taking food after rising from one's seat, being a three-piece-robe ascetic, being a refuse-rag ascetic,

original: gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid dang / dur khrod pa nyid dang / shing drung pa nyid dang / bla gab med pa nyid dang ngo //
analyzed: gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid dang / dur khrod pa nyid dang / shing drung pa nyid dang / bla gab med pa nyid dang ngo //
translated: living in a charnel ground, living at the foot of a tree, and living without shelter.

original: de la dam bca' ba dang rjes su mthun par 'di dgon par gnas pa yin bas na dgon pa pa'o //
analyzed: de la dam bca' ba dang rjes su mthun par 'di dgon par gnas pa yin bas na dgon pa pa'o //
translated: The ascetic practice of living in the forest is called forest because one lives in the forest in accordance with one's vow.

original: de'i dngos po nyid ni dgon pa pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po nyid ni dgon pa pa nyid do //
translated: The state of that is the nature of a forest dweller.

original: dam bca' ba yang de nas brtsams te grong gi mthar gnas pa spang bar bgyi zhing dgon par gnas par bgyi'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dam bca' ba yang de nas brtsams te grong gi mthar gnas pa spang bar bgyi zhing dgon par gnas par bgyi'o zhes bya'o //
translated: The vow is to abandon living on the outskirts of a village and to live in the forest.

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan lhag ma rnams la rim pa bzhin nyid kyis de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'o //
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan lhag ma rnams la rim pa bzhin nyid kyis de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba'o //
translated: The other ascetic practices are to abandon their opposites in the proper order.

original: de la dgon pa pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di yin te //üîΩdgon par gnas la mngon dga' ting nge 'dzin //
analyzed: de la dgon pa pa nyid kyi yon tan ni 'di yin te // dgon par gnas la mngon dga' ting nge 'dzin //
translated: The advantages of living in the wilderness are as follows.

original: thob pa'am yongs su bsrung bar nus pa yin //üîΩgrong nang gnas rnams g-yeng ba'i nyes pa yis //
analyzed: thob pa'am yongs su bsrung bar nus pa yin // grong nang gnas rnams g-yeng ba'i nyes pa yis //
translated: The one who delights in living in the wilderness is able to attain and maintain meditative concentration.

original: sems ni rnam bcom nyer zhi thob mi 'gyur //üîΩde ru gnas pa nyid la phyag dar khrod //
analyzed: sems ni rnam bcom nyer zhi thob mi 'gyur // de ru gnas pa nyid la phyag dar khrod //
translated: But those who live in towns, their minds destroyed by the faults of distraction, will not attain tranquility.

original: spyod pa lhag ma sbyangs pas rnam mdzes te //üîΩg-yul du mda' skyob phub bcas go bgos shing //
analyzed: spyod pa lhag ma sbyangs pas rnam mdzes te // g-yul du mda' skyob phub bcas go bgos shing //
translated: The one who lives in the wilderness is beautiful with the remaining aspects of mendicancy.üîΩHe is like a warrior who goes into battle fully armored, with shield and helmet.

original: mtshon cha phun tshogs ldan pas 'thab dang mtshungs //
analyzed: mtshon cha phun tshogs ldan pas 'thab dang mtshungs //
translated: He is like a warrior who goes into battle fully armored, with shield and helmet.

original: dgon par gnyid log gyur kyang dben par ni //üîΩgnas pas bde gshegs thugs mnyes byed nyid yin //üîΩgrong gnas shin tu mnyam par gzhag gyur kyang //
analyzed: dgon par gnyid log gyur kyang dben par ni // gnas pas bde gshegs thugs mnyes byed nyid yin // grong gnas shin tu mnyam par gzhag gyur kyang //
translated: Even if he falls asleep in the wilderness, he is still living in solitude.

original: der ni ring 'dzin bde bar bsrung mi 'gyur //üîΩmdza' dang phrad dang rang gi srog dang ni //
analyzed: der ni ring 'dzin bde bar bsrung mi 'gyur // mdza' dang phrad dang rang gi srog dang ni //
translated: But even if he is in meditative concentration in a town, he is not protected by the happiness of solitude.üîΩHe has no concern for meeting with friends, for his own life,

original: sdug pa'i lus la 'ang ltos pa med par ni //
analyzed: sdug pa'i lus la 'ang ltos pa med par ni //
translated: or even for his own beloved body.

original: bas mtha' dgon par gan te brtson 'grus rtsom //
analyzed: bas mtha' dgon par gan te brtson 'grus rtsom //
translated: He should strive in the forest, in a secluded place.

original: yon tan khyad par gang zhig thob mi 'gyur //
analyzed: yon tan khyad par gang zhig thob mi 'gyur //
translated: What special quality will he not attain?

original: rol mo sna tshogs sgra dang glu yi sgra //
analyzed: rol mo sna tshogs sgra dang glu yi sgra //
translated: The sounds of various musical instruments and songs,

original: g-yeng bar byed pa'i khyad par de dang de //
analyzed: g-yeng bar byed pa'i khyad par de dang de //
translated: all those special things that distract the mind,

original: dgon par med de gang phyir de yid 'ang //
analyzed: dgon par med de gang phyir de yid 'ang //
translated: are not in the forest, because the mind is distracted by them.

original: rnal 'byor la phan sbyor la spyod pa rnams ni de la brten par bya ba'i rigs so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor la phan sbyor la spyod pa rnams ni de la brten par bya ba'i rigs so //
translated: It is proper for those who practice to rely on that.

original: de bzhin du phyag dar @18a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du phyag dar @18a * //
translated: In the same way, the dust-heap dweller

original: khrod pa nyid kyang de bzhin du dam bca' sngon du 'gro bas phyag dar khrod pa 'chang ba'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas phyag dar khrod pa ste /
analyzed: khrod pa nyid kyang de bzhin du dam bca' sngon du 'gro bas phyag dar khrod pa 'chang ba'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas phyag dar khrod pa ste /
translated: is so called because of the vow to live in the dust-heap.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ni phyag dar khrod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ni phyag dar khrod pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of that is dust-heap dwelling.

original: phyag dar khrod pa yang yul dang ngur khrod dang / de'i gnyen 'khor dang / bar dag gi khrod na ngogs ltar gnas pa de las mnyam pa dang / mtho ba nyid yin pa'i phyir phyag dar khrod pa yin pa'am /
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa yang yul dang ngur khrod dang / de'i gnyen 'khor dang / bar dag gi khrod na ngogs ltar gnas pa de las mnyam pa dang / mtho ba nyid yin pa'i phyir phyag dar khrod pa yin pa'am /
translated: The refuse-rag wearer is so called because he wears what others have discarded, which is equal or even superior to what is worn by those who live in towns and charnel grounds, and by their relatives and neighbors.

original: phyag dar 'jig rten pa rnams smod pa yon pas na phyag dar khrod yin la /
analyzed: phyag dar 'jig rten pa rnams smod pa yon pas na phyag dar khrod yin la /
translated: Or else, the refuse-rag wearer is so called because the refuse-rag is despised by worldly people as something crooked.

original: dam bcas pa'i cho gas khyim pas byin pa'i gos spangs pa phyag dar khrod bsags shing rab tu zhi zhing chog shes pa'i dpal dang ldan pa ni phyag dar khrod pa'o //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i cho gas khyim pas byin pa'i gos spangs pa phyag dar khrod bsags shing rab tu zhi zhing chog shes pa'i dpal dang ldan pa ni phyag dar khrod pa'o //
translated: The refuse-rag wearer is one who, by the rite of taking the vow, has abandoned the robes given by householders and who possesses the glory of complete peace and contentment.üîΩMoreover,

original: de yang / dgon par gnas shing chog shes sems kyis ni //
analyzed: de yang / dgon par gnas shing chog shes sems kyis ni //
translated: Dwelling in the forest, with a contented mind,

original: gos ni dman las rab dman gyon byed la //
analyzed: gos ni dman las rab dman gyon byed la //
translated: he wears the worst of poor clothes.

original: 'di la ltos pa drag pa mi 'byung zhing //
analyzed: 'di la ltos pa drag pa mi 'byung zhing //
translated: He does not have strong attachments

original: 'jigs dang 'khrugs pas rmongs par 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: 'jigs dang 'khrugs pas rmongs par 'gyur ma yin //
translated: and is not confused by fear and agitation.

original: gzhan la chog shes yon tan go byed cing //
analyzed: gzhan la chog shes yon tan go byed cing //
translated: He makes others understand the good quality of contentment

original: yid kyang shin tu dang ba kho nar byed //
analyzed: yid kyang shin tu dang ba kho nar byed //
translated: and makes their minds very clear.

original: sems ni gya nom sred las zlog byed la /
analyzed: sems ni gya nom sred las zlog byed la /
translated: The mind is turned away from the craving for fine things,

original: de thob phyir na sdug bsngal skyed mi byed //
analyzed: de thob phyir na sdug bsngal skyed mi byed //
translated: and for the sake of attaining that, one does not create suffering.

original: brlag na'ang rjes su gdung bar 'gyur min te //
analyzed: brlag na'ang rjes su gdung bar 'gyur min te //
translated: Even if lost, there is no subsequent torment,

original: phyag dar khrod ni rnyed par dka' ma yin //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod ni rnyed par dka' ma yin //
translated: and it is not difficult to find a charnel ground.

original: gos phyir khyim pa dang ni 'dris pa yis //
analyzed: gos phyir khyim pa dang ni 'dris pa yis //
translated: By associating with householders for the sake of clothing,

original: rang gi chos kyi las las nyams mi 'gyur //
analyzed: rang gi chos kyi las las nyams mi 'gyur //
translated: one does not fall away from one‚Äôs own religious activities.

original: de ni rkun ma dag gis dogs mi skyed //
analyzed: de ni rkun ma dag gis dogs mi skyed //
translated: One does not arouse fear in thieves,

original: bsrung ba'i 'bad pas de la bcom mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bsrung ba'i 'bad pas de la bcom mi 'gyur //
translated: and through the effort of guarding, one is not destroyed.

original: 'di las phyogs kyi gnod pa'ang skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di las phyogs kyi gnod pa'ang skye mi 'gyur //
translated: From this, harm from the directions also does not arise,

original: de ni log par 'tsho bas nyams mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni log par 'tsho bas nyams mi 'gyur //
translated: and one is not ruined by wrong livelihood.üîΩThis austerity is the practice

original: sbyangs pa 'di ni sngon chad byung ba yi //üîΩthub pa rnams kyang rjes su 'jug pa yin //
analyzed: sbyangs pa 'di ni sngon chad byung ba yi // thub pa rnams kyang rjes su 'jug pa yin //
translated: of the sages of the past.

original: bdud kyi stobs las rgyal bar brtson pa la //
analyzed: bdud kyi stobs las rgyal bar brtson pa la //
translated: In striving to conquer the power of MƒÅra,

original: dpa' bo go bgos lta bur gyur pa yin //üîΩgser gyi 'od 'bar ngang pas mtshan cing dkar //
analyzed: dpa' bo go bgos lta bur gyur pa yin // gser gyi 'od 'bar ngang pas mtshan cing dkar //
translated: one becomes like a hero in armor.üîΩIf one abandons a radiant, white,

original: mdangs ldan spangs na rgyal pas gang bcas pa //
analyzed: mdangs ldan spangs na rgyal pas gang bcas pa //
translated: goose-marked, blazing golden light, it is provided by the king.

original: de phyir lha dang mi yis phyag byas pa'i //
analyzed: de phyir lha dang mi yis phyag byas pa'i //
translated: Therefore, who would not take a vow

original: phyag dar khrod la dam bca' su mi byed //üîΩdman pa gyon zhing zla 'dra'i mdangs ldan pa //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod la dam bca' su mi byed // dman pa gyon zhing zla 'dra'i mdangs ldan pa //
translated: to wear the rag robes revered by gods and men?üîΩEven beautiful, attractive clothes

original: yid du 'ong zhing mdzes pa'i gos dag kyang //
analyzed: yid du 'ong zhing mdzes pa'i gos dag kyang //
translated: that are worn by the lowly and have the luster of the moon,

original: gang zhig phyag dar khrod ni 'chang byed ltar //
analyzed: gang zhig phyag dar khrod ni 'chang byed ltar //
translated: the one who wears the rag robes

original: zhi ba'i phun tshogs de ni skyod mi byed //
analyzed: zhi ba'i phun tshogs de ni skyod mi byed //
translated: does not move from the perfection of peace.

original: dgra bcom stong phrag mang pos 'chad byed pa //
analyzed: dgra bcom stong phrag mang pos 'chad byed pa //
translated: The many thousands of arhats have taught

original: rnyed bla 'di ni kha na ma tho med //
analyzed: rnyed bla 'di ni kha na ma tho med //
translated: that this is a gain that is free of wrongdoing.

original: nyer zhi dpal ldan bsngags @18b 'os rnams kyis brten //
analyzed: nyer zhi dpal ldan bsngags @18b 'os rnams kyis brten //
translated: The glorious ones who are praised by the peaceful

original: phyag dar khrod la dga' bar su mi byed //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod la dga' bar su mi byed //
translated: should rely on the rag robes. Who would not delight in them?

original: rab tu byung nas gang zhig la gnas pa //
analyzed: rab tu byung nas gang zhig la gnas pa //
translated: Whoever, having gone forth,

original: ji skad smras bzhin byed pa de nyid mdzes //
analyzed: ji skad smras bzhin byed pa de nyid mdzes //
translated: acts in accordance with what has been said is beautiful.

original: 'dis ni gang zhig dam bcas byas gyur pa //
analyzed: 'dis ni gang zhig dam bcas byas gyur pa //
translated: This is because the one who has taken a vow

original: de ni de bzhin 'dzin pas sdug pa yin //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin 'dzin pas sdug pa yin //
translated: is dear due to holding to it in just that way.

original: chog shes 'phel ba nor chen pa yi phyir //
analyzed: chog shes 'phel ba nor chen pa yi phyir //
translated: Because contentment is the great wealth,

original: de yis chos ni phun sum tshogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yis chos ni phun sum tshogs par 'gyur //
translated: one will be endowed with the Dharma.

original: chog shes gtam gyis chog shes rab dgar 'gyur //
analyzed: chog shes gtam gyis chog shes rab dgar 'gyur //
translated: One who is satisfied is delighted by the talk of satisfaction.

original: dman las dman rnams gos kyis mgu ba yin //
analyzed: dman las dman rnams gos kyis mgu ba yin //
translated: The inferior are satisfied with clothing.

original: slob dpon gzhan dag ni rang bzhin gyi chos gos dang ldan ba la gnas nas phyag dar khrod pa nyid du dam bca' ba yin no zhes zer mod kyi ;
analyzed: slob dpon gzhan dag ni rang bzhin gyi chos gos dang ldan ba la gnas nas phyag dar khrod pa nyid du dam bca' ba yin no zhes zer mod kyi ;
translated: Other masters say: ‚ÄúThe ascetic who is by nature endowed with the three robes takes the vow of the rag-robe wearer.

original: de ni khyim pa las blangs pa'i gos ma spangs pa'i phyir tshig tsam gyis dngos po sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de ni khyim pa las blangs pa'i gos ma spangs pa'i phyir tshig tsam gyis dngos po sgrub par byed do //
translated: ‚Äù But this is only a verbal proof, for he does not abandon the robes given by householders.

original: khyim pa las blangs pa'i gos lo mang zhig yongs su longs spyod cing 'jog pa de phyag dar khrod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang mos pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: khyim pa las blangs pa'i gos lo mang zhig yongs su longs spyod cing 'jog pa de phyag dar khrod pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang mos pa tsam du zad do //
translated: It is only a matter of faith to say that the ascetic who has many robes given by householders and who stores them is a rag-robe wearer.

original: de las bsod snyoms pa nyid ces bya ba ni dam bca' bas mgron du bos pa spangs te bsod snyoms la rgyu ba yin pas na bsod snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: de las bsod snyoms pa nyid ces bya ba ni dam bca' bas mgron du bos pa spangs te bsod snyoms la rgyu ba yin pas na bsod snyoms pa'o //
translated: The ascetic who lives on alms is so called because he goes on his rounds for alms without accepting invitations.

original: bsod snyoms ni kham gyi zas slong ba zhes bya ba'i don yin te de rnyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsod snyoms ni kham gyi zas slong ba zhes bya ba'i don yin te de rnyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Alms-food means to beg for morsels of food, that is, to obtain them.

original: bsod snyoms de yang dman pa dang / bar ma dang / mchog gi khyim du slong mo rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i don yin pa'am /üîΩbsod snyoms kyi phyir rgyu ba'i brtul zhugs kyi ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na bsod snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms de yang dman pa dang / bar ma dang / mchog gi khyim du slong mo rgyu ba zhes bya ba'i don yin pa'am / bsod snyoms kyi phyir rgyu ba'i brtul zhugs kyi ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na bsod snyoms pa'o //
translated: Or else, to go for alms means to go to inferior, mediocre, and superior houses.üîΩThe one who has the nature of the vow to go for alms is called the one who goes for alms.

original: de'i dngos po nyid ni bsod snyoms pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po nyid ni bsod snyoms pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of that is the state of being the one who goes for alms.

original: de yang dam bca' pa 'dis byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang dam bca' pa 'dis byed pa yin no //
translated: And that is accomplished by this vow.

original: nga rgyal spong zhing brnyas pa bzod byed la //
analyzed: nga rgyal spong zhing brnyas pa bzod byed la //
translated: One who goes for alms endures the insults of others, thinking, They are not worth a sixteenth part of me.

original: rang gi lus ni skyo ba bzod byed cing //
analyzed: rang gi lus ni skyo ba bzod byed cing //
translated: One who goes for alms endures the suffering of his own body, thinking,

original: mgron bos pa yi bsdams pa'i sdug bsngal ni //
analyzed: mgron bos pa yi bsdams pa'i sdug bsngal ni //
translated: The suffering of being bound by the invitation of others

original: slong mos spyod la zhugs la yod ma yin //
analyzed: slong mos spyod la zhugs la yod ma yin //
translated: does not exist for one who goes for alms.

original: sbyin pa'i gter chen bde ba rgya che la //
analyzed: sbyin pa'i gter chen bde ba rgya che la //
translated: One who goes for alms is a great treasure of generosity, a great field of happiness,

original: mi smra bzhin du skye bo 'dzud par byed //
analyzed: mi smra bzhin du skye bo 'dzud par byed //
translated: and he causes people to enter it without speaking.

original: khyim nang 'jug pa'i nges pa'i bslab pa ni //
analyzed: khyim nang 'jug pa'i nges pa'i bslab pa ni //
translated: The training in the certainty of entering the household

original: de spyod pa yis dge slong shin tu mdzes ;
analyzed: de spyod pa yis dge slong shin tu mdzes ;
translated: is that a monk is very beautiful by his conduct.

original: / dge slong tshul ni rang dbang gis 'tsho zhing //
analyzed: / dge slong tshul ni rang dbang gis 'tsho zhing //
translated: The monk‚Äôs way is to live independently,

original: rang gi brtson pas thob la bde bar spyod //
analyzed: rang gi brtson pas thob la bde bar spyod //
translated: to enjoy what is obtained by his own effort.

original: log 'tsho'i nyes pas zil gyis mi gnon zhing //
analyzed: log 'tsho'i nyes pas zil gyis mi gnon zhing //
translated: He is not overcome by the faults of wrong livelihood,

original: 'di yi phyogs 'di gang du 'ang dgag pa med //üîΩgang la gnas te rab tu byung gyur pa /
analyzed: 'di yi phyogs 'di gang du 'ang dgag pa med // gang la gnas te rab tu byung gyur pa /
translated: and there is no prohibition anywhere in this regard.üîΩHe is very beautiful by practicing in accordance with

original: de ni de bzhin sgrub pas rnam par mdzes //üîΩzas @19a * //
analyzed: de ni de bzhin sgrub pas rnam par mdzes // zas @19a * //
translated: the state in which he has gone forth.

original: kyi phyir ni sdug bsngal mi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: kyi phyir ni sdug bsngal mi 'gyur zhing //
translated: He does not suffer for the sake of food,

original: dam pa rnams kyi tshul la rjes 'jug yin //üîΩnor dang nye du'i skye bo sdug dang khyim //
analyzed: dam pa rnams kyi tshul la rjes 'jug yin // nor dang nye du'i skye bo sdug dang khyim //
translated: and he follows the way of the holy ones.üîΩHaving abandoned wealth, relatives, pleasant people, home,

original: kha zas ro zhim de dang de spangs nas //
analyzed: kha zas ro zhim de dang de spangs nas //
translated: and delicious food,

original: zas kyi sred pa las ni ldog gyur pa //
analyzed: zas kyi sred pa las ni ldog gyur pa //

original: mgu bas dge slong dngos po gsal byed yin //
analyzed: mgu bas dge slong dngos po gsal byed yin //
translated: A monk is made clear by contentment.

analyzed: dam bca' ba'i dbang las stan gnyis pa la gnas pa'i kha zas spangs /
translated: By the power of his vow, he abandons food that is placed on a second seat.

analyzed: stan gcig la zas kyi rigs la spyod pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na stan gcig pa'o //
translated: They are called ‚Äúthose who eat in one sitting‚Äù because they eat in a single sitting.

original: kha cig ni de ni stan la 'dug pa'i mthar thug pa yin par 'dod la /
analyzed: kha cig ni de ni stan la 'dug pa'i mthar thug pa yin par 'dod la /

analyzed: gzhan dag ni khrus byas pa'i mthar thug pa yin no zhes zer te /
translated: Others say that it refers to the end of bathing.

original: gang zhig zos nas stan de las ma langs kyang lhung bzed khru ba'i chu blangs nas slang za bar mi byed pa dang / kha zas so sor thob nas kham gyi tha ma zos nas yang slar mi za ba de ni zas kyi mtha' yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang zhig zos nas stan de las ma langs kyang lhung bzed khru ba'i chu blangs nas slang za bar mi byed pa dang / kha zas so sor thob nas kham gyi tha ma zos nas yang slar mi za ba de ni zas kyi mtha' yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: It is said that the end of eating is when, after eating, one does not get up from one‚Äôs seat, but takes water for washing the begging bowl and does not eat again.

original: de yang 'di ltar dam bca' ba goms par byed do //üîΩyang dang yang du za ba'i nyes pa yis //
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar dam bca' ba goms par byed do // yang dang yang du za ba'i nyes pa yis //
translated: One should make a vow to do this and then practice it.üîΩDo not abandon your practice of eating in one sitting

original: stan gcig rang gi bya ba spong mi byed //
analyzed: stan gcig rang gi bya ba spong mi byed //
translated: because of the faults of eating again and again.

original: nad nyung gnod pa chung zhing lus srab 'gyur //
analyzed: nad nyung gnod pa chung zhing lus srab 'gyur //

original: rnal 'byor ldang ba yang bar 'dis 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ldang ba yang bar 'dis 'gyur ro //

original: cho ga bzhin gnas bde bar 'chag pa dang // thub dbang tshul gyis rjes su 'jug pa dang // chog shes gso sla'i yon tan rjes mthun zhing //
analyzed: cho ga bzhin gnas bde bar 'chag pa dang // thub dbang tshul gyis rjes su 'jug pa dang // chog shes gso sla'i yon tan rjes mthun zhing //

original: zas kyi bde ba'i 'dam gyis gos mi 'gyur //
analyzed: zas kyi bde ba'i 'dam gyis gos mi 'gyur //
translated: He is not soiled by the mud of the pleasures of food.

original: 'di yi sems ni ro la mi gdung zhing //
analyzed: 'di yi sems ni ro la mi gdung zhing //

original: bsam gtan rjes sbyor dag la dga' ba yin //
analyzed: bsam gtan rjes sbyor dag la dga' ba yin //
translated: He is devoted to the practice of meditation.üîΩHe is happy, and he must be calmed by that happiness;

original: de la dga' bas rab zhi bya dgos gcig / nyon mongs phyogs ni bde blag nyid du spong //
analyzed: de la dga' bas rab zhi bya dgos gcig / nyon mongs phyogs ni bde blag nyid du spong //
translated: he easily abandons the side of the afflictions.

original: dam bca' ba sngon du 'gro bas glos phab spangs te 'dug pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na cog pu pa'o //
analyzed: dam bca' ba sngon du 'gro bas glos phab spangs te 'dug pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na cog pu pa'o //

original: sems can dge ba la dam bca' ba'i yang dag par sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: sems can dge ba la dam bca' ba'i yang dag par sgrub pa yin no //
translated: He is the true practitioner of the vow of virtue for sentient beings.

original: gnyid kyi mun pa stug pos mi non cing //
analyzed: gnyid kyi mun pa stug pos mi non cing //

original: sems ni mal stan bde ba'i dbang mi 'gro //
analyzed: sems ni mal stan bde ba'i dbang mi 'gro //
translated: His mind does not go under the power of the pleasures of bed and seat.

original: 'di yi lus su 'dzin pa srab pa dang // 'di las mnyam par 'jog pa bder gnas 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di yi lus su 'dzin pa srab pa dang // 'di las mnyam par 'jog pa bder gnas 'gyur //

original: le lo dngos po spong ba'i stobs skyed la //
analyzed: le lo dngos po spong ba'i stobs skyed la //
translated: The power of the elimination of laziness is generated.

original: rang gi chos kyi las bsgrub la mi g-yel //
analyzed: rang gi chos kyi las bsgrub la mi g-yel //
translated: One is not distracted from accomplishing one‚Äôs own religious duties.

original: yang ba'i rim gyis slar la brten pa na //
analyzed: yang ba'i rim gyis slar la brten pa na //
translated: By gradually increasing one‚Äôs strength, one is able to stand for a long time.

original: ngal ba'i nyes pa shas cher nyams mi myong //
analyzed: ngal ba'i nyes pa shas cher nyams mi myong //
translated: One does not experience the fault of excessive fatigue.

original: skyil krung dang bcas lus ni drang por gnas //
analyzed: skyil krung dang bcas lus ni drang por gnas //
translated: One sits cross-legged, keeping the body straight.

original: bsam gtan la @19b rtsol lus kyis gang 'dzin pa //
analyzed: bsam gtan la @19b rtsol lus kyis gang 'dzin pa //
translated: Whatever posture one uses for the practice of meditation,

original: dge slong 'chag gnas nyal ba'am 'dug pa yis //
analyzed: dge slong 'chag gnas nyal ba'am 'dug pa yis //
translated: whether walking, standing, lying down, or sitting,

original: zhi ba'i dpal ni de 'dra 'dzin mi 'gyur //
analyzed: zhi ba'i dpal ni de 'dra 'dzin mi 'gyur //

original: zas phyis mi len pa nyid ces bya ba ni phyis kha zas mi za ba'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa ni phyis mi len pa ste /
analyzed: zas phyis mi len pa nyid ces bya ba ni phyis kha zas mi za ba'i ngang tshul can gang yin pa ni phyis mi len pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNot eating in the evening‚Äù means that one has the nature of not eating food in the evening.üîΩOne turns away from and abandons eating leftover food from the previous day.

original: bca' ba sngon du 'gro bas lhag pa'i kha zas za ba las ldog cing de 'dor ba yin bas na zas phyis mi len pa'o //
analyzed: bca' ba sngon du 'gro bas lhag pa'i kha zas za ba las ldog cing de 'dor ba yin bas na zas phyis mi len pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúnot eating in the evening.‚Äù

original: de'i dngos po nyid ni zas phyis mi len pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po nyid ni zas phyis mi len pa nyid do //
translated: The nature of that is ‚Äúnot eating in the evening.‚Äù

original: phyis nas za ba spangs pa yin //
analyzed: phyis nas za ba spangs pa yin //
translated: One abandons eating in the evening.

original: dam bca' blangs par gyur pa yis //
analyzed: dam bca' blangs par gyur pa yis //
translated: One who has taken a vow

original: brkam chags med cing chog shes dang // dad pa'i tshul dang rjes mthun yin //
analyzed: brkam chags med cing chog shes dang // dad pa'i tshul dang rjes mthun yin //
translated: and he is in accord with the way of faith.üîΩHe has abandoned the trouble of

original: slar yang kha zas tshol ba yi //üîΩngal ba rnam par spangs nas ni //
analyzed: slar yang kha zas tshol ba yi // ngal ba rnam par spangs nas ni //
translated: seeking food again and again.

original: de tsam gyis cho ga ngo mtshar bcas //
analyzed: de tsam gyis cho ga ngo mtshar bcas //
translated: He has the wonderful rite of just that much.

original: 'dod mtshungs nyid ni yon tan dpal //üîΩspangs te za ba'i cho ga bral //üîΩltos la gdung ba'i tshul spangs pa //
analyzed: 'dod mtshungs nyid ni yon tan dpal // spangs te za ba'i cho ga bral // ltos la gdung ba'i tshul spangs pa //
translated: He has abandoned the glory of qualities that are like desires.üîΩHe is free from the rite of eating.üîΩHe has abandoned the way of being tormented by dependence.

original: de ni gso slar gyur pa ste //
analyzed: de ni gso slar gyur pa ste //
translated: He is easy to nourish,

original: bde zhing lus yang 'gyur pa nyid //
analyzed: bde zhing lus yang 'gyur pa nyid //

original: chos gos gsum pa yod pas chos gos gsum ste /
analyzed: chos gos gsum pa yod pas chos gos gsum ste /

original: snam sbyar dang / bla gos dang / mthang gos dang / bca' ba sngon du 'gro bas rtag pa spangs te chos gos gsum 'chang ba'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na chos gos gsum pa'o //

analyzed: de'i dngos po nyid ni chos gos gsum pa nyid do //

analyzed: chos gos gsum po tsam gyis ni //üîΩchog shes yang ba la 'jug cing //

analyzed: mang po la sred nyer bcas pas // gos sogs pa ni spangs pa yin //
translated: And with the desire for many things,üîΩI have given up the desire for clothes and so forth.

analyzed: 'dab chags lta bur blangs nas ni //

analyzed: gang du dga' bar 'gro bar byed //

analyzed: / zhag bcu las 'das ltung ba ni //

analyzed: chos gos kyi ni bya ba yis // shin tu ngal bar 'gyur ma yin //

analyzed: dam @20a * // bca' ba sngon gyi 'gro bas phying ba 'chang ba'i ngang tshul 'di la yin pas na phying pa pa'o // de'i dngos po nyid ni phying pa pa nyid do // de yang / dag par spangs pa'i yon tan ni // bal bsdus pa las byas pa'i gos //
translated: The cloth-wearers are those who, in the past, have taken the vow to wear cloth.üîΩThe nature of that is cloth-wearingness.üîΩAnd that is said to be:üîΩThe virtue of the pure renunciatesüîΩis cloth made from rags.üîΩ

original: bya ba mang nyung rang don dang // chog shes pa las nyams mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bya ba mang nyung rang don dang // chog shes pa las nyams mi 'gyur //

analyzed: gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid ces bya ba ni dam bca' ba sngon du 'gro bas gzhi ji bzhin pa la gnas pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na gzhi ji bzhin pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äújust as the basis‚Äù is a compound word. It is ‚Äújust as the basis‚Äù because it exists in the state of abiding just as the basis.

analyzed: de yang gang du ji ltar rnyed pa'i mal stan gyis mgu bar gyur cing gsar bus yongs su bzung ba'i mal stan bzang po la chags pas des bslang ba yongs su spangs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, he is satisfied with whatever bed or seat he finds, and he completely avoids attachment to a good bed or seat that is coveted by those who are young.

original: ji bzhin bting bas mgu ba'i phyir //
analyzed: ji bzhin bting bas mgu ba'i phyir //

original: sdom brtson shin tu mdzes pa yin //
analyzed: sdom brtson shin tu mdzes pa yin //

original: dge slong gsar bu mal stan na //
analyzed: dge slong gsar bu mal stan na //
translated: The new monk should protect

original: bde la gnas pa rjes su bsrung //
analyzed: bde la gnas pa rjes su bsrung //

original: dman pa'i mal stan la 'dug kyang //
analyzed: dman pa'i mal stan la 'dug kyang //

analyzed: bzang po la ni nye ba med // chags dang sdang ba'i phyogs kyi ni //

original: gnod pa'i gzhi ru 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: gnod pa'i gzhi ru 'gyur ma yin //
translated: He does not become the basis for the harm

original: mal stan la ni chags pa yis //
analyzed: mal stan la ni chags pa yis //
translated: that comes from the side of attachment or hostility.üîΩHe is not attached to a bed or seat.

original: phan tshun du ni drangs pa yis //
analyzed: phan tshun du ni drangs pa yis //
translated: By mutual support,

original: rang gi bya ba mi nyams shing //
analyzed: rang gi bya ba mi nyams shing //
translated: one‚Äôs own actions are not lost,

original: bral bar gyur kyang gnam mi g-yo //
analyzed: bral bar gyur kyang gnam mi g-yo //
translated: and even when separated, there is no falling.

original: rtsva bting ba 'am sa la nyal ba na //
analyzed: rtsva bting ba 'am sa la nyal ba na //
translated: Whether lying on a spread of straw or on the ground,

original: ji bzhin gzhi las gyur pa'i bde ba ni //
analyzed: ji bzhin gzhi las gyur pa'i bde ba ni //
translated: the happiness that comes from such a basis

original: nor bu 'bar ba'i gzhal yas khang stengs na'ang //
analyzed: nor bu 'bar ba'i gzhal yas khang stengs na'ang //
translated: is not found in the jeweled palaces of the burning gods,

original: chog shes med pa'i sems la ji yod min //
analyzed: chog shes med pa'i sems la ji yod min //
translated: for those with insatiable minds.

analyzed: dur khrod pa nyid ces bya ba ni dam bca' ba sngon du 'gro bas dur khrod du gnas pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na dur khrod pa'o //
translated: The ‚Äúcemetery nature‚Äù is the nature of one who lives in a cemetery, because of the prior commitment to do so.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na dur khrod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na dur khrod pa nyid do //
translated: It is the cemetery nature because it has that nature.

original: de'i yon tan ni /
analyzed: de'i yon tan ni /
translated: Its good qualities are as follows:

original: dur khrod du ni rgyun du 'chi dran pas //
analyzed: dur khrod du ni rgyun du 'chi dran pas //
translated: Constantly mindful of death in the cemetery,

original: skyo 'gyur de las bag med 'gyur ma yin //
analyzed: skyo 'gyur de las bag med 'gyur ma yin //
translated: one becomes disenchanted, and from that, not heedless.

original: mi gtsang sna @20b tshogs mtshan ma rnams mthong nas /
analyzed: mi gtsang sna @20b tshogs mtshan ma rnams mthong nas /
translated: Seeing the various signs of impurity,

original: 'di yi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags 'phel mi 'gyur //
analyzed: 'di yi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags 'phel mi 'gyur //
translated: one‚Äôs desire for sense pleasures does not increase.üîΩThe nonhuman beings there are respectful,

original: 'dir ni mi ma yin pa gus 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'dir ni mi ma yin pa gus 'gyur zhing //
translated: and

original: 'di yi srog la ltos pa chung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'di yi srog la ltos pa chung 'gyur zhing //
translated: He has little regard for his own life,

original: de la brten pas dregs pa spong 'gyur la //
analyzed: de la brten pas dregs pa spong 'gyur la //
translated: and by depending on him, pride is abandoned.

original: de bas de ni chos 'ga' mang dag 'thob //
analyzed: de bas de ni chos 'ga' mang dag 'thob //
translated: Therefore, he obtains many qualities of Dharma.

original: sems ni zhi la phyogs phyir rang srog dang / bde dang lus la ltos pa med 'gyur la //üîΩsdig sbrul mi ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa las //
analyzed: sems ni zhi la phyogs phyir rang srog dang / bde dang lus la ltos pa med 'gyur la // sdig sbrul mi ma yin pa'i 'jigs pa las //
translated: Because his mind is inclined to peace, he has no regard for his own life, for happiness, or for his body.

original: der gnas pas kyang sdar bas skrag pa med //üîΩshing drung pa nyid ces bya ba ni dam bca' ba'i tshogs g-yogs pa'i gnas spangs la shing drung du gnas pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas shing drung pa'o //
analyzed: der gnas pas kyang sdar bas skrag pa med // shing drung pa nyid ces bya ba ni dam bca' ba'i tshogs g-yogs pa'i gnas spangs la shing drung du gnas pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas shing drung pa'o //
translated: He who dwells there is not frightened by the fear of snakes, of non-humans, or of robbers.

original: de'i dngos po ni shing drung pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni shing drung pa nyid do //
translated: The state of dwelling at the foot of a tree is the nature of dwelling at the foot of a tree.

original: der dam bcas pa'i yon tan ni /üîΩgang zhig shing drung bzang po dag tu ni //
analyzed: der dam bcas pa'i yon tan ni / gang zhig shing drung bzang po dag tu ni //
translated: The qualities of the vow are:üîΩHe who is wealthy with a mind pleased by the good bed and seat

original: mal stan dag gis sems mgu'i 'byor par ldan //
analyzed: mal stan dag gis sems mgu'i 'byor par ldan //
translated: at the foot of a tree,

original: phyogs rnams kun du thogs pa med par 'gro //
analyzed: phyogs rnams kun du thogs pa med par 'gro //
translated: goes everywhere without obstruction.

original: de ni dam chos phun sum tshogs pa'i lam ;
analyzed: de ni dam chos phun sum tshogs pa'i lam ;
translated: He is on the perfect path of the true Dharma.

original: / de ni chos kyang rnam par 'phel 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: / de ni chos kyang rnam par 'phel 'gyur zhing //
translated: ‚ÄúThe Dharma will flourish,

original: bdud kyi stobs kyi dregs pa zlog par byed //üîΩde yi yid ni mnyam 'jog sgrub rgyu yi //
analyzed: bdud kyi stobs kyi dregs pa zlog par byed // de yi yid ni mnyam 'jog sgrub rgyu yi //
translated: and the arrogance of the power of MƒÅra will be destroyed.üîΩThe monk who is focused on the cause of accomplishment

original: bde ba dag las dge slong nyams mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bde ba dag las dge slong nyams mi 'gyur //
translated: will not lose his happiness.üîΩEasy to acquire, with few possessions,

original: rnyed par sla zhing yo byad nyung ba dang // 'du 'dzi sdug bsngal sgrib pa dang mtshungs shing //
analyzed: rnyed par sla zhing yo byad nyung ba dang // 'du 'dzi sdug bsngal sgrib pa dang mtshungs shing //
translated: suffering from distraction and obscuration,

original: rang gi gnas la yon tan rgya chen sten //
analyzed: rang gi gnas la yon tan rgya chen sten //
translated: and with the support of vast qualities in his own place,

original: dga' bas shing drung dag tu su mi gnas //
analyzed: dga' bas shing drung dag tu su mi gnas //
translated: who would not delight in staying at the foot of a tree?

original: lo 'dab gsar du byung bar gyur nas ni //
analyzed: lo 'dab gsar du byung bar gyur nas ni //
translated: When the new leaves appear,

original: mdog 'gyur bas bcom lo ma lhags pas shing //
analyzed: mdog 'gyur bas bcom lo ma lhags pas shing //
translated: the tree is destroyed by the change in color and the falling leaves.

original: rang gi rtsa bar gnas pa'i sdom brtson la //
analyzed: rang gi rtsa bar gnas pa'i sdom brtson la //
translated: The ascetic who stays at the foot of the tree

original: mi rtag 'du shes ston pa lta bu yin //
analyzed: mi rtag 'du shes ston pa lta bu yin //
translated: is taught the perception of impermanence.

original: bla gab med pa nyid ces bya ba ni dam bca' ba'i tshogs g-yogs pa'i cho gas shing drung spangs pa'i gnas kun nas go skabs yod bla gab med pa la gnas pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na bla gab med pa pa'o //
analyzed: bla gab med pa nyid ces bya ba ni dam bca' ba'i tshogs g-yogs pa'i cho gas shing drung spangs pa'i gnas kun nas go skabs yod bla gab med pa la gnas pa'i ngang tshul 'di la yod pas na bla gab med pa pa'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúopen-air‚Äù means that the vow to live in the open-air is the nature of the vow to live in the open-air.

original: bla gab med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bla gab pa nyid do //üîΩde yang dag par blangs pa'i yon tan ni ;
analyzed: bla gab med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni bla gab pa nyid do // de yang dag par blangs pa'i yon tan ni ;
translated: The benefits of taking up the vow to live in the open-air are as follows:

original: / mal stan tshol dang bsrung dang sbrug pa yis //
analyzed: / mal stan tshol dang bsrung dang sbrug pa yis //
translated: One does not have to search for a dwelling, protect it, or clean it.

original: yongs su nyal ba'i gzhir gyur ma yin zhing //üîΩbla gab med la sgrub par khas blangs la //
analyzed: yongs su nyal ba'i gzhir gyur ma yin zhing // bla gab med la sgrub par khas blangs la //
translated: One does not have a home to which one returns.

original: 'du 'dzi med pas shin tu mdzes pa yin //üîΩphyogs rnams kun du dgag pa med par ni //üîΩri dags lta bur rang dgar @21a * //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi med pas shin tu mdzes pa yin // phyogs rnams kun du dgag pa med par ni // ri dags lta bur rang dgar @21a * //
translated: One is very beautiful because of being free from social interactions.üîΩOne goes wherever one wants,

original: 'gro ba yin //
analyzed: 'gro ba yin //
translated: like a deer, without being blocked in any direction.

original: chog shes yon tan mchog dang ldan 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: chog shes yon tan mchog dang ldan 'gyur zhing //
translated: One becomes endowed with the supreme quality of contentment.

original: sems ni gnas khang 'du 'dzi las rnams grol //
analyzed: sems ni gnas khang 'du 'dzi las rnams grol //
translated: The mind is freed from the house and from social interactions.

original: gnyid chung nyid dang yid la byed pa'i rjes mthun zhing //
analyzed: gnyid chung nyid dang yid la byed pa'i rjes mthun zhing //
translated: Having little sleep, being in accord with mental activity,

original: dam pa'i tshul la brten pas yon tan phyogs 'dzin cing /
analyzed: dam pa'i tshul la brten pas yon tan phyogs 'dzin cing /
translated: and being based on the holy Dharma, one acquires the qualities of the side of virtue.

original: lus kyi bde ba cung zad la chags rnam spong ba //
analyzed: lus kyi bde ba cung zad la chags rnam spong ba //
translated: Abandoning attachment to slight physical comfort,

original: yon tan de de bla gab med la gnas pas 'thob //üîΩskar tshogs rin chen 'od zer 'bar ba yis //
analyzed: yon tan de de bla gab med la gnas pas 'thob // skar tshogs rin chen 'od zer 'bar ba yis //
translated: one acquires those qualities by living in the open air.üîΩThe sky is like a jeweled canopyüîΩwith the stars as its shining jewels,

original: nam mkha'i bla re nyi zla'i mar mer ldan //üîΩ'jig rten du ma de snyed ri dang bcas //
analyzed: nam mkha'i bla re nyi zla'i mar mer ldan // 'jig rten du ma de snyed ri dang bcas //
translated: the moon and sun as its lamps,

original: khang bzangs dang ldan gtsug lag khang chen yin //
analyzed: khang bzangs dang ldan gtsug lag khang chen yin //
translated: and the many worlds as its great temples.

original: de dag la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs yang dag par 'byor bas na spyangs pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba dang / nyes pa rnams sbyong bar byed pas na sbyangs pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dag la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi tshogs yang dag par 'byor bas na spyangs pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba dang / nyes pa rnams sbyong bar byed pas na sbyangs pa'i yon tan zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The qualities of austerity are so called because they are the means of acquiring such a collection of qualities and because they purify faults.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: glang po che chu 'thung ba la 'thung ba la zhes brjod pa'am /
analyzed: glang po che chu 'thung ba la 'thung ba la zhes brjod pa'am /
translated: when an elephant drinks water, it is said that he drinks with his trunk.

original: zas za ba la za ba zhes smra ba dang 'dra bar tshig gong ma phyis te chog mi shes pa dang / 'du 'dzi dang shas cher 'dre ba nyid dang / le lo nyid dang / gnyid dang / 'du 'dzi'i nyes pa sbyong bar byed pa yin pas sbyangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zas za ba la za ba zhes smra ba dang 'dra bar tshig gong ma phyis te chog mi shes pa dang / 'du 'dzi dang shas cher 'dre ba nyid dang / le lo nyid dang / gnyid dang / 'du 'dzi'i nyes pa sbyong bar byed pa yin pas sbyangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called purification because it purifies the faults of laziness, sleep, and distraction.

original: dam bca' ba 'di dag ni nyes pa rnams kyi mi mthun ba'i phyogs yin bas sbyangs pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: dam bca' ba 'di dag ni nyes pa rnams kyi mi mthun ba'i phyogs yin bas sbyangs pa zhes bya la /
translated: These vows are called purifications because they are the antidotes to the faults.

original: 'di dag ni dam bca' ba'i rten gyi bye brag tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni dam bca' ba'i rten gyi bye brag tu phye ba yin no //
translated: They are distinguished by the particular basis of the vow.

original: de ni nyan thos mchog rnams kyis bsngags shing bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni nyan thos mchog rnams kyis bsngags shing bzung ba yin te /
translated: They are praised and accepted by the best of the disciples.

original: dgos pa byed pa'i mchog yin pas 'di dag yang dag par blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dgos pa byed pa'i mchog yin pas 'di dag yang dag par blang bar bya'o //
translated: Since they are the best for accomplishing the goal, they should be undertaken.

original: de bzhin du 'di dag yongs su bzung ba'i sdig pa 'dod pa dang / sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / dman pa dang / kun du rmongs pa rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / chog mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di dag yongs su bzung ba'i sdig pa 'dod pa dang / sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang / dman pa dang / kun du rmongs pa rnams kyi thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / chog mi shes pa dang /
translated: Likewise, they are not shared in common by those who are sinful, distracted, inferior, or confused, and they are not shared in common by those who are insatiable,

original: chags pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa so sor spong ba yin la /
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa'i sdig pa so sor spong ba yin la /
translated: or by those who are sinful through attachment, etc.

original: thams cad kyi thun mong pa yin pa nyid dang / mthar thug par bya ba nyid yin no //üîΩyang sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la mchod pa dang 'dra bar /
analyzed: thams cad kyi thun mong pa yin pa nyid dang / mthar thug par bya ba nyid yin no // yang sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun la mchod pa dang 'dra bar /
translated: They are shared in common by all, and they are the ultimate.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gti mug med pa dag sbyong ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir dge ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang gti mug med pa dag sbyong ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir dge ba yin no //
translated: Moreover, they are virtuous because they are the Dharma which purifies the defilements of attachment and delusion, just like the worship of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sa·πÖgha.

original: de la dge slong dgon pas ma 'ongs pa'i 'jigs pa dran nas bag yod pa nyid dang / brtson 'grus @21b brtul ba dang / mchog tu bdag la phan bas gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong dgon pas ma 'ongs pa'i 'jigs pa dran nas bag yod pa nyid dang / brtson 'grus @21b brtul ba dang / mchog tu bdag la phan bas gnas par bya'o //
translated: The monk who lives in the forest should be mindful of future dangers, and he should be heedful, resolute, and intent on his own highest goal.

original: chos kyi dad dpon gyis dge slong sgra ngan las brtsams te bshad pa'i dgon pa pa'i tshul skyo bas ga yengs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir bsam bar bya zhing de bzhin du bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dad dpon gyis dge slong sgra ngan las brtsams te bshad pa'i dgon pa pa'i tshul skyo bas ga yengs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir bsam bar bya zhing de bzhin du bslab par bya'o //
translated: The Dharma Master should explain the forest life, beginning with the story of Bhadrika, in order to dispel the sadness of those who are distracted by thoughts of home.üîΩOne becomes sad by remembering the pleasures of the household life,

original: bag med gnyid dang le lo'i rjes 'jug dang // khyim pa'i bde ba dran pas skyo bar 'gyur //üîΩlog par brtson pas nags la mngon dga' dang // dga' zhing dgod sogs kyis ni dgon par g-yengs //
analyzed: bag med gnyid dang le lo'i rjes 'jug dang // khyim pa'i bde ba dran pas skyo bar 'gyur // log par brtson pas nags la mngon dga' dang // dga' zhing dgod sogs kyis ni dgon par g-yengs //
translated: and by following after carelessness, sleep, and laziness.üîΩOne becomes distracted in the forest by delighting in wrong endeavors,

original: sdig 'dod bsam pas dgon par gnas pa yin //
analyzed: sdig 'dod bsam pas dgon par gnas pa yin //
translated: by delighting in and laughing a lot, and by living in the forest with the desire for sin.

original: dman zhing mi mkhas skyo ba nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: dman zhing mi mkhas skyo ba nyid du 'gyur //
translated: One becomes sad by being of low aspiration and lacking in skill.üîΩOne becomes distracted by being of a distracted nature and by being very distracted.

original: rnam g-yengs bdag nyid shin tu g-yengs byed cing //üîΩsbyor ba bzang ldan nyes de'i skal can min //üîΩnyes la mngon dags kun du zhum 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: rnam g-yengs bdag nyid shin tu g-yengs byed cing // sbyor ba bzang ldan nyes de'i skal can min // nyes la mngon dags kun du zhum 'gyur zhing //

original: khyad par chung dus shin tu dag pas g-yengs //üîΩnyes la dgra bo lta bur yid rtsub cing //
analyzed: khyad par chung dus shin tu dag pas g-yengs //üîΩnyes la dgra bo lta bur yid rtsub cing //
translated: One becomes distracted by being of a distracted nature and by being very distracted.üîΩOne becomes

original: zhi la mngon brtson brtan pa rnams ni mdzes //
analyzed: zhi la mngon brtson brtan pa rnams ni mdzes //
translated: Those who are steadfast in striving for peace are beautiful.

original: de bzhin phyag dar khrod la sogs pa la skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi chos dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i chos la yang dag par bsams nas /
analyzed: de bzhin phyag dar khrod la sogs pa la skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi chos dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i chos la yang dag par bsams nas /
translated: In the same way, having reflected well on the holy Dharma and the non-Dharma of the holy ones,

original: sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs nas bdag la stod pa dang / gzhan la smod pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'brang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag par blangs nas bdag la stod pa dang / gzhan la smod pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'i lam gyi rjes su 'brang bar mi bya'o //
translated: such as the practice of wearing cast-off rags, one should take up the ascetic practices without praising oneself, disparaging others, or following the path of the non-Dharma.

original: 'di dag ni gtso bo'i yo byad yin gyi dregs pa'i tshogs ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni gtso bo'i yo byad yin gyi dregs pa'i tshogs ma yin no //
translated: These are the principal practices, not the collection of conceits.

original: de rnams kyis bsgrubs pa'i rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i ro myang bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyis bsgrubs pa'i rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pa'i ro myang bar mi bya ste /
translated: One should not relish the taste of gain, honor, or fame that comes from those practices.

original: rnyed pa dang / bskur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pas lha sbyin rnam par ltung bar gyur pa yang dran par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bskur sti dang / tshigs su bcad pas lha sbyin rnam par ltung bar gyur pa yang dran par bya'o //
translated: One should remember that Devadatta fell because of gain, honor, and fame.

original: dge slong phag dar khrod pas kyang phyag dar khrod 'chang ba dang / rjes su mthun par rab tu zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong phag dar khrod pas kyang phyag dar khrod 'chang ba dang / rjes su mthun par rab tu zhi bar bya'o //
translated: The monk who lives in the dust-heap should take up the dust-heap and be in harmony with it.

original: 'di las gzhan du na /
analyzed: 'di las gzhan du na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: dge slong khengs shing mi brtan pa //
analyzed: dge slong khengs shing mi brtan pa //
translated: the monk who is puffed up and unstable,

original: phyag dar khrod ni gon gyur na //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod ni gon gyur na //
translated: even if he wears the dust-heap

original: spre'u stag lpags gon mtshungs te //
analyzed: spre'u stag lpags gon mtshungs te //
translated: is like a monkey in a tiger skin.

original: 'di ni de yis mdzes ma yin //
analyzed: 'di ni de yis mdzes ma yin //
translated: This does not become him.

original: khengs pa med cing rang bzhin brtan //
analyzed: khengs pa med cing rang bzhin brtan //
translated: But the monk who is humble and stable by nature,

original: sdig med dbang po bsdams pa ni //
analyzed: sdig med dbang po bsdams pa ni //
translated: who is without sin and has his senses under control,

original: phyag dar khrod kyis rnams mdzes te //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod kyis rnams mdzes te //
translated: he is beautiful in his dust-heap

original: ri sul gyi ni seng ger mtshungs //
analyzed: ri sul gyi ni seng ger mtshungs //
translated: like a lion in the mountain fastness.

original: dad pa med pa'am dad pa chung ba rnams kyis 'di smad par 'gyur na yang /
analyzed: dad pa med pa'am dad pa chung ba rnams kyis 'di smad par 'gyur na yang /
translated: Even if those who are without faith or have little faith should despise him,

original: gang smod par 'gyur ba 'di ni 'jig rten gyi chos yin pas dam bca' ba rjes su @22a * //
analyzed: gang smod par 'gyur ba 'di ni 'jig rten gyi chos yin pas dam bca' ba rjes su @22a * //
translated: since it is a worldly thing to be despised, one should not give up one‚Äôs commitment.

original: dor bar mi bya zhing 'di la bzod pa'i bsam pas zil gyis mnan par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: dor bar mi bya zhing 'di la bzod pa'i bsam pas zil gyis mnan par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: One should rather overpower them with a thought of patience.

original: bsod snyoms pa nyid kyis kyang grong khyer ram ljongs su bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na bslab pa yongs su dag pa dang / dge ba yid la byed pas bdag nyid snod du byas pa bla ma'am /
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa nyid kyis kyang grong khyer ram ljongs su bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na bslab pa yongs su dag pa dang / dge ba yid la byed pas bdag nyid snod du byas pa bla ma'am /
translated: The alms-begging monk, when he enters a town or village for alms, should purify his training and make himself a proper vessel by keeping in mind virtuous thoughts.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i tshangs pa mtshungs pa rnams la dri ba byas nas gos gyon te /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i tshangs pa mtshungs pa rnams la dri ba byas nas gos gyon te /
translated: He should then ask a teacher or a fellow monk who is like a teacher about the right way to put on his robes.

original: ska rags bcings la shes bzhin dang ldan pas chos gos dang lhung bzed blangs la mdud pa bcings te /
analyzed: ska rags bcings la shes bzhin dang ldan pas chos gos dang lhung bzed blangs la mdud pa bcings te /
translated: He should put on his robes, tie his belt, and, with full awareness, pick up his robes and bowl.üîΩHe should put on his sandals and, when the time has come, enter the town.

original: mchil lham bgos nas dus la bab par grong du 'jug pa na yang nyi ma dang dus shes par byas la 'jug par bya'o ;
analyzed: mchil lham bgos nas dus la bab par grong du 'jug pa na yang nyi ma dang dus shes par byas la 'jug par bya'o ;
translated: He should know the time of day and the time of year.

original: /'di lta ste slong mo spyod pas 'tsho ba 'di ni 'tsho ba'i tha chad yin zhing 'jig rten 'di ltar skra brags pa lag na thod pa thogs shing gos tha dad pa gyon nas gzhan gyi grong du slong mo rgyu bar gyur cig ces bya ba yin mod
analyzed: /'di lta ste slong mo spyod pas 'tsho ba 'di ni 'tsho ba'i tha chad yin zhing 'jig rten 'di ltar skra brags pa lag na thod pa thogs shing gos tha dad pa gyon nas gzhan gyi grong du slong mo rgyu bar gyur cig ces bya ba yin mod
translated: He should think, ‚ÄúThis is the worst kind of livelihood, that I should have to go begging for alms in another‚Äôs house, my head shaven, carrying an extra bowl, wearing different clothes from those of other people.‚Äù

original: kyi / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams ngag rjes su dran zhing lus kyi don du 'di ltar tshol ba la zhugs pa yin no zhes lus kyi nyes dmigs mthong ba dang / grong khyer du 'jug pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi la rjes su slob bzhin pa dang /üîΩchos gos dang sham thabs zlum por bgos pa dang / mig gzhan du ma yengs pa dang / lkugs pa ma yin bzhin du lkug pa lta bur byed cing bsdams pa lus shin tu bsngams par 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: kyi / de bzhin gshegs pa'i gdams ngag rjes su dran zhing lus kyi don du 'di ltar tshol ba la zhugs pa yin no zhes lus kyi nyes dmigs mthong ba dang / grong khyer du 'jug pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi la rjes su slob bzhin pa dang / chos gos dang sham thabs zlum por bgos pa dang / mig gzhan du ma yengs pa dang / lkugs pa ma yin bzhin du lkug pa lta bur byed cing bsdams pa lus shin tu bsngams par 'jug par bya'o //
translated: And, I am engaged in this search for the body, remembering the instructions of the Tathagata, seeing the faults of the body.

original: grong gi nang du zhugs shing rgyu ba dang / rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / bstod dang ma smad pa na dga' bar gyur pa med pa dang bsod snyoms ster ba rtsom pa'i bud med mtshan ma dang / yan lag la rtog pa ltar spang zhing yongs su tshol ba med pa dang /
analyzed: grong gi nang du zhugs shing rgyu ba dang / rnyed pa dang / ma rnyed pa dang / bstod dang ma smad pa na dga' bar gyur pa med pa dang bsod snyoms ster ba rtsom pa'i bud med mtshan ma dang / yan lag la rtog pa ltar spang zhing yongs su tshol ba med pa dang /

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / dregs pa skye ba'i dngos po rnams la dran pa brtan pas bsrung ba dang / yongs su len pa'i tshod shes pa dang / snyoms shing dus la rtog pa dang / bag yod pas rgyu bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / dregs pa skye ba'i dngos po rnams la dran pa brtan pas bsrung ba dang / yongs su len pa'i tshod shes pa dang / snyoms shing dus la rtog pa dang / bag yod pas rgyu bar bya'o //
translated: One should protect oneself with firm mindfulness against the things that give rise to desire, anger, ignorance, and pride. One should know the proper amount to accept. One should be even-tempered and understand the right time. One should move about mindfully.

original: 'dris pa med cing mdza' bshes min khyim du //üîΩgyo mo'i snod thogs slong mo'i phyir rgyu la //
analyzed: 'dris pa med cing mdza' bshes min khyim du // gyo mo'i snod thogs slong mo'i phyir rgyu la //
translated: One should not go to the house of someone who is not a friend or relative

original: mgo bregs brtsams pa'i gos ngan gyon pa la //
analyzed: mgo bregs brtsams pa'i gos ngan gyon pa la //
translated: to beg for alms, carrying an earthenware pot and wearing a patched robe.

original: bag med gyur na ngan pa rnams dang snyam //
analyzed: bag med gyur na ngan pa rnams dang snyam //
translated: If one becomes careless, one will be considered to be like the bad people.

original: stan gcig pa dag gis kyang bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / btung bar bya ba la longs spyod dam @22b bca' ba ni 'gal ba med na yang chog shes pa dang / brkam chags med pa dang / ro la zhen pa med pa dang /
analyzed: stan gcig pa dag gis kyang bza' ba dang / bca' ba dang / btung bar bya ba la longs spyod dam @22b bca' ba ni 'gal ba med na yang chog shes pa dang / brkam chags med pa dang / ro la zhen pa med pa dang /
translated: Even if one eats, drinks, and chews food with the same people, there is no problem if one is content, not greedy, and not attached to tastes.

original: rang gi bya ba las nyams par ma gyur pa las yang dag par bltas te stan gcig pa nyid la gnas nas longs spyod par rigs pa yin te //
analyzed: rang gi bya ba las nyams par ma gyur pa las yang dag par bltas te stan gcig pa nyid la gnas nas longs spyod par rigs pa yin te //
translated: He should be content with what he has, and not neglect his own duties.

original: de tsam gyis 'tsho ba dang / bde ba la reg bar gnas par 'gyur bar bya'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyis 'tsho ba dang / bde ba la reg bar gnas par 'gyur bar bya'o //
translated: He should live in such a way that he can be satisfied with that much, and can remain in touch with what is happening.

original: cog bur 'dug ste gnyid log pa la 'jug par mchog tu gzhol bas 'gyel zhing mgo bo 'dud pa dang / kha chu 'dzags pas nyal ba dang mtshungs par mi bya zhing //
analyzed: cog bur 'dug ste gnyid log pa la 'jug par mchog tu gzhol bas 'gyel zhing mgo bo 'dud pa dang / kha chu 'dzags pas nyal ba dang mtshungs par mi bya zhing //
translated: He should not lie down as if he were drunk, or fall asleep in a heap, with his head lolling and his mouth gaping open.

original: 'di ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir sgrub pa yin pas mal stan gyi bde ba spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni brtson 'grus rtsom pa'i phyir sgrub pa yin pas mal stan gyi bde ba spang bar bya'o //
translated: He should give up the pleasure of lying down, in order to apply himself to his spiritual practice.

original: cog pu ma yin na yang sna sman btang ba'i don du dus nyung zad cig lus phab tu zin kyang dam bca' ba las nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cog pu ma yin na yang sna sman btang ba'i don du dus nyung zad cig lus phab tu zin kyang dam bca' ba las nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if he does lie down for a short time, in order to take a nasal medication, he should not break his vow of sitting upright.

original: zas phyis mi len pas kyang bstabs pa las lhag par longs spyad par mi bya zhing /
analyzed: zas phyis mi len pas kyang bstabs pa las lhag par longs spyad par mi bya zhing /
translated: He should not eat more than the amount that was offered to him, by accepting additional helpings.

original: ma bstabs pa yang zos zin nas longs spyad par mi bya ste ;
analyzed: ma bstabs pa yang zos zin nas longs spyad par mi bya ste ;
translated: And when the food has been eaten, he should not eat again without having offered it.

original: brkam chags med pa dang / chog shes pa'i rjes su mthun par bya'o //
analyzed: brkam chags med pa dang / chog shes pa'i rjes su mthun par bya'o //
translated: He should be in accord with being without greed and with contentment.

original: chos gos gsum pa bas kyang ci nas kyang yo byad bskyungs pas gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: chos gos gsum pa bas kyang ci nas kyang yo byad bskyungs pas gnas par bya ste /
translated: He should be one who is even more frugal than the one who has only three robes.

original: dbyar gyi ras chen la sogs pa yang dam bca' ba dang mi 'gal bar 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras chen la sogs pa yang dam bca' ba dang mi 'gal bar 'jug par bya'o //
translated: He should use the great rains-residence cloth, etc., without contradicting his vow.

original: phying pa pas kyang phying pa'i rgyu las byas pa'i chos gos ma rnyed par gyur na bal las byas pa snal ma btags pa yang bcang bar bya ste /
analyzed: phying pa pas kyang phying pa'i rgyu las byas pa'i chos gos ma rnyed par gyur na bal las byas pa snal ma btags pa yang bcang bar bya ste /
translated: If the one who uses felt cannot find a robe made of felt, he should use one made of wool, woven by hand.

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not in accord with that.

original: gzhi ji bzhin pas kyang rkyen de lta bu byung na gzhan las rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: gzhi ji bzhin pas kyang rkyen de lta bu byung na gzhan las rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: The one who uses what is just enough should use what is given by others in such circumstances.

original: mnos la de'i mal stan la gnas par bya ste /
analyzed: mnos la de'i mal stan la gnas par bya ste /
translated: He should take the vow and live on that bed and seat.

original: 'di lta bus de'i dam bcas pa nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bus de'i dam bcas pa nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, his vow will not be broken.

original: dur khrod pas kyang bu ram til dang sbyar tshod dang sha'i tshod ma la longs spyad par mi bya zhing dge ba yid la byed pas gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun mang du rjes su dran pa dang / byams pa'i sems dang gal te smra na chos ston pas gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: dur khrod pas kyang bu ram til dang sbyar tshod dang sha'i tshod ma la longs spyad par mi bya zhing dge ba yid la byed pas gnas pa dang / sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun mang du rjes su dran pa dang / byams pa'i sems dang gal te smra na chos ston pas gnas par bya'o //
translated: and should be mindful of the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, and should remain with a loving mind, and if speaking, should teach the Dharma.

original: gzhan dag na re dur khrod pas dur khrod du spyil po'am /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re dur khrod pas dur khrod du spyil po'am /
translated: Others say that the charnel ground practitioner should not make a hut or bed, etc.

original: mal stan la sogs pa mi bya zhing dur khrod kyi gong gi cha 'am 'og gi char gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mal stan la sogs pa mi bya zhing dur khrod kyi gong gi cha 'am 'og gi char gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: in the charnel ground, and should not remain in the upper or lower part of the charnel ground.

original: glos phab ste nyal bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: glos phab ste nyal bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not lie down on his side.üîΩHe should not eat fish, meat, milk, sesame, pastries,

original: nya dang sha dang 'o ma dang til dang / bag zan dang / ma sha'i @23a * //üîΩsran chen bza' bar mi bya /üîΩkhyim du zhugs par mi bya /
analyzed: nya dang sha dang 'o ma dang til dang / bag zan dang / ma sha'i @23a * // sran chen bza' bar mi bya / khyim du zhugs par mi bya /
translated: or beans.üîΩHe should not enter a house.

original: lhung bzed gtang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed gtang bar mi bya'o //
translated: He should not give up his alms bowl.

original: skye bo'i 'dus pa chen po longs ba slar song nas gos kyi gnas dang stan blangs la ro sregs dang shin tu mi ring bar bor ba 'phangs pas nod pa tsam gyi gnas kyi nang du 'dug pa la nam langs nas gos dang stan blangs la 'gro barüîΩbya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: skye bo'i 'dus pa chen po longs ba slar song nas gos kyi gnas dang stan blangs la ro sregs dang shin tu mi ring bar bor ba 'phangs pas nod pa tsam gyi gnas kyi nang du 'dug pa la nam langs nas gos dang stan blangs la 'gro bar bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: When dawn breaks, he should take up his robe and seat and go.
