original: shing drung pas kyang rnyings pa dang / khang stong dang / dbyar gyi dus ma gtogs pa gzhan du ljan ljin bcas pa'i shing gi rtsa ba spang bar bya'o //üîΩbla gab med pas kyang sbrang bu dang chu sbrang nyung ba /
analyzed: shing drung pas kyang rnyings pa dang / khang stong dang / dbyar gyi dus ma gtogs pa gzhan du ljan ljin bcas pa'i shing gi rtsa ba spang bar bya'o // bla gab med pas kyang sbrang bu dang chu sbrang nyung ba /
translated: The one who lives at the foot of a tree should avoid staying at the foot of a tree that is overgrown with vines, except in the rainy season.üîΩThe one who lives in the open air should stay in a place that has few flies and mosquitoes,

original: sdig sprul dang / srog chags gdug pa dang / grog sbur me dang / tsher ma dang bral ba'i gnas bstan par bya ba dpyar gnas pa'i dus su ni g-yogs pa'i gnas su 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: sdig sprul dang / srog chags gdug pa dang / grog sbur me dang / tsher ma dang bral ba'i gnas bstan par bya ba dpyar gnas pa'i dus su ni g-yogs pa'i gnas su 'dug par bya'o //
translated: and is free from snakes, poisonous insects, ants, and thorns. In the rainy season, he should stay in a covered place.

original: dur khrod pas kyang gnas g-yogs pa yod na dbyar gnas kyi bar du 'dug pa la 'gal ba med la /
analyzed: dur khrod pas kyang gnas g-yogs pa yod na dbyar gnas kyi bar du 'dug pa la 'gal ba med la /
translated: If a charnel ground is covered, there is no violation if one stays there for the duration of the rainy season retreat.

original: dbyar gyi gnas med na steng g-yogs yod par 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi gnas med na steng g-yogs yod par 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: If there is no rainy season retreat dwelling, one should go to a place that is covered.

original: de la dgon pa nyid kyang bar gyi nyes pas grong nang du dus cung zad cig 'dug na yang dam bca' ba mi gtor ba yin pa'i phyir nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dgon pa nyid kyang bar gyi nyes pas grong nang du dus cung zad cig 'dug na yang dam bca' ba mi gtor ba yin pa'i phyir nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one is in the wilderness, but goes to a village for a short time because of a minor difficulty, one does not break one's vow, because one is not staying in the village.

original: de bzhin du chos nyan pa dang / gso sbyong dang / dgag dbye'i don dang / kun la mngon par grags pa'i mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir dang / bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba dang / ltung ba las ldang ba dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos nyan pa dang / gso sbyong dang / dgag dbye'i don dang / kun la mngon par grags pa'i mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / yongs su dag par bya ba'i phyir dang / bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba dang / ltung ba las ldang ba dang /
translated: Similarly, there is no offense if one goes to listen to the teaching, to receive the po·π£adha purification, to receive the invitation ceremony, to receive a s≈´tra that is well known to all, to purify oneself, to receive full ordination, to rise from a downfall,

original: ldang pa byed du gzhug pa dang / nad gso ba dang / nad g-yog bya ba la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis 'gro ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ldang pa byed du gzhug pa dang / nad gso ba dang / nad g-yog bya ba la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis 'gro ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: to make someone else rise from a downfall, to cure an illness, to nurse someone who is ill, and so on.

original: de bzhin du shing drung pas kyang de dag lta bu'i bya ba'i gtsug lag khang du zhugs pa dang / char 'bab pa na skya rengs shar bar gyur kyang shing drung ba nyid las nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du shing drung pas kyang de dag lta bu'i bya ba'i gtsug lag khang du zhugs pa dang / char 'bab pa na skya rengs shar bar gyur kyang shing drung ba nyid las nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: So too, one who dwells in a tree root dwelling enters such a temple and when it rains, even if dawn has passed, one does not fall from the vow of dwelling at the foot of a tree.

original: shing drung pa dang / bla gab med pa dang / dur khrod pa'i nyes par 'byung ba yang dgon pa pa dang 'dra'o //üîΩphyag dar khrod pa nyid kyis kyang kha tshang bcad pa dang ; mtha' ma bcad pa dang / ba lang gis zos pa dang / byi bas zos pa dang / mes tshig pa dang / bkra shis par bya ba'i phyir lam du 'dor ba dang /
analyzed: shing drung pa dang / bla gab med pa dang / dur khrod pa'i nyes par 'byung ba yang dgon pa pa dang 'dra'o // phyag dar khrod pa nyid kyis kyang kha tshang bcad pa dang ; mtha' ma bcad pa dang / ba lang gis zos pa dang / byi bas zos pa dang / mes tshig pa dang / bkra shis par bya ba'i phyir lam du 'dor ba dang /
translated: The faults of dwelling at the foot of a tree, in the open air and in a charnel ground are similar to those of dwelling in the forest.

original: dur khrod du gtogs pa dang / smres te bor ba dang / 'jug sogs kyi rgyal mtshan dang / dge sbyong gis byin pa'i gos rnams gyon @23b pa la 'gal ba med do zhes kha cig 'dod de /
analyzed: dur khrod du gtogs pa dang / smres te bor ba dang / 'jug sogs kyi rgyal mtshan dang / dge sbyong gis byin pa'i gos rnams gyon @23b pa la 'gal ba med do zhes kha cig 'dod de /
translated: Some say: There is no contradiction in wearing the clothes of a sweeper, a butcher, a bird catcher, a hunter, a fisherman, a thief, a barber, a washer man, a garland maker, a liquor maker, a king, a messenger, a soldier, a tailor, a dancer, a singer, a musician, a prostitute, a eunuch, a woman, a child, a monk, a brahmin, a leper, one with elephantiasis, one who is blind, one who is mute, one who is mute and blind, one who is insane, one who is possessed by a ghost, one who is possessed by a spirit, one who is possessed by a demon, one who is possessed by a ghost, spirit and demon, one who is possessed by a ghost, spirit, demon and graha, one who is possessed by a ghost, spirit, demon, graha and pi≈õƒÅca, one who is possessed by a ghost, spirit, demon, graha, pi≈õƒÅca and vetƒÅla, one who is possessed by a ghost, spirit, demon, graha, pi≈õƒÅca, vetƒÅla and kumbhƒÅ·πá·∏ça, one who is possessed by a ghost, spirit, demon, graha, pi≈õƒÅca, vetƒÅla, kumbhƒÅ·πá·∏ça and rƒÅk·π£asa, one who is possessed by a ghost, spirit, demon, graha, pi≈õƒÅca, vetƒÅla, kumbhƒÅ·πá·∏ça, rƒÅk·π£asa and pi≈õƒÅca, one who is possessed by a ghost, spirit, demon, graha, pi≈õƒÅca, vetƒÅla, kumbhƒÅ·πá·∏ça, rƒÅk·π£asa and pi≈õƒÅca, one who is possessed by a ghost, spirit, demon, graha, pi≈õƒÅca, vetƒÅla, kumbhƒÅ·πá·∏ça, rƒÅk·π£asa, pi≈õƒÅca and bh≈´ta, one who is possessed by a ghost, spirit, demon, graha, pi≈õƒÅca, vetƒÅla, kumbhƒÅ·πá·∏ça, rƒÅk·π£

original: de rnams ni phyag dar khrod pa dang 'dra bar 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams ni phyag dar khrod pa dang 'dra bar 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are asserted to be like those who wear cast off rags.

original: phyag dar khrod gnyug mtshol ba'i phyir zhugs pa la gal te khyim bdag gis sra zhing gsar pa'i dar la sogs pa byin pa na de blangs kyang phyag dar khrod las nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes grag go //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod gnyug mtshol ba'i phyir zhugs pa la gal te khyim bdag gis sra zhing gsar pa'i dar la sogs pa byin pa na de blangs kyang phyag dar khrod las nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes grag go //
translated: It is well known that if a householder gives them new and strong cloth, they should accept it, but they do not transgress the practice of wearing cast off rags.

original: de bzhin du ched du bya ba'i kha zas dang / tshul shing gis bab pa'i kha zas dang / zla ba phyed pa dang / gso sbyong pa dang / dge 'dun gyi zas dang / gtsug lag khang gi kha zas rnams ni mgron du bos pa ma yin pa'i phyir bsod snyoms pa nyid las nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ched du bya ba'i kha zas dang / tshul shing gis bab pa'i kha zas dang / zla ba phyed pa dang / gso sbyong pa dang / dge 'dun gyi zas dang / gtsug lag khang gi kha zas rnams ni mgron du bos pa ma yin pa'i phyir bsod snyoms pa nyid las nyams par mi 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Similarly, they say that they do not transgress the practice of eating almsfood because they are not invited to eat food that is prepared for a specific person, food that is obtained by drawing lots, food on the days of the new moon and full moon, food of the Sa·πÖgha, or food in the temple.

original: stan gcig pa nyid du zab yang glang po che gtum po dang / rta dang / khyu mchog mi srun pa dang / sprul la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la gus pas 'phral du langs nas zas la spyod kyang stan gcig pa nyid las nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: stan gcig pa nyid du zab yang glang po che gtum po dang / rta dang / khyu mchog mi srun pa dang / sprul la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la gus pas 'phral du langs nas zas la spyod kyang stan gcig pa nyid las nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The one who is seated on one seat does not lose the quality of being seated on one seat even if he eats while standing out of respect for the elephant, horse, bull, or snake that are nearby, or for the preceptor, the master, or the practitioners of pure conduct.

original: de la sbyangs pa'i yon tan 'di rnams las dgon pa pa nyid dang / cog pu pa nyid dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid dang / dur khrod pa nyid dang / shing drung pa nyid dang / bla gab med pa nyid de drug na mal stan dang rab tu ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sbyangs pa'i yon tan 'di rnams las dgon pa pa nyid dang / cog pu pa nyid dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid dang / dur khrod pa nyid dang / shing drung pa nyid dang / bla gab med pa nyid de drug na mal stan dang rab tu ldan pa yin no //
translated: Among these ascetic practices, the six beginning with the practice of living in the forest are related to the bed and seat.

original: phyag dar khrod pa nyid dang / chos gos gsum pa nyid dang phyir pa pa nyid de gsum ni chos gos dang rab tu ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: phyag dar khrod pa nyid dang / chos gos gsum pa nyid dang phyir pa pa nyid de gsum ni chos gos dang rab tu ldan pa yin no //
translated: The three beginning with the practice of wearing robes made of rags are related to the robes.

original: bsod snyoms pa nyid dang / stan gcig ba nyid dang / zas phyis mi len pa nyid de gsum po nyid ni bsod snyoms dang rab tu ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa nyid dang / stan gcig ba nyid dang / zas phyis mi len pa nyid de gsum po nyid ni bsod snyoms dang rab tu ldan pa yin no //
translated: The three, namely, the practice of living on alms food, the practice of wearing robes made of rags, and the practice of sitting at the foot of a tree, are the practices of the alms-food gatherer.

original: de dag las kyang bsod snyoms dang / chos gos dang / mal stan la sred pa nye bar skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i rigs dang rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dag las kyang bsod snyoms dang / chos gos dang / mal stan la sred pa nye bar skyed pa'i rgyur gyur pa rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'phags pa'i rigs dang rjes su mthun par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par blang bar bya ste /
translated: And, among these, the practice of living on alms food, the practice of wearing robes made of rags, and the practice of sitting at the foot of a tree are to be undertaken in order to pacify the causes that give rise to craving for food, robes, and bedding, and in order to conform to the noble lineage.

original: de la gnas na spang ba la mngon bar dga' ba nyid kyis srid par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu can gyi srid pa rnam par gcod pa yin pas bde ba dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gnas na spang ba la mngon bar dga' ba nyid kyis srid par 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu can gyi srid pa rnam par gcod pa yin pas bde ba dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Dwelling in these, one is happy because one is free from craving for food, robes, and bedding, and because one is free from craving for existence, since one delights in renunciation.

original: kha cig na re sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang po gsum ni gtso bor gyur pa yin la lhag ma rnams ni khor du gyur ba yin no zhes 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig na re sbyangs pa'i yon tan dang po gsum ni gtso bor gyur pa yin la lhag ma rnams ni khor du gyur ba yin no zhes 'dod de /
translated: Some believe that the first three of the ascetic practices are the principal ones, while the others are secondary.

original: 'phags pa mdzes dga' la mngon par dgyes pa ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa mdzes dga' la mngon par dgyes pa ston pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he manifests his joy in the noble Sudatta.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' bo khyod nam ngas @24a * //
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis dga' bo khyod nam ngas @24a * //
translated: And the Blessed One said to Nanda:

original: mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'e //
analyzed: mthong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'e //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen I see you, Nanda, with the thirty-two major marks of a great man,

original: la la na re gang gis gnas brtan rnams mchog nyid du bstan cing grags pa'i lnga po 'di dag gis gtso bor gyur pa yin la de las gzhan pa bdun ni 'khor du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: la la na re gang gis gnas brtan rnams mchog nyid du bstan cing grags pa'i lnga po 'di dag gis gtso bor gyur pa yin la de las gzhan pa bdun ni 'khor du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Some say that these five elders are the most eminent because they are renowned as the best, and the other seven are their retinue.

original: 'di dag thams cad kyang dad pa rnam par dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / yon tan du mas phul du byung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'dra bar smad par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de rab tu zhi ba yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad kyang dad pa rnam par dag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / yon tan du mas phul du byung ba yin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa dang 'dra bar smad par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de rab tu zhi ba yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: All of them are the best of those who are pure in faith, the best of those who have many virtues, the best of those who are irreproachable like the Tathagata, the best of those who are tranquil,

original: rab tu zhi ba 'phel bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bkra shis pa'i mchog yin no //
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba 'phel bar byed pa nyid yin pa'i phyir bkra shis pa'i mchog yin no //
translated: and the best of those who increase tranquility.

original: legs pa'i lam bstan pa'i gtam las sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyis mdzes pa zhes bya ba phun sum tshogs pa gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: legs pa'i lam bstan pa'i gtam las sbyangs pa'i yon tan gyis mdzes pa zhes bya ba phun sum tshogs pa gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second perfection: beauty through the ornament of good qualities.

original: // / sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag blangs //
analyzed: // / sbyangs pa'i yon tan yang dag blangs //
translated: Taking up the ascetic practices,üîΩhe should be mindful of the meaning,

original: don dran pa la yang dag gnas //
analyzed: don dran pa la yang dag gnas //
translated: and abide in vigilance.

original: shes bzhin ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
analyzed: shes bzhin ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pa //
translated: The ascetic whose practice is vigilant

original: sbyod pa thams cad don yod 'gyur //
analyzed: sbyod pa thams cad don yod 'gyur //
translated: makes all his activities meaningful.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i ldang ba dang 'dug pa na shes bzhin dang ldan pa kho na bya'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i ldang ba dang 'dug pa na shes bzhin dang ldan pa kho na bya'o //
translated: As explained, he should be vigilant in all his activities, whether he is standing or sitting.

original: de la lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las thams cad shes bzhin nyid kyis so sor legs par brtags nas bya ste /üîΩ'di ni 'di'i rgyur bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de la lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi las thams cad shes bzhin nyid kyis so sor legs par brtags nas bya ste / 'di ni 'di'i rgyur bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: He should do all his actions with his body, speech, and mind after careful consideration, with vigilance.

original: 'di ni 'di'i rgyur spyad par bya'o snyam pas don med pa ci yang bsgrub par mi bya na dge ba rnams lta ci smos /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i rgyur spyad par bya'o snyam pas don med pa ci yang bsgrub par mi bya na dge ba rnams lta ci smos /
translated: He should not undertake anything meaningless, thinking, ‚ÄúThis is the cause for that, so I will do this in order to achieve that.‚Äù

original: 'di ni shes bzhin don dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni shes bzhin don dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: This is the meaningful practice of vigilance.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa sgra gcan 'dzin la gdams pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa sgra gcan 'dzin la gdams pa las /
translated: As it says in the ƒÄrya-rƒÅ·π£·π≠rapƒÅla-s≈´tra:

original: sgra gcan 'dzin de bas na lus kyi las byed par 'dod pas lus 'di ni rus pa sum brgya 'dus pa /
analyzed: sgra gcan 'dzin de bas na lus kyi las byed par 'dod pas lus 'di ni rus pa sum brgya 'dus pa /
translated: RƒÅhula, therefore, one who wishes to engage in physical action should view this body as a composite of three hundred bones

original: rgyus pas sbrel ba /
analyzed: rgyus pas sbrel ba /
translated: connected by tendons,

original: sha'i ris brgya phrag du mas zhal zhal byas pa /
analyzed: sha'i ris brgya phrag du mas zhal zhal byas pa /
translated: covered with many hundreds of patches of flesh,

original: pags pas g-yogs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: pags pas g-yogs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: and wrapped in the moist skin.

original: sems kyi dbang gis 'jug par byed pa /
analyzed: sems kyi dbang gis 'jug par byed pa /
translated: It is moved by the power of the mind,

original: me dang rlung gis rgyu bar byed pa /
analyzed: me dang rlung gis rgyu bar byed pa /
translated: and it is moved by the power of fire and wind.

original: sa dang chu dag shas che bar gyur pa na mal dang stan la sogs pa la 'jug pa /üîΩrkyen la rag las pas mi brtan pa nyid kyis na sdug bsngal ba de nyid kyi phyir bdag dang bdag gi ba med pa zhes gsungs pa dang / ji skad du dge slong dag lus 'di ni khyod gcig gi yang ma yin /
analyzed: sa dang chu dag shas che bar gyur pa na mal dang stan la sogs pa la 'jug pa / rkyen la rag las pas mi brtan pa nyid kyis na sdug bsngal ba de nyid kyi phyir bdag dang bdag gi ba med pa zhes gsungs pa dang / ji skad du dge slong dag lus 'di ni khyod gcig gi yang ma yin /
translated: When the elements of earth and water predominate, it is placed on a bed or seat.üîΩIt is unstable because it depends on conditions, and therefore it is suffering.üîΩFor this very reason, it is said that it is devoid of self and what belongs to self.üîΩAnd it is said:

original: gzhan gyi yang ma yin pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yang ma yin pa 'di ni /
translated: Monks, this body is not yours, nor is it that of others.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid yang dag par shes pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / @24b nges par bya ba yongs su rdzogs nas kyang 'dug ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid yang dag par shes pa yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / @24b nges par bya ba yongs su rdzogs nas kyang 'dug ste /
translated: It is the correct knowledge of their own characteristics.üîΩAnd when the task of ascertaining is completed, he should remain

original: gang gis goms pa dang rjes su mthun par mngon par 'dod pa'i bya ba 'jug pas bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba yin la byed pa la mngon par phyogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / rjes su mthun pa la mngon par phyogs pa 'dis yid la bya ste /
analyzed: gang gis goms pa dang rjes su mthun par mngon par 'dod pa'i bya ba 'jug pas bya ba ni nges par 'byung ba yin la byed pa la mngon par phyogs pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / rjes su mthun pa la mngon par phyogs pa 'dis yid la bya ste /
translated: in the state of equanimity that is in conformity with the practice of the mindfulnesses.

original: 'di ni rang gi spyod yul shes pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rang gi spyod yul shes pa nyid yin no //
translated: This is the knowledge of one‚Äôs own sphere.üîΩHe should accomplish at the appropriate time whatever task is to be done,

original: shes bzhin du bya ba 'di dag las gang zhig gang gi dus su bsgrub par bya ba de dus ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: shes bzhin du bya ba 'di dag las gang zhig gang gi dus su bsgrub par bya ba de dus ji lta ba bzhin du bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: knowing the time for each of the activities.

original: 'di ni ma rmongs pa'i yang dag pa shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni ma rmongs pa'i yang dag pa shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: This is the knowledge of non-delusion.üîΩAs it is said, ‚ÄúHow does a monk become one who knows the time?

original: ji skad du dge slong gis dus shes par 'gyur ba ji lta ba yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du dge slong gis dus shes par 'gyur ba ji lta ba yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúHow does a bhik·π£u come to know the proper time?‚Äù

original: de ltar yang dag pa'i shes bzhin nyid la sogs lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las shin tu rnam par dag pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba tsam bsgrub par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar yang dag pa'i shes bzhin nyid la sogs lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las shin tu rnam par dag pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba tsam bsgrub par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Thus, the extremely pure actions of body, speech, and mind, such as right mindfulness, are the accomplishment of the mere preparation of concentration.

original: lus dang ngag gi nyes pa 'bring dang ni //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi nyes pa 'bring dang ni //
translated: The middling faults of body and speech,

original: sems byung ba yi phra mo zhi gyur na //
analyzed: sems byung ba yi phra mo zhi gyur na //
translated: and the subtle faults of mind are pacified.

original: sa rdul bkrus pa'i gser ni phra mo bzhin //
analyzed: sa rdul bkrus pa'i gser ni phra mo bzhin //
translated: Like the subtle dust of gold that is washed away,

original: dge ba'i rnam rtog lhag ma lus par 'gyur //
analyzed: dge ba'i rnam rtog lhag ma lus par 'gyur //
translated: the remaining virtuous thoughts are left behind.

original: de ni ting nge 'dzin mngon par 'dus byas pa las thob pa sems bsdus nas 'jog pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni ting nge 'dzin mngon par 'dus byas pa las thob pa sems bsdus nas 'jog pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is the attainment from the manifest performance of concentration, called the placement of the mind through gathering.

original: ji skad du phyag dar 'khrud par byed pa'i mdo las //
analyzed: ji skad du phyag dar 'khrud par byed pa'i mdo las //
translated: As it is said in the S≈´tra on Washing Away Dust:

original: yang dag mtshan ma la ni legs gnas la //üîΩmnyam zhing rgod dang zhum pa'i sems nyid ni //
analyzed: yang dag mtshan ma la ni legs gnas la // mnyam zhing rgod dang zhum pa'i sems nyid ni //
translated: Dwelling well in the right signs,üîΩthe mind that is even, without agitation or depression,

original: btang snyoms zhi dang 'dzin par gyur nyid du //
analyzed: btang snyoms zhi dang 'dzin par gyur nyid du //
translated: becomes equanimous, peaceful, and focused.

original: sems de la ni mngon brtson mnyam par gzhag / gser gyi phye ma sa rdul sbyangs pa ni //
analyzed: sems de la ni mngon brtson mnyam par gzhag / gser gyi phye ma sa rdul sbyangs pa ni //
translated: Just as gold dust is purified by fire,

original: se'u'i khar gzhag 'ju par 'dod pa na //
analyzed: se'u'i khar gzhag 'ju par 'dod pa na //
translated: and placed in an acid solution,üîΩthe fire is controlled,

original: me stobs mnyam zhing rno dang chung ba ni //
analyzed: me stobs mnyam zhing rno dang chung ba ni //
translated: and the gold is purified by the acid solution.

original: btang snyoms gzhag dang dbal bsad sngar mtshungs dang // rnal 'byor spyod pa'i rnam g-yengs 'dis mnyam par gzhag pa'i phan yon la bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms gzhag dang dbal bsad sngar mtshungs dang // rnal 'byor spyod pa'i rnam g-yengs 'dis mnyam par gzhag pa'i phan yon la bsam par bya'o //
translated: The yogƒÅcƒÅra, in the same way, is indifferent to the distraction of the world, and is intent on the purification of the mind.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / gzhan gyi kha na ma las pa'i ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba'i ro sten par byed pa na mi las 'das pa'i dga' ba yid du'ong ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa dang / gzhan gyi kha na ma las pa'i ting nge 'dzin las byung ba'i dga' ba dang bde ba'i ro sten par byed pa na mi las 'das pa'i dga' ba yid du'ong ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: The yogƒÅcƒÅra who has attained concentration, when he cultivates the taste of the joy and pleasure born of concentration, free from evil and the reproach of others, experiences a joy and pleasure surpassing that of men.

original: ji skad du dge slong khyim stong par zhugs pa ni mi'i las 'dus pa'i dga' ba thob po zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du dge slong khyim stong par zhugs pa ni mi'i las 'dus pa'i dga' ba thob po zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThe monk who enters an empty house obtains the joy of the assembly of men.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du lus 'di nyid la dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba bde ba dang / ting nge 'dzin yongs su @25a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus 'di nyid la dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba bde ba dang / ting nge 'dzin yongs su @25a * //
translated: Likewise, in this very body, there is the joy and bliss born of seclusion, and there is concentration.üîΩ

original: sbyang ba byas pa'i sems 'jam zhing las su rung ba sgrib pa'i rnyog pa dang bral ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyi bde blag tu mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyang ba byas pa'i sems 'jam zhing las su rung ba sgrib pa'i rnyog pa dang bral ba ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi rang bzhin gyi bde blag tu mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, in this very body, one sees the pleasure and joy born of seclusion, and the mind that is supple and serviceable, free from the turbidity of obscurations, through the thorough training in concentration.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag ting nge 'dzin bsgoms shing ting nge 'dzin mang du bya zhing bag yod pa dang / sdig pa dang bral ba dang / nang du yang dag par 'jog pas rnal 'byor la mnyam par gzhag par bya zhing sems nang du zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag ting nge 'dzin bsgoms shing ting nge 'dzin mang du bya zhing bag yod pa dang / sdig pa dang bral ba dang / nang du yang dag par 'jog pas rnal 'byor la mnyam par gzhag par bya zhing sems nang du zhi bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One said, ‚ÄúMonks, you should cultivate concentration, you should have much concentration, you should be heedful, free from evil, and practice yoga with mental equipoise through inner proper placement, and you should pacify the mind internally.

original: ting nge 'dzin la brten nas mngon par shes pa lnga dang // khyad par de dang de thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la brten nas mngon par shes pa lnga dang // khyad par de dang de thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Based on concentration, you will attain the five superknowledges and various special qualities.‚Äù

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: de de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyi cho 'phrul gyi cho ga mngon sum du bya bas sems la dbang sgyur zhing de rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba dpag tu med pa nyams su myong bar byed do zhes gsungs pa yin pas /
analyzed: de de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyi cho 'phrul gyi cho ga mngon sum du bya bas sems la dbang sgyur zhing de rdzu 'phrul gyi bya ba dpag tu med pa nyams su myong bar byed do zhes gsungs pa yin pas /
translated: Since he has directly perceived the ritual of the miracle of the mind that is thus concentrated, he has mastery over the mind and experiences limitless miracles.

original: ting nge 'dzin thob pa mi slob pa'i sa ma thob par ma nyams par dus byas nas ting nge 'dzin ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob pa mi slob pa'i sa ma thob par ma nyams par dus byas nas ting nge 'dzin ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i ting nge 'dzin phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one who has attained concentration and has not lost it at the time of death before attaining the stage of no more learning will be reborn in the form and formless worlds in accordance with his concentration.üîΩThe Exposition of Karma states:üîΩKarma accumulated through the enjoyment of concentration results in the perfection of being a lord of the gods or a universal monarch and so on.

original: ji skad du skye ba rnam par 'byed pa las ting nge 'dzin gyi nye bar spyod pas nye bar bsags pa'i las kyi lha'i bdag po dang / 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du skye ba rnam par 'byed pa las ting nge 'dzin gyi nye bar spyod pas nye bar bsags pa'i las kyi lha'i bdag po dang / 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa'i phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / ji skad du /
translated: And the S≈´tra on Chanting the Dharma Together states:

original: dge slong dag nga len sum cu rtsa drug gi phar du lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin du gyur na /
analyzed: dge slong dag nga len sum cu rtsa drug gi phar du lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin du gyur na /
translated: Monks, I have been ≈öakra, Lord of the Gods, thirty-six times.

original: rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang skur bar gyur pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: rgyal po rgyal rigs spyi bo nas dbang skur bar gyur pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention that I have been a king, a k·π£atriya anointed on the head?

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: In that way,

original: ting 'dzin grub phyir yid ni brtson gyur pa //
analyzed: ting 'dzin grub phyir yid ni brtson gyur pa //
translated: The mind is diligent for the sake of accomplishing samƒÅdhi.

original: de yi yang dag yon tan la lta ba //
analyzed: de yi yang dag yon tan la lta ba //
translated: Seeing its perfect qualities,

original: yon tan la dags bya ba 'grub pa dang // sems ni spro ba brten pa nyid du 'gyur //üîΩde la ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni bying ba dang / zhum pa dang / rnam par g-yengs pa dang / mi mnyam pa spang ba'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba dmigs pa gcig la gtod pas ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: yon tan la dags bya ba 'grub pa dang // sems ni spro ba brten pa nyid du 'gyur // de la ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba ni bying ba dang / zhum pa dang / rnam par g-yengs pa dang / mi mnyam pa spang ba'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba dmigs pa gcig la gtod pas ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba'am /
translated: One is satisfied with the qualities, and one‚Äôs mind becomes stable and enthusiastic.üîΩHere, ‚ÄúsamƒÅdhi‚Äù is the mind and mental factors being focused on a single object in order to abandon sinking, agitation, distraction, and unevenness. Therefore, it is called ‚ÄúsamƒÅdhi.‚Äù

original: sems dang sems las byung ba dmigs pa gcig yang dag par sdud pas na ting nge 'dzin yin pa'am /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba dmigs pa gcig yang dag par sdud pas na ting nge 'dzin yin pa'am /
translated: Or, samƒÅdhi is the mind and mental factors being focused on a single object.

original: phyin ci ma log pa yin pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la gtod cing 'jog pa na phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par ye shes dang mthong ba de dang de skyed pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa yin pas ting nge 'dzin 'di la gtod cing 'jog pa na phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par ye shes dang mthong ba de dang de skyed pa'i phyir ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Since it is unmistaken, when one is focused on and settled in this samƒÅdhi, it is samƒÅdhi because it generates that wisdom and insight that are special excellences.

original: de yang gang rnam par dag pa'i sems @25b dmigs pa gcig la nye bar zhi ba'i yon tan gyis yang dag par brtson 'grus 'jug cing mi g-yeng bar gnas pa'am //
analyzed: de yang gang rnam par dag pa'i sems @25b dmigs pa gcig la nye bar zhi ba'i yon tan gyis yang dag par brtson 'grus 'jug cing mi g-yeng bar gnas pa'am //
translated: Moreover, it is when one's pure mind is focused on a single object and one engages in correct effort with the qualities of tranquility and abides without distraction.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rlung gis ma bskyod par khang pa'i nang gi mar me dang 'dra bar sems rtse gcig par 'jug pa ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rlung gis ma bskyod par khang pa'i nang gi mar me dang 'dra bar sems rtse gcig par 'jug pa ni ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ste /
translated: Or it is when one's mind engages one-pointedly, like a lamp in a house that is not shaken by the wind of the secondary afflictions. This is called samƒÅdhi.

original: sems gnas pa dang yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems gnas pa dang yang dag par gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThe mind abides and abides correctly.‚Äù

original: yang na rnam pa gcig pa dang / sbyor ba gcig pa dang / sgo gcig pa dang / dmigs pa gcig pa la sems yang dag par 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rnam pa gcig pa dang / sbyor ba gcig pa dang / sgo gcig pa dang / dmigs pa gcig pa la sems yang dag par 'jog pa'o //
translated: Or it is when the mind is correctly settled on a single aspect, a single engagement, a single door, and a single object.

original: de yang sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de yang sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Moreover, it is the characteristic of one-pointedness of mind.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba rab tu zhi ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba rab tu zhi ba'i phyir nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: It is the basis for the complete pacification of the torment of the afflictions.

original: de ni 'gyod pa med pa dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pas kun nas bslang ba'i gzhi'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'gyod pa med pa dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pas kun nas bslang ba'i gzhi'i gnas yin no //
translated: It is the basis for the complete eradication of regret, joy, satisfaction, and pliancy.

original: de ni sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyad kyis rnam pa gcig yin no //
analyzed: de ni sems rtse gcig pa'i mtshan nyad kyis rnam pa gcig yin no //
translated: It is one kind by way of the characteristic of one-pointedness of mind.

original: 'jag rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbye bas ni rnam pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: 'jag rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dbye bas ni rnam pa gnyis yin te /
translated: It is two kinds by way of mundane and supramundane.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dang rab tu ldan pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dang rab tu ldan pa ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: That endowed with the branches of enlightenment is supramundane.üîΩThe others are mundane.

original: de las gzhan pa ni 'jig rten pa rnams so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni 'jig rten pa rnams so //
translated: Moreover,

original: yang ; yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam pa gnyis te //
analyzed: yang ; yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni rnam pa gnyis te //
translated: right concentration is two kinds:

original: dge ba la sems rtse gcig pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: dge ba la sems rtse gcig pa ni yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: one-pointedness of mind on virtue is right concentration.

original: mi dge ba la sems rtse gcig pa ni log pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: mi dge ba la sems rtse gcig pa ni log pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: One-pointedness of mind on nonvirtue is wrong concentration.

original: gzhan yang lung du bstan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang lung du bstan pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa gnyis te /
translated: determinate and indeterminate.

original: lung du bstan pa ni dge ba dang / ma bstan pa ni mi dge ba dag go //
analyzed: lung du bstan pa ni dge ba dang / ma bstan pa ni mi dge ba dag go //
translated: The determinate is wholesome and the indeterminate is unwholesome.

original: de gnyi ga las go bzlog pa ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga las go bzlog pa ni lung du ma bstan pa'o //
translated: The opposite of both is indeterminate.

original: gzhan dag ni ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gnyis su 'chad de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni ting nge 'dzin rnam pa gnyis su 'chad de /
translated: Others explain concentration as twofold:

original: nye bar gdags pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / gtod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: nye bar gdags pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / gtod pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: concentration of designation and concentration of projection.

original: ting nge 'dzin de dang de dag las snga ma'i cha dang nye ba ni gdags pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de dang de dag las snga ma'i cha dang nye ba ni gdags pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: Concentration of designation is that which is proximate to the former part of this or that concentration.

original: rigs su gyur pa'i chos kyi rjes thogs la ni gtod pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
analyzed: rigs su gyur pa'i chos kyi rjes thogs la ni gtod pa'i ting nge 'dzin yin no //
translated: Concentration of projection is that which is projected in the future, immediately after the Dharma of the family.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa gnyis te ;
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa gnyis te ;
translated: Furthermore, it is twofold:

original: dga' ba dang bcas pa dang / dga' ba med pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bcas pa dang / dga' ba med pa'o //
translated: with joy and without joy.

original: dga' ba dang bcas pa ni bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / de'i nyer bsdogs dang / de'i mthus gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bcas pa ni bsam gtan dang po dang / gnyis pa dang / de'i nyer bsdogs dang / de'i mthus gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
translated: The first and second absorptions, their access concentrations, and the attainments that occur through their power are associated with joy.

original: dga' ba med pa ni de yan chad kyi bsam gtan dang / nyer bsdogs @26a * //
analyzed: dga' ba med pa ni de yan chad kyi bsam gtan dang / nyer bsdogs @26a * //
translated: The absorptions and access concentrations above that are not associated with joy.

original: dang ; de'i mthus gnas pa rnams so //
analyzed: dang ; de'i mthus gnas pa rnams so //
translated: The attainments that occur through their power are also not associated with joy.

original: yang gnyis te //
analyzed: yang gnyis te //
translated: There are two more types:

original: gzugs la spyod pa dang // gzugs med pa la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la spyod pa dang // gzugs med pa la spyod pa'o //
translated: those that occur in the form realm and those that occur in the formless realm.

original: gzugs la spyod pa ni slob pa dang / so so'i skye bo rnams bsam gtan bzhi dang / de'i nyer bsdogs dang / de'i mthus snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs la spyod pa ni slob pa dang / so so'i skye bo rnams bsam gtan bzhi dang / de'i nyer bsdogs dang / de'i mthus snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
translated: Those that occur in the form realm are the four absorptions, their access concentrations, and the attainments that occur through their power, which are possessed by both those in training and ordinary beings.

original: gzugs med pa ni gzugs med pa la spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa ni gzugs med pa la spyod pa rnams so //
translated: Those that occur in the formless realm are possessed only by those in training.

original: gzhan yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two more types:

original: smon pa dang bcas pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: smon pa dang bcas pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //
translated: those that are accompanied by aspiration and those that are not accompanied by aspiration.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag can ma yin pa srid pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa ni smon pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag can ma yin pa srid pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa ni smon pa'o //
translated: Those that are accompanied by aspiration are those that are not possessed by those who possess the branches of enlightenment and that bring about the actualization of existence.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag dang bcas srid pa spong bar byed pa ni smin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag dang bcas srid pa spong bar byed pa ni smin pa med pa'o //
translated: The one that is accompanied by the limbs of enlightenment and that abandons existence is not ripe.

original: yang rnam pa gsum te //
analyzed: yang rnam pa gsum te //
translated: There are three more kinds:

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa tsam dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa tsam dang / rtog pa med cing dpyod pa tsam dang / rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa'o //
translated: that which is accompanied by both discursive thought and sustained thought, that which is accompanied by neither discursive thought nor sustained thought.

original: de la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni bsam gtan dang po dang de'i mthus snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de la rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bcas pa ni bsam gtan dang po dang de'i mthus snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: That which is accompanied by both discursive thought and sustained thought is the first meditation and the attainment that is due to its power.

original: rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam ni bsam gtan dang po'i bsam gtan khyad par can dang / de'i mthus snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam ni bsam gtan dang po'i bsam gtan khyad par can dang / de'i mthus snyoms par 'jug pa'o //
translated: That which is accompanied by sustained thought alone, and is not accompanied by discursive thought, is the special first meditation and the attainment that is due to its power.

original: rtog pa med la dpyod pa med pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dang / de'i nyer bsdogs dang / de'i mthus snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
analyzed: rtog pa med la dpyod pa med pa ni bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa dang / de'i nyer bsdogs dang / de'i mthus snyoms par 'jug pa rnams so //
translated: That which is not accompanied by either discursive thought or sustained thought is the second meditation, etc., and the attainment that is due to its power.

original: yang ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang ting nge 'dzin rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of concentration:

original: nyams pa dang / gnas pa dang / khyad par dang / nges par 'byed pa'i skal pa can no //
analyzed: nyams pa dang / gnas pa dang / khyad par dang / nges par 'byed pa'i skal pa can no //
translated: the stage of degeneration, the stage of stability, the stage of distinction, and the stage of the spiritual victor.

original: gzhan yang 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i dbang du byas pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dun pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / sems dang / dpyod pa'i dbang du byas pa bzhi'o //
translated: Moreover, there are four stages in terms of the predominance of aspiration, effort, mind, and examination.

original: de nyid dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas ting nge 'dzin rnam pa mang po yod do //
analyzed: de nyid dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / chung ngu dang / 'bring dang chen po'i dbye bas ting nge 'dzin rnam pa mang po yod do //
translated: Moreover, there are many kinds of meditative concentration in terms of the differentiation of object, aspect, small, medium, and great.

original: de yang shin tu bsdus pa dang / rgyas pa ma yin par rim pa rab ma la gnas nas 'di dag tsam zhig rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang shin tu bsdus pa dang / rgyas pa ma yin par rim pa rab ma la gnas nas 'di dag tsam zhig rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, these are established in a very condensed and not extensive way, in terms of the stages of abiding, and so on.

original: 'di lta ste bsam gtan bzhi dang / de'i nye bsngogs gsum dang / gzugs med pa rnam pa bzhi dang / rjes su dran pa drug dang / tshad med pa rnam pa bzhi dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa rjes su dran pa dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste bsam gtan bzhi dang / de'i nye bsngogs gsum dang / gzugs med pa rnam pa bzhi dang / rjes su dran pa drug dang / tshad med pa rnam pa bzhi dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang rngub pa rjes su dran pa dang /
translated: They are the four meditative concentrations, the three access concentrations to the meditative concentrations, the four formless states, the six recollections, the four immeasurables, and the mindfulness of inhalation and exhalation.

original: 'du shes bcu dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / zil gyis non pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / 'du @26b shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang smon pa med pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum dang /
analyzed: 'du shes bcu dang / zad par gyi skye mched bcu dang / zil gyis non pa'i skye mched brgyad dang / rnam par thar pa brgyad dang / zil gyis gnon pa dang / 'du @26b shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid dang smon pa med pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gsum dang /
translated: the ten perceptions, the ten powers of perceptual limitlessness, the eight bases of subjugation, the eight deliverances, the subjugation and the meditative absorption of non-perception, the three meditative absorptions of emptiness, absence of expectancy and absence of attributes,

original: rjes su mthun pa la rjes su mthun par 'du shes la sogs pa snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid gsum dang / yan lag lnga dang / shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa la rjes su mthun par 'du shes la sogs pa snyoms par 'jug pa dang / stong pa nyid gsum dang / yan lag lnga dang / shes pa lnga dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin rnams so //
translated: the meditative absorption of the conformity of perception to the conformity of the object, the three emptinesses, the five branches and the five cognitions.

original: de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs 'di dag rnal 'byor pas gzhung dang don gyi sgo nas yang dag par rtogs par byas nas kyang de rdzogs par bya ba'i don du gtam bcu bzhi'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen nam /
analyzed: de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs 'di dag rnal 'byor pas gzhung dang don gyi sgo nas yang dag par rtogs par byas nas kyang de rdzogs par bya ba'i don du gtam bcu bzhi'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen nam /
translated: Thus, having perfectly understood these collections of meditative absorption by means of the text and their meaning, the yogin should perfect them by means of a spiritual master who is endowed with the excellent qualities of the fourteen kinds of expertise.

original: mkhan po'am / slob dpon nam /üîΩtshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa de lta bu bsten par bya ba'am /
analyzed: mkhan po'am / slob dpon nam / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa de lta bu bsten par bya ba'am /
translated: or a fellow brahmacƒÅrin.

original: gang zhig la brten nam thos pa thos pa dang / thos pa rnams yongs su dag par byed pa dang / the tshom spong bar 'gyur ba dang / lta ba drang por byed pa dang / tshig zab mo'i don so sor shes rab kyis rtogs pa dang /
analyzed: gang zhig la brten nam thos pa thos pa dang / thos pa rnams yongs su dag par byed pa dang / the tshom spong bar 'gyur ba dang / lta ba drang por byed pa dang / tshig zab mo'i don so sor shes rab kyis rtogs pa dang /
translated: One should rely on someone who, when one hears the Dharma, purifies what one has heard, abandons doubts, makes one‚Äôs view straight, and understands the meaning of the profound words with wisdom.üîΩOne should rely on someone who, when one trains, increases the special qualities of ethics, learning, wisdom, and so on.

original: gang zhig la bslab pa na tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par 'phel bar 'gyur ba la brten par bya'o //üîΩgang yang sdug dang bla ma dang // dang bya smra mkhas tshig sma nus //
analyzed: gang zhig la bslab pa na tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan gyi khyad par 'phel bar 'gyur ba la brten par bya'o // gang yang sdug dang bla ma dang // dang bya smra mkhas tshig sma nus //
translated: One should rely on someone who isüîΩpleasant, superior,üîΩand skilled in speech,

original: zab mo'i gtam ni ston byed pa //üîΩgnas min pa ni mi sbyar ro //
analyzed: zab mo'i gtam ni ston byed pa // gnas min pa ni mi sbyar ro //
translated: who teaches the profound,üîΩand who is not a bad person.üîΩIf one finds such a person, one should rely on them.üîΩIf one does not find such a person, one should not rely on anyone.üîΩIf one finds such a person, one should rely on them.üîΩIf one does not find such a person, one should not rely on anyone.üîΩIf one finds such a person, one should rely on them.üîΩIf one does not find such a person, one should not rely on anyone.üîΩIf one finds such a person, one should rely on them.üîΩIf one does not find such a person, one should not rely on anyone.üîΩIf one finds such a person, one should rely on them.üîΩIf one does not find such a person, one should not rely on anyone.üîΩIf one finds such a person, one should rely on them.üîΩIf one does not find such a person, one should not rely on anyone.üîΩIf one finds such a person, one should rely on them.üîΩIf one does not find such a person, one should not rely on anyone.üîΩIf one finds such a person, one should rely on them.üîΩIf one does not find such a person, one should not rely on anyone.üîΩIf one finds such a person, one should rely on them.üîΩIf one does not find such a person, one should not rely on anyone.üîΩIf one finds such a person, one should rely on them.üîΩIf one does not find such a person, one should not rely on anyone.üîΩIf one finds such a person, one should rely on them.üîΩIf one does not find such a person, one should not rely on anyone.üîΩIf one finds such a person, one should rely on them.üîΩIf one does not find such a person, one should not rely on anyone.

original: gal te rnyed na sdig med shes rab can //
analyzed: gal te rnyed na sdig med shes rab can //
translated: If one finds such a person, one should rely on them.üîΩIf one does not

original: zhes bya ba la sogs dang / kun dga' po 'di ni tshangs par spyod pa yongs su dag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs dang / kun dga' po 'di ni tshangs par spyod pa yongs su dag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ji skad du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnanda, this is the purity of the holy life.‚Äù

original: de la sdug pa ni tshul khrims dang thos pa phun sum tshogs pa'i byams pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis sam ;
analyzed: de la sdug pa ni tshul khrims dang thos pa phun sum tshogs pa'i byams pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis sam ;
translated: Therein, one is dear through the perfection of morality and learning, through love, and through body, speech, and mind.

original: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don mthun pa dang / don spyod pas ni sdug par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don mthun pa dang / don spyod pas ni sdug par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Or one is dear through generosity, agreeable speech, beneficence, and sameness of purpose.

original: nye bar zhi ba la goms pa dang / tshig ma 'chal ba dang ldan pa nyid dang / chog shes pa nyid kyis na bla ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba la goms pa dang / tshig ma 'chal ba dang ldan pa nyid dang / chog shes pa nyid kyis na bla ma yin no //
translated: One is venerable through the practice of tranquility, through the possession of unimpaired speech, and through contentment.

original: shes pa dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ; khyad par rtogs par 'os pa'i spyod lam dang ldan pa'i phyir dang bar bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa dang / yon tan phun sum tshogs pa dang ; khyad par rtogs par 'os pa'i spyod lam dang ldan pa'i phyir dang bar bya'o //
translated: One is confident through knowledge, through the perfection of good qualities, and through conduct worthy of a superior person.

original: chos la gus pa dang / gzhan la phan pa la brtson pa'i blo can nyid dang / yang dag par dang / dus dang / 'jam pa dang / don dang ldan par tshig smra ba la mkhas pa dang / bdag nyid gzhal ba @27a * //üîΩshis pas na smra ba la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: chos la gus pa dang / gzhan la phan pa la brtson pa'i blo can nyid dang / yang dag par dang / dus dang / 'jam pa dang / don dang ldan par tshig smra ba la mkhas pa dang / bdag nyid gzhal ba @27a * // shis pas na smra ba la mkhas pa'o //
translated: He is skilled in speaking words that are respectful of the Dharma, that are directed to the benefit of others, that are correct, timely, gentle, and meaningful.üîΩHe is skilled in speaking because he is skilled in speaking words that are respectful of the Dharma, that are directed to the benefit of others, that are correct, timely, gentle, and meaningful.

original: rang bzhin bzang ba nyid dang / rang dang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs shes pa dang / gtam gyi bya ba la mkhas pas na tshig smra ba nus pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin bzang ba nyid dang / rang dang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs shes pa dang / gtam gyi bya ba la mkhas pas na tshig smra ba nus pa'o //
translated: He is able to speak because he is naturally good, he knows the systems of his own and other schools, and he is skilled in the activity of conversation.

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rim pa shes pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas zab mo'i gtam ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i rim pa shes pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pas zab mo'i gtam ston par byed pa'o //
translated: He teaches the profound teachings because he knows the process of engagement and disengagement and he has the intention to escape from cyclic existence.

original: legs par brtags nas byed /
analyzed: legs par brtags nas byed /
translated: He acts after careful consideration.

original: spyod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bslab pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs shes pas gnas ma yin par mi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: spyod pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bslab pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs shes pas gnas ma yin par mi sbyor ba'o //
translated: He does not apply himself in inappropriate situations because he knows the characteristics of practice, the training, and the counteragents.

original: yang na dge ba'i phyogs nyams par byed pa'i tshig dang las la mi sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na dge ba'i phyogs nyams par byed pa'i tshig dang las la mi sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or else, they do not engage in speech or actions that undermine virtue.

original: sems can rnams ni phal cher nyes pa de dang de la spyod pa yin pa dang / dad pa dang / blo dang / rtog dpyod pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la spyod pa dang / zhe sdang la spyod pa dang / gti mug la spyod pa zhes de dang de ltar ston te /
analyzed: sems can rnams ni phal cher nyes pa de dang de la spyod pa yin pa dang / dad pa dang / blo dang / rtog dpyod pa yin pa'i phyir 'dod chags la spyod pa dang / zhe sdang la spyod pa dang / gti mug la spyod pa zhes de dang de ltar ston te /
translated: Sentient beings generally engage in this or that fault, and they engage in faith, intelligence, and investigation, so they are taught to be of this or that type, such as those who engage passion, those who engage aversion, and those who engage delusion.

original: dad pa la sogs pa la spyod pa yang gsum po 'di dag gi nang du 'dus pa yin te /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa la spyod pa yang gsum po 'di dag gi nang du 'dus pa yin te /
translated: Those who engage faith and so on are also included among these three types.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ni nyon mongs pa'i gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / dad pa dang / blo dang / rnam par rtog pa ni de'i rigs kyi skal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug ni nyon mongs pa'i gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang / dad pa dang / blo dang / rnam par rtog pa ni de'i rigs kyi skal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because passion, aversion, and delusion are the principal afflictions and those who engage faith, intelligence, and investigation possess the fortune of their type.

original: 'dod chags ni kun du sbyor ba'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni kun du sbyor ba'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: Passion is the nature of fetters.

original: de ni da lta byung ba'i don la tshul bzhin ma yin pas zhen pas na 'dod chags zhes bya la /
analyzed: de ni da lta byung ba'i don la tshul bzhin ma yin pas zhen pas na 'dod chags zhes bya la /
translated: It is called ‚Äúattachment‚Äù because it is an inappropriate adherence to an object that has arisen.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa can la don du gnyer ba'i sgo nas zhes pa ni sred ba zhes bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i nyon mongs pa can la don du gnyer ba'i sgo nas zhes pa ni sred ba zhes bya bar bshad do //
translated: It is called ‚Äúcraving‚Äù because it is an aspiration for a future afflicted object.

original: de'i bdag nyid can gyi gang zag ni dge bar 'gyur ba'i don la tshul bzhin sbyor bas na dad pa la spyod pa zhes bya'o ;
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can gyi gang zag ni dge bar 'gyur ba'i don la tshul bzhin sbyor bas na dad pa la spyod pa zhes bya'o ;
translated: The person who has that nature is called ‚Äúone who practices faith‚Äù because he is properly engaged in the object that is conducive to virtue.

original: / de bas na 'dod chags dang / sred pa dang / dad pa la spyod pa gcig tu rab tu skyes pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byar ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: / de bas na 'dod chags dang / sred pa dang / dad pa la spyod pa gcig tu rab tu skyes pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'byar ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir gcig pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, attachment, craving, and the practice of faith are called ‚Äúone‚Äù because they are produced in the same way and because they have the nature of being joined.

original: de bzhin du bral ba'i bdag nyid can ni zhe sdang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bral ba'i bdag nyid can ni zhe sdang ste /
translated: Similarly, aversion has the nature of separation.

original: de zhe sdang ba'i sgo nas 'bral bar 'gyur bas na zhe sdang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de zhe sdang ba'i sgo nas 'bral bar 'gyur bas na zhe sdang zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúaversion‚Äù because it is separation by way of aversion.

original: bdag la bstod pa'i sgo nas 'bral bar byed pas nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la bstod pa'i sgo nas 'bral bar byed pas nga rgyal zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called ‚Äúpride‚Äù because it is separation by way of self-praise.

original: de'i bdag nyid can gyi gang zag ni skye ba mang ba yin /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can gyi gang zag ni skye ba mang ba yin /
translated: The person who has this nature is one who has many rebirths.

original: khams gsum po dang bral bar byed pas na shes rab kyi sgo nas blo zhes bshad do //
analyzed: khams gsum po dang bral bar byed pas na shes rab kyi sgo nas blo zhes bshad do //
translated: Because it causes one to be free from the three realms, it is called ‚Äúmind‚Äù from the point of view of wisdom.

original: de bas na 'di dag kyang gcig pa nyid @27b yin no ;
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag kyang gcig pa nyid @27b yin no ;
translated: Therefore, these two are the same.

original: / de bzhin du rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid can ni gti mug ste /
analyzed: / de bzhin du rtog pa med pa'i bdag nyid can ni gti mug ste /
translated: Similarly, the nature of non-imagination is delusion.

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad du rtog pa med pas na rmongs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad du rtog pa med pas na rmongs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Since it is non-imagination in every way, it is called ‚Äúdelusion.‚Äù

original: log par rtog pas na lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: log par rtog pas na lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is a wrong imagination, it is called ‚Äúview.‚Äù

original: de'i bdag nyid can gyi gang zag ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pas 'jug pa yin du zin kyang rnam par rtog pa mang bar 'gyur zhing ma nges pa'i blo can yin te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid can gyi gang zag ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pas 'jug pa yin du zin kyang rnam par rtog pa mang bar 'gyur zhing ma nges pa'i blo can yin te /
translated: The person who has this nature, even though he engages in proper mental attention, has many imaginations and is of uncertain mind.

original: de bas na 'di dag kyang gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'di dag kyang gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, these two are the same.

original: yang na 'dod chags dang / sred pa dang / dad pa ni rtse zhing yon tan tshol la yongs su mi spong ba'i rang bzhin can yin pas 'dod pa la chags pa ni sred pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: yang na 'dod chags dang / sred pa dang / dad pa ni rtse zhing yon tan tshol la yongs su mi spong ba'i rang bzhin can yin pas 'dod pa la chags pa ni sred pa zhes bya la /
translated: Or else, attachment, craving, and faith have the nature of delighting in and seeking out qualities and not abandoning them.üîΩAttachment to sense objects is called craving.

original: dge ba dang dga' ba ni dad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba dang dga' ba ni dad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Delight in virtue is called faith.

original: 'dod chags dang srid pa'i yon tan tshol ba'i bdag nyid can ni 'dod chags dang / sred pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang srid pa'i yon tan tshol ba'i bdag nyid can ni 'dod chags dang / sred pa zhes bya la /
translated: Attachment and craving have the nature of seeking out the qualities of attachment and existence.

original: dge ba tshol ba'i bdag nyid can ni dad pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba tshol ba'i bdag nyid can ni dad pa yin no //
translated: Faith has the nature of seeking out virtue.

original: phan pa ma yin pa yongs su mi 'dor ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'dod chags dang sred pa yin la phan pa yongs su mi 'dor ba'i mtshan nyid ni dad pa yin te /
analyzed: phan pa ma yin pa yongs su mi 'dor ba'i mtshan nyid ni 'dod chags dang sred pa yin la phan pa yongs su mi 'dor ba'i mtshan nyid ni dad pa yin te /
translated: The characteristic of not abandoning what is harmful is attachment and craving. The characteristic of not abandoning what is beneficial is faith.

original: de ltar na 'di dag kyang gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di dag kyang gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, these are the same.

original: de las go bzlog pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal dang blo'i spyod pa rnams kyang cig pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de las go bzlog pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal dang blo'i spyod pa rnams kyang cig pa nyid yin te /
translated: The general characteristics of aversion, pride, and mental activity that are the opposite of those are the same.

original: brtse ba nyid dang / nyes pa tshol ba dang / yongs su 'dor ba'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal can gyi gang zag brtse ba med pa'i rang bzhin can yin la /
analyzed: brtse ba nyid dang / nyes pa tshol ba dang / yongs su 'dor ba'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal can gyi gang zag brtse ba med pa'i rang bzhin can yin la /
translated: Because of their nature of being compassion, seeking faults, and being totally rejecting, the persons who are hateful and proud are of the nature of being without compassion.

original: 'dus byas zhes pa ni blo yin no //
analyzed: 'dus byas zhes pa ni blo yin no //
translated: The mind is the one that is called ‚Äúcompounded.‚Äù

original: zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal ni gang zag nyes nga tshol ba'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal ni gang zag nyes nga tshol ba'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: Hatred and pride are the natures of the person who seeks faults.

original: blo ni 'dus byas kyi nyes pa tshol ba'i bdag nyid can no //
analyzed: blo ni 'dus byas kyi nyes pa tshol ba'i bdag nyid can no //
translated: The mind is the nature of the one who seeks the faults of the compounded.

original: zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal ni gang zag yongs su 'dor ba yin no //
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / nga rgyal ni gang zag yongs su 'dor ba yin no //
translated: Hatred and pride are the total rejection of the person.

original: blo ni 'dus byas yongs su 'dor ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: blo ni 'dus byas yongs su 'dor ba shes pa'o //
translated: The mind is the knowledge of the total rejection of the compounded.

original: de bas na mtshan nyid mtshan pas zhe sdang dang nga rgyal dang blo la spyod pa rnams ni mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mtshan nyid mtshan pas zhe sdang dang nga rgyal dang blo la spyod pa rnams ni mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, those who practice hatred, pride, and mind have the same characteristic.

original: de bzhin du gti mug dang / lta ba dang / rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa rnams ni mi brtan zhing rnam par g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir gti mug gi rnam par 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid can yin bas na mi brtan pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gti mug dang / lta ba dang / rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa rnams ni mi brtan zhing rnam par g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir gti mug gi rnam par 'gyur ba'i bdag nyid can yin bas na mi brtan pa yin la /
translated: Likewise, those who practice delusion, view, and discursive thought are unstable and have a nature of fluctuation, because delusion has a nature of transformation, it is unstable.

original: lta ba ni log pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir mi brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: lta ba ni log pa'i bdag nyid can yin pa'i phyir mi brtan pa yin no //
translated: View is unstable because it has a nature of error.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni rnam par rtog par bya ba'i dngos po mang bo la rgyugs pas na mi brtan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni rnam par rtog par bya ba'i dngos po mang bo la rgyugs pas na mi brtan pa yin no //
translated: Discursive thought is unstable because it runs to many things to be discursively thought.

original: @28a * // gti mug gi chos kyi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pas g-yo ba yin la /
analyzed: @28a * // gti mug gi chos kyi mtshan nyid ma rtogs pas g-yo ba yin la /
translated: It is unstable because it is unstable due to not understanding the characteristics of the phenomena of delusion.

original: lta ba ni log pa'i chos la rnam par g-yengs pas g-yo ba yin zhing rnam par rtog pa ni yang ba yin pas g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: lta ba ni log pa'i chos la rnam par g-yengs pas g-yo ba yin zhing rnam par rtog pa ni yang ba yin pas g-yo ba yin no //
translated: View is unstable because it is unstable due to being distracted by erroneous phenomena. Discursive thought is unstable because it is unstable due to being light.

original: des na mi brten zhing g-yo ba yin pa'i gti mug dang lta ba dang / rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa rnams spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: des na mi brten zhing g-yo ba yin pa'i gti mug dang lta ba dang / rnam par rtog pa la spyod pa rnams spyi'i mtshan nyid kyi gcig pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, delusion, view, and discursive thought, which are non-abiding and unstable, are the general characteristics of the one who engages in them.

original: 'di dag ni las kyis phan tshun du tha dad par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni las kyis phan tshun du tha dad par gyur pa yin te /
translated: They are different from each other due to their actions.

original: dge slong las kyi mtshan nyid kyis byis pa yin zhing las kyi mtshan nyid kyis mkhas pa yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: dge slong las kyi mtshan nyid kyis byis pa yin zhing las kyi mtshan nyid kyis mkhas pa yin no zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: As it is said, ‚ÄúThe monk is a fool due to the characteristics of his actions, and he is wise due to the characteristics of his actions.‚Äù

original: des na tshul de ltar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: des na tshul de ltar shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this should be understood in this way.üîΩFrom desire for going, looking, acting, speaking,

original: 'gro dang lta dang spyod dang smra ba dang // nyal dang zas dang gos gyon 'dod pa las //
analyzed: 'gro dang lta dang spyod dang smra ba dang // nyal dang zas dang gos gyon 'dod pa las //
translated: sleeping, eating, and wearing clothes,

original: 'jam dang rtsu ba dang kun nas g-yo ba'i mi //
analyzed: 'jam dang rtsu ba dang kun nas g-yo ba'i mi //
translated: a person who is gentle, harsh, or completely agitated

original: 'dod dang khro dang gti mug la spyod bshad //
analyzed: 'dod dang khro dang gti mug la spyod bshad //
translated: is said to engage in desire, anger, or delusion.

original: nyes pa'i rang bzhin rjes 'jug byed pa rnams //
analyzed: nyes pa'i rang bzhin rjes 'jug byed pa rnams //
translated: Those who follow the nature of faultsüîΩare, due to that,

original: 'di dang pha rol dag tu de'i dbang gis //
analyzed: 'di dang pha rol dag tu de'i dbang gis //
translated: in this life and the next,

original: spyod pa sna tshogs 'gyur bde yi phyir //
analyzed: spyod pa sna tshogs 'gyur bde yi phyir //
translated: under the power of various actions.

original: de las go bzlog tshul gyis 'di la sbyar //
analyzed: de las go bzlog tshul gyis 'di la sbyar //
translated: The opposite of this is to be applied here.

original: de lta sbyor ba dang ni mtshan nyid dang ldang bar bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs shes pas gnas pa ma yin pa la sbyor bar ma byed do //
analyzed: de lta sbyor ba dang ni mtshan nyid dang ldang bar bya ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs shes pas gnas pa ma yin pa la sbyor bar ma byed do //
translated: Thus, by knowing the counteragents to application, characteristics, and rising, one does not apply oneself to non-abiding.

original: gang gi phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnal 'byor spyod pa /
translated: Therefore, the spiritual practitioner

original: 'di nyid 'phel bar 'dod pas 'di lta bu'i bla ma la yang dag par brten te gnas par bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'di nyid 'phel bar 'dod pas 'di lta bu'i bla ma la yang dag par brten te gnas par bya ba'am /
translated: should rely upon and abide with a guru who is like this, if he wishes to increase this very [practice].

original: slob dpon nam mkhan po yon tan de lta bu dang mi ldan bar gyur na gang na yon tan de lta bu'i bla ma yod pa der 'gro bar bya'o //üîΩdam pa rang gi yon tan gyis //
analyzed: slob dpon nam mkhan po yon tan de lta bu dang mi ldan bar gyur na gang na yon tan de lta bu'i bla ma yod pa der 'gro bar bya'o // dam pa rang gi yon tan gyis //
translated: If the master or preceptor does not possess such qualities, one should go to where there is a guru with such qualities.üîΩThe excellent one is seen from afar

original: mtho ba ring po nas kyang snang //üîΩdri med sa phyogs mdzes pa yi //
analyzed: mtho ba ring po nas kyang snang // dri med sa phyogs mdzes pa yi //
translated: by his own qualities,üîΩjust as the autumn sky is seen

original: ston ka yi ni ring por mtshungs //
analyzed: ston ka yi ni ring por mtshungs //
translated: from afar by its stainless region.üîΩGoing there will result in many afflictions and obstacles,

original: der 'gro ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bar chad mang bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: der 'gro ba ni nyon mongs pa dang bar chad mang bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: To go there is to have many afflictions and obstacles.üîΩ

original: mi nus pa'am de lta bu dang ldan pa gang na yang yod bar thos par ma gyur na /
analyzed: mi nus pa'am de lta bu dang ldan pa gang na yang yod bar thos par ma gyur na /
translated: If you do not hear of anyone who is able to do this or who possesses such qualities,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba nyid slob dpon gyi mchog yin pa la brten par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba nyid slob dpon gyi mchog yin pa la brten par bya ste /
translated: then you should rely on the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathagata himself, which is the supreme teacher.

original: de'i dbang gis rang la phan pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te ;üîΩmdo sde las ji skad gsungs pa ston pa ni de skad gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis rang la phan pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te ; mdo sde las ji skad gsungs pa ston pa ni de skad gsungs pa yin la /
translated: Because by its power you will obtain benefit for yourself.üîΩThe phrase as it is taught means as it is taught in the sutras.

original: ji skad gsungs pa mdo sde las de skad ston pa yin te /
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa mdo sde las de skad ston pa yin te /
translated: The phrase as it is taught in the sutras means as it is taught in the sutras.

original: slob dpon yang rjes su ston pas 'di dag nyid rjes su ston pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob dpon yang rjes su ston pas 'di dag nyid rjes su ston pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The teacher is also a teacher because he teaches these very things.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: The Blessed One also said:üîΩIf you do not find a companion who is free from sin, who is wise,

original: gal te sdig bral shes rab @28b can lhan cig / spyod pa brtan pa'i legs gnas ma rnyed na //
analyzed: gal te sdig bral shes rab @28b can lhan cig / spyod pa brtan pa'i legs gnas ma rnyed na //
translated: who is well-established in good conduct,

original: rgyal po rnam rgyal grol khror spangs pa ltar //
analyzed: rgyal po rnam rgyal grol khror spangs pa ltar //
translated: then like King Vijayasimha,

original: dgon pa'i glang chen lta bur gcig pur spyod //
analyzed: dgon pa'i glang chen lta bur gcig pur spyod //
translated: wander alone like a solitary elephant in the forest.

original: ces gsungs pa dang / de yang rang sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa dang / de yang rang sangs rgyas kyis //
translated: The self-awakened one

original: dam pa shes rab can la yang dag brten //
analyzed: dam pa shes rab can la yang dag brten //
translated: should rely on the holy one who has wisdom.

original: grogs kyi phun tshogs rab tu bsngags yin gyi //
analyzed: grogs kyi phun tshogs rab tu bsngags yin gyi //
translated: The excellence of friends is highly praised.

original: gal te nyes med de ni ma rnyed na //
analyzed: gal te nyes med de ni ma rnyed na //
translated: But if you do not find such a faultless one,

original: bse ru lta bur gcig pur spyod par dya //üîΩzhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bse ru lta bur gcig pur spyod par dya // zhes ji skad bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: you should practice alone like a rhinoceros.

original: gcig pu gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba ji skad thos pa bag yod pa nyid du yang dag par sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig pu gnas pa ni ting nge 'dzin gyi bya ba ji skad thos pa bag yod pa nyid du yang dag par sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: As stated, living alone, you should practice with carefulness just as you have heard the activities of samƒÅdhi.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma'i nus pa la yid sbyar bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma'i nus pa la yid sbyar bar mi bya ste /
translated: You should not apply your mind to the power of the signs of samƒÅdhi,

original: de la brten pa'i sems ni legs pa phul du byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la brten pa'i sems ni legs pa phul du byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because the mind that relies on them will not become excellent and sublime.

original: de'i phyir phul du byung ba'i chos la nges par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phul du byung ba'i chos la nges par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, you should definitely apply yourself to the sublime Dharma.

original: dal 'byor gyi chos 'di ni lha'i bu'i 'gro ba'i snying po bas kyang shin tu mgyogs par 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: dal 'byor gyi chos 'di ni lha'i bu'i 'gro ba'i snying po bas kyang shin tu mgyogs par 'gro ba yin no //
translated: This Dharma of leisure and opportunity is swifter than even the essence of the god‚Äôs life.

original: de bas na yang dang yang du nyon mongs pa spong bar 'os pa'i kun du spyod pa dang / nus pa che ba zag pa zad pa'i rten du gyur pa'am /üîΩde ni lam gyi ting nge 'dzin gcig gi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de bas na yang dang yang du nyon mongs pa spong bar 'os pa'i kun du spyod pa dang / nus pa che ba zag pa zad pa'i rten du gyur pa'am / de ni lam gyi ting nge 'dzin gcig gi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Therefore, one should repeatedly practice the proper elimination of the afflictions, and the great power of the support for the exhaustion of the contaminants.

original: de las gzhan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan skyes pa dang // ma skyes pa'i nyes pa rnams zhi bar byed pa rnams kyang yid la bya'o ;üîΩ/'dod chags la spyod pa yin na yang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi nyon mongs pa rnams la kun du spyod par 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyu mtshan skyes pa dang // ma skyes pa'i nyes pa rnams zhi bar byed pa rnams kyang yid la bya'o ; /'dod chags la spyod pa yin na yang zhe sdang dang gti mug gi nyon mongs pa rnams la kun du spyod par 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: In this way, one should bring to mind the pacification of the faults that arise from the signs of concentration other than that, whether they have arisen or not.üîΩEven if one is practicing with passion, one may still be overcome by the afflictions of hatred and delusion.

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa la yang 'dod chags dang gti mug la sogs pa zil gyis gnon par 'gyur zhing gti mug la spyod pa rnams la yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa la yang 'dod chags dang gti mug la sogs pa zil gyis gnon par 'gyur zhing gti mug la spyod pa rnams la yang 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if one is practicing with hatred, one may still be overcome by passion and delusion. Even if one is practicing with delusion, one may still be overcome by passion and hatred.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gal te 'dod pa la 'dun pa skyes par gyur na mi sdug pa'i mtshan ma tshul bzhin du yid la gyis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa nges par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag gal te 'dod pa la 'dun pa skyes par gyur na mi sdug pa'i mtshan ma tshul bzhin du yid la gyis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa nges par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúMonks, if desire arises, properly bring to mind the signs of foulness.‚Äù

original: dge slong ma lhag pa'i sems la mngon par brtson pas gnas lnga yang dang yang du yid la bya zhing mtshan ma gsum pa yang dang yang du yid la bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma lhag pa'i sems la mngon par brtson pas gnas lnga yang dang yang du yid la bya zhing mtshan ma gsum pa yang dang yang du yid la bya'o //
translated: A nun who is striving to attain higher mental states should repeatedly bring to mind the five points and the three signs.

original: thams cad bag yod pa dang ldan par bya ste /
analyzed: thams cad bag yod pa dang ldan par bya ste /
translated: She should be heedful in all things.

original: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, her meditative absorption will be perfected.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bag yod pa'i rgyu dang / brtson 'grus kyi rgyu @29a * //
analyzed: bag yod pa'i rgyu dang / brtson 'grus kyi rgyu @29a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cause of heedfulness and the cause of effort

original: dang ; rtag tu bya ba'i rgyu dang / rjes su sbyor ba'i rgyu dang / yang dag par yid la byed pa'i rgyus de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la reg par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / sems kyi yang snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
analyzed: dang ; rtag tu bya ba'i rgyu dang / rjes su sbyor ba'i rgyu dang / yang dag par yid la byed pa'i rgyus de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la reg par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa dang / sems kyi yang snyoms par 'jug pa dang /
translated: and the cause of constant practice, the cause of subsequent application, and the cause of correct mental attention, one touches such a concentration.

original: rnam pa dang mtshan ma gang gis sems kyi nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ba de nyid yang dag par shes par bya'o //üîΩji skad du //

original: mnyam bar gzhag pa 'di ni dran pa la nye bar gnas pa rnams kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: mnyam bar gzhag pa 'di ni dran pa la nye bar gnas pa rnams kyi yin gyi /
translated: This meditative concentration is for those who are established in mindfulness.üîΩThis Dharma is not for those who are weak in mindfulness.

original: chos 'di ni dran pa nyams pa rnams kyi ma yin no zhes gsungs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin las g-yeng ba'i nyes dmigs rnam pa du mas shin tu bsam par bya zhing //

analyzed: snga ma bzhin du ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan mthong ba la 'bad par bya ste /

original: ji skad du /

original: dus su chos nyan pa la brten par bya'o //
analyzed: dus su chos nyan pa la brten par bya'o //
translated: One should rely on listening to the Dharma at the proper time.üîΩOne should frequently examine one's own mind, as explained.

original: rang gi sems la so sor brtag pa mang du bya'o zhes ji skad bshad pa dang / de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag rnam par dag pa dang ldan na yid gang la nye bar sbyar ba yang dag pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa de thogs ma med pa nyid du ting nge 'dzin dang rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i gter thob par 'gyur ro
analyzed: rang gi sems la so sor brtag pa mang du bya'o zhes ji skad bshad pa dang / de ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi yan lag rnam par dag pa dang ldan na yid gang la nye bar sbyar ba yang dag pa'i sbyor ba dang ldan pa de thogs ma med pa nyid du ting nge 'dzin dang rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa'i gter thob par 'gyur ro
translated: Thus, when endowed with the purity of the branches of samadhi, whatever mind one applies to the correct practice, one will attain the treasure of samadhi, supernormal powers, and so on from beginningless time.

original: // bag med nyes dang yan lag nyams pa ni //
analyzed: // bag med nyes dang yan lag nyams pa ni //
translated: The faults of carelessness and the degeneration of limbs

original: yan lag la ni 'bad pa nyid du gyur //
analyzed: yan lag la ni 'bad pa nyid du gyur //
